In to his chaumber / and fonde how þat he lay
Vp on his bedde / but man so sore grone
Ne herde I neuere and what þat was his mone
Ne wyste I nought for as I was comynge
Al sodeynly he lefte his compleynynge
¶ Of which I toke somwhat suspecion
And ner I come and fond he wepte soore
And god so wys be my sauacioun
As neuere of thynge had I no rowthe more
For neyther with engyn ne with no lore
Vnnethes myght I hym fro þe deth kepe
Þat ȝet fele I myn herte for hym wepe
¶ And god woot neuere sith þat I was borne
was I so bysi no man for to preche
Ne neuere was to wyght so depe sworne
Or he me told / who myghte ben his leche
But now to ȝow rehersen al his speche
Or al his woful wordes for to sowne
Ne byd me naught / but ȝe wol se me swone
¶ But for to saue his lyf and elles nought
And to no harme of ȝow þus am I dryuen
And for þe loue of god þat vs hath wroght
Swuche chere hym doth þat he and I may lyuen
Now haue I plat to ȝow myn herte screuyn
And sith ȝe woot þat myn entent is clene
Take hede þer-of for I non euel mene
¶ And right good thryft I pray to god haue ȝe
That han swich oon I-caught with-outen net
And be ȝe wys as ȝe ben fayr to se
wel in þe ringe than is the ruby set
Þer were neuere two so wele ymet
when ȝe ben his al hole as he is ȝoure
Þer myghty god graunt vs þat se þat houre
¶ Nay þer-of speke I nought ha a quod she
As helpe me god ȝe shenden euery dele
O mercy dere nece a-non quod he
what so I spake I mente nought but wele
By mars þe god þat helmed is of stele
Now beth nought wroth my blode my nece dere
Now wol I quod she forȝeuen be it here
¶ with þis he toke his leue and home he wente
And lord he was glad and wel bygon
Criseyde aros no longer she ne stente
But streght in to hire closet wente anon
And set hire down as stille as any stone
And euery word gon vp and down to wynde
Þat he had seyde as it come hire to mynde
¶ And was somdele astoned in hire thought
Right in þe new cas but when þat she
was ful auysed / tho fonde she right nought
Of peril / why she aught a-ferde be
For man may loue of possibilite
A womman so his hert may to-breste
And nought loue aȝeyn but if hire liste
¶ But as she sat allon and thought thus
Ascry aroos at scarmich alle with-oute
And men cried in þe strete se Troilus
Hath right now put to flyght þe grekes route
with þat gan al hire meyne for to shoute
A gow we se / caste vp the ȝates wyde
For thorwgh þis strete he moote to paleys ryde
¶ For oother way is to þe ȝate noon
Of dardanus þere open is þe cheyne
with þat come he and alle his folke anon
An hesy pace / rydynge in routes tweyne
Right as happy day was sothe to seyne
For wiche men seyne may nought distourbed be
That shal bytyden of necessite
¶ Thus Troilus sat on his bay steede
Alle armed saue his hed ful richly
And wonded was his hors / and gan to blede
On wiche he roode / a pase ful softely
But swiche a knyghtely sighte / trewly
as was on hym / was nought with-outen faile
To loke on mars / þat god is of batayle
¶ So like aman of armes / and a knyght
He was to sen / fulfild of heigh prowesse
For bothe he hadde a body / and a myght
To don þat thynge / as wele as hardynesse
And ek to sen hym / in his gere hym drisse
So fressh so ȝong / so weldy / semed he
It was an heuen / vp on hym for to se
¶ His helme to-hewen was / in twenty places
Þat by a tyssew henge / his bak by-hynde
His shelde to-dasshed was / with swerdes and maces
In which men myght / many a narwe fynde
Þat thyrled hadde horn / and nerf and rynde
And ay þe peple criede / here comyth oure Ioye
And nexte his broþer / holdere vp of Troye.
¶ For which he wex / a litel rede for schame
when he þe peple / vp on hym herd crien
Þat to by-holde / it was a noble game
How sobreliche / he caste down his eighen
Criseyda gan / al his chere aspyen
And leet so softe / it in hire herte synken
Þat to hire self / she seyde who ȝaf me drynken
¶ For of hire owene thought she wex al rede
Remembrynge hire right þus / lo þis is he
wich [? MS. with] þat myn vncle swerth he moot be dede
But I on hym haue mercy and pite
And with þat thought for pure ashamed she
Gan in hire hed to pulle and þat as faste
while he and alle þe peple forby paste
¶ And gan to caste and rollen vp and down
with-in hire thought his excellent prowesse
And his estat / and also his renoun
His wit his shappe and ek his gentilnesse
But moost hire favour was for his destresse
was al for hire and thought it as a rowrhte
To slane swich oon If þat he mente trouthe
¶ Now myghte som enuyous Iangle thus
Þis was a sodeyn loue how myghte it be
Þat she so ligh[t]ly loues Troylus
Right for þe firste sight ȝe parde
Now who seith so mote he neuere ythe
For euery thynge a gynnyng hath it nede
Er alle be wrought with-outen any drede
¶ For I sey nought þat she so sodeynly
Ȝaf hym hire loue but þat she gan enclyne
To like hym firste and I haue tald ȝow why
And efter þat his manhod and his pyne
Made loue with-Inne hire for to myne
For which by proces and by goode ceruyse
He gaf hire loue and in no sodeyn wyse
¶ And also blisful Venus wel arayed
Sat in hire seuenthe hous of heuene tho [two altered late]
Disposed wel and with appectes payed
To helpen sely Troilus of his wo
A soth to seyn she nas nat al a fo
To Troilus in his Natiuitee
God woot þat wele þe sonner spedde he
¶ Now lat vs stynte of Troilus a throwe
Þat rideth forth and lat vs torne faste
Vn to criseyde / þat henge hire hed ful lawe
Þer as she sat allone / and gan to caste
wher-on she wold a-poynte hire at þe laste
If it so were hire Em ne wold cesse
For Troilus vp on hire for to presse
¶ And lord so sche gan in hire thought argwe
In þis matere of which I haue ȝow tolde
And what to done best were and what eschuwe
Þat plyted she ful ofte in many folde
Now was hire hert warm now was it colde
And what she thought som what schal I wryte
As to myn auctour listeth for tendite.
¶ She thought wel þat Troilus persone
She knewe by sight and ek his gentilnesse
And þus she seyd al were it not to done
To graunt hym loue ȝet for his worthinesse
It were honor with pleye and with gladnesse
In honeste with swich a lord to dele
For myn estat / and also for his hele
¶ Ek wel wot I my kynges sonne is he
And sith he hath to se me swich delite
If I wold outreliche his sighte flee
Paraunter he myght haue me in dispite
Thorwgh which I myght stond in worse plite
No were I wis me hate to purchace
with-outen nede ther I may stonde in grace
¶ In euery thynge I wote þer lith mesure
For though aman forbede dronkennesse
He naught forbet þat euery creature
Be drenkynlees for alway as I gesse
Ek sith I wote for me is his destresse
I ne aught nat for þat thyng hym dispice
Sith it is so he meneth in goode wyse
¶ And ek I knowe of longe tyme agon
His thewes goode and þat he is nat nyce
Navauntour seith men certein is he noon
To wys is he to don so grete a vyce
Ne als I nyl hym neuere so cherice
Þat he may mak auaunte by Iuste cause
He shal me neuere bynde in swich a clause
¶ Now set a caas the hardeste is I-wys
Men myghten demen that he loueth me
What dishonour were it vnto me this
May Ich hym lett of þat why nay pardee
I knowe also and alway here and see
Men louen wommen al by-syde hire leue
And when hem liste namore lat hym bileue
¶ I thenk ek how he able is for to haue
Of al þis ilke noble town the thriftyeste
To ben his loue / so she hire honour saue
For oute and oute he is þe worthyeste
Saue oonly Ector which þat is þe beste
And ȝit his lyf alle lith now in my cure
But swich is loue and ek myn auenture
¶ Ne me to loue a wonder is it nought
For wele wote I my self so god me spede
Al wold I that noon wyste of þis thoughte
I am oon þe fayreste out of drede
And goodelyeste who so taketh hede
And so men seyn in al þe town of Troye
what wonder is it though he of me haue Ioye
¶ I am myn owene womman wele at ese
I thanke it god as efter myn estat
Right ȝong / and stonde vnteyd in lusty leese
with-outen Ialousie or swich debat
Shal noon housebonde seyn to me chek mat
For eyther þei ben ful of Ialousie
Or maysterful / or louen nouelrye
¶ what shal I don to what fyn lyue I thus
Shal I nat loue in cas If þat me liste
what pardieux I am nought religiouse
And though þat I myn herte sette at reste
Vp on þis knyght þat is þe worthyeste
And kepe alway myn honour and my name
By al right it may do me no chame
¶ But right as when þe sonne shyneth brighte
In march þat chaungeth oft tyme his face
And þat a cloude is put with wynde to flyght
Which ouersprat þe sonne as for a space
A cloudy thought gan thorugh hire soule pace
Þat ouerspradde hire brighte thoughtes alle
So þat for feere al-moost she gan to falle
¶ That thought was þis allas syn [I] am free
Shold I now loue and putte in Iupartye
My sikernesse and thrallen libertye
Allas how dorste I thenken that folye
May [I] nough wel in other folk aspye
Hire dredful Ioye / hire constreynte and hire peyne
Þer loueth noon þat she nath way to pleyne
¶ For loue is ȝet þe moost stormy lyf
Right of hym self þat euere was by-gonne
For euere som mystruste or nyce stryfe
Þer is in loue som cloude is ouere þat sonne
Þer-to we wreched wommen no thynge konne
when vs is wo / but wepe and sitte and thynke
Oure wreche is þis oure owen wo to drynke
¶ Also thise wikkede tonges ben so preste
To speke vs harme / ek men so vntrewe
Þat right anon as cessed is hire leste
So ceseth loue / and forth to loue a newe
But harm I-don is don who so it rewe
For though þis men for love hem firste to-rende
Ful charpe bygynnynge breketh oft at ende
¶ How oft tyme hath it y-knowen be
Þe treson þat to wommen hath ben do
To what fyn is swich loue I kan nat se
Or wher bicometh it when þat it is ago
There is no wyght þat woot I trow so
wher it bicometh lo no wight on it sporneth
Þat arst was no thynge in to nought it torneth
¶ How bisy If I loue ek most I be
To plesen hem þat Iangle of loue and dremen
And coye hym they seye noon harme of me
For though þer be no cause ȝet hem semen
alle be for harme þat folk hire frendes quemen
And who may stoppen euery wykked tonge
Or sown of belles while þat þei ben ronge
¶ And efter þat hire though[t] gan for to clere
and seyde / he which nat no thynge vndertaketh
No thynge nacheueth / be hym loth or deere
And with another thought hire hert qwaketh
Than slepeth hope / and after drede awaketh
Now hoot / now cold / but þus bytwixen tweye
Þo rist hire vp / and hire fer to pleye
¶ Adown þe steyre anon right tho she wente
In to þe gardyn with hire neces thre
And vp and down ther made many a wente
Flexippe she tharbe and antigone
To pleyn þat it Ioye was to se
And other of hire wommen a grete route
Hire folweden in þe gardyn alle aboute
¶ Þis ȝerde was large and rayled alle thaleyes
And shadwed wel with blosmy bowes grene
And benched new and sonded alle þe wayes
In whiche she walketh arm in arm betwene
Til at þe laste antigone the shene
Gan on a Troian songe to syngen clere
Þat it an heuene was hire vois to here

LG.HEAD: (119) (Antigone's Song of Love. St. 1.)
LG.L: ¶ She seyde o loue to whom I haue and shal
Ben humble subgit trewe in myn entente
As I best kan / to whom lord ȝeue Ich al
For euere mo myn hertes lust to rente
For neuere ȝet thi grace no wight sente
So blisful cause / as me my lyf to lede
In alle Ioye and seurte oute of drede

LG.HEAD: (120) (Antigone's Song of Love. St. 2.)
LG.L: ¶ Þe blisful god han me so wele besette
In love I-wis / þat alle þat bereth lyf
Ymagynen ne koude how to ben bett
For lord with-owten Ialousye or stryf
I loue oon which þat moost is ententif
To seruen wel vnwery or vnfeyned
Þat euere was / and leest with harme destreyned
¶ As he þat is þe wel of worthynesse
Of trowthe ground / myrour of goodelyhede
Of wit appollo / stoon of secrenesse
Of vertue roota / of lust fynder and hed
Thorugh [which] is alle sorwe fro me ded
I-wis I loue hym best so doth he me
Now goode thryft haue he wher so þat he be
¶ whom shold I thanken but ȝow god of loue
Of alle þis blisse in which to bathe I gynne
And thanked be ȝe lord for þat I loue
Þis is þe right lyf that I am Inne
To flemen alle manere vyce and synne
This doth me so to vertue for tentende
Þat day by day I in my wyl amende
¶ And who so seith that for to loue is vice
Or thraldom / though he fele in it destresse
He outher is enuyous or right nyce
Or is vnmyghty for his sherewednesse
To louen / for swich maner folk I gesse
Defamen loue as no thynge of it knowe
They speken / but þey benten neuere is bowe

LG.HEAD: (124) (Antigone's Song of Love. St. 6.)
LG.L: ¶ what is þe sonne wors of kynde righte
Though þat aman for fieblenesse of his eigheu
May nought endure on it to se for bryghte
Or loue þe wors theigh wreches on it crien
No wele is worth þat may no sorwe dryen
And for-thy who þat hath han hed of verre
Fro caste of stonnes war hym in þe werre
¶ But I with al myn herte and alle my myght
As I haue seyd wol loue vn to my laste
My dere herte alle myn owen knyght
In whiche myn herte growen is so faste
And his in me þat it schal euere laste
Alle dredde I firste to loue hym to bigynne
Now wote I wel þer is no peril Inne
¶ And of hire song right with þat worde she stente
And þer-with-alle now nece quod Criseyde
who made þis songe now with so goode entente
Antigone answerde anoon and seyde
Madam I-wis the goodelyest mayde
Of grete estate in al þe town of Troye
And let hire lyf in moost honour and Ioye
¶ For sothe so it semeth by hire songe
Quod tho Criseyde and gan þer-with to syke
And seyde lord is þer swich blisse amonge
Thise louers as they donnen fayre endite
Ȝe yis quod fresshe antigone the white
For al þe folk þat han or ben on lyue
Ne konne wel þe blisse of loue descryue
¶ But wene ȝe þat euery wreche woot
The parfit blisse of loue why nay I-wys
They wonen al be loue If oon be hote
Do way do way they wote no thyng of þis
Men moste axe at seintes if it is
Aught fayre in heuen why fer they kan telle
And axen fendes is it foule in helle
¶ Criseyde vnto that purpos nought answer[d]e
But seyde I-wis it wol be nyght as faste
But euery word with þat she of hire herde
She gan to prenten in [hire] herte faste
And ay gan loue lesse hire for tagaste
than it dyde erst and synken in hire herte
Þat she wax somwhat able to conuerte
¶ The dayes honour and þe heuenes heye
The nyghtes foo / al þis clepe I þe sonne
Gan westren faste and downward for to wrye
As he þat hadde his dayes cours yronne
And white thynges wexen dymme and donne
For lakke of lyght and sterres for tapere
Þat she and al hire folk in wente yfere
¶ So when it liked hire to go to reste
And voyded weren they þat voyden aughte
She seyde þat to slepen wel hire leste
Hire wommen soon tyl hire bed hire broughte
when al was hust þan lay she stil and thoughte
Of al þis thynge þe manere and þe wyse
Reherce it nedeth nought for ȝe ben wyse
¶ A nyghtyngale vp on a cedre grene
Vnder þe chaumber wal þer as she lay
Ful lowde songe aȝein þe moone shene
Paraunter in his briddes wyse a lay
Of loue / þat made hire herte fresshe and gay
Þat herkned she so longe in goode entente
Tyl at þe laste þe dede slepe hire hente
¶ And as she slepe anoon right þo hire mette
How þat an Egle fethered white as bone
Vnder hire breste his longe clewes sette
And out hire herte he rent and þat anon
And dide his hert in to hire breste to gon
Of whiche she naught agroos ne no thyng smerte
And forth he fleigh with herte left for herte
¶ Now lat hire slepe and we oure tales holde
Of Troilus / þat is to palays ryden
Fro þe scarmich of þe whiche I tolde
And in his chaumber sit and hath abyden
Til two or thre of his messages ȝeden
Fro Pandarus / and soughten hym ful faste
Til they hym fonde and broughte hym at þe laste
¶ This Pandarus come lepynge In stones
And seyde þus / who hath ben wel bette
To day / with swerdes and wiþ sleynge stones
But Troilus þat hath kaughte hym an hete
And gan to Iape / and seyde lorde so ȝe swete
But ris and lat vs soupe and go to reste
And answerde hym do we as the leste
¶ with alle þe haste goodely þat they myghte
They spede hem fro þe soper vnto bedde
And euery wyght oute at þe dore hym dyght
And wher hym leste vp on his way he spedde
But Troilus thought his herte bledde
For wo / til þat he herde som tydynge
He seyde frende shal I now wepe or synge
¶ Quod Pandarus li stil and lat me slepe
And don þin hode / thy nedes spedde be
And chese if þow wilte synge or daunce or lepe
At shorte wordes thow shal trow me
Sir my nece wol do wel by the
And loue þe beste by god and by my trouthe
But lokke of Pursuyte mak it in þi slouthe
¶ For þus ferforth I haue thy worke bigonne
Fro day to day til þis day by the morwe
Hire loue of frenship haue I to þe wonne
And also hath she layd hire faith to borwe
Algate a foot is hameled of þi sorwe
What shold I lenger sermon of it holde
As ȝe han herd bifore / al he hym tolde
¶ But right as floures thorugh þe cold of nyght
Y-closed stowpen on her stalk lowe
Redressen hem aȝein þe sonne bright
And spreden on hire kynde cours by rowe
Right so gan tho his eighen vp to throwe
This troilus / and seyde o venus dere
Þi might þi grace y-heried be it here
¶ And to pandarus held vp both his hondes
And seyde lord al þin be that I haue
For I am hole and brosten ben my bondes
A thousand Troians who-so þat me ȝaue
Ech efter other god so wys me saue
Ne myghte me so gladen lo myn herte
It spredeth so for Ioie it wol to-sterte
¶ But lord how shal I don how shal I lyuen
when shal I next my deere hert see
How shal þis longe tyme away be dryuen
Til þat thow be aȝein at hire fro me
Thow maist answere abid abid but he
Þat hanght by þe nekke soth to seyne
In grete disese abideth for þe peyne
¶ Al esily now for þe loue of marte
Quod Pandarus / for euery thynge hath tyme
So longe abid til þat þe nyght departe
For also siker as thow list here bi me
And god to-forne I wol be thare at pryme
And for þi werk som-what as I shal seye
Or on som other wight þis charge leye
¶ For parde god wote I haue euere ȝit
Ben redy þe to serue and to þis nyght
Haue naught feyned / but emforth my wit
Don al þi luste / and shal with alle my myght
Do now as [I] shal seyne and fare arighte
And if thow nylt wyte al þi self þi care
On me is nought a-longe þin yuel fare
¶ I woote wel þat thow wyser art than I.
A thowsand fold / but if I were as thow
God helpe me so as I wolde outrely
Of myn own honde write hire right now
A lettre / In which I wolde hire tellen how
I ferd amys / and hire biseche of routhe
Now helpe þi self and leue it nought for slouthe
¶ And I my self wol ther-with to hire gone
And when thow woste þat I am with hire there
worth thow vp on a coursur right a-noon
Ȝe hardily right in þi beste gere
And ride forth by þe place as nought it were
And thow shal fynde vs if I may sittynge
At som wyndow in to þe strete lokynge
¶ And if þe leste þan maistow vs salue
And vp on me make thow thy contennaunce
But by thi lif be war and faste eschue
To tarien ought god schilde vs fro mischaunce
Ride forth thy way and hold þy gouernaunce
And we shal speke of the som what I trowe
when thow art gon / to don thyn eris glowe
¶ Touchynge þi lettre thow ert wys ynough
I wot thow nylt it digneliche endite
As make it with thyse argumentus tough
Ne [MS. str, &c] scryuenyssh or craftily thow it write
Byblotte it with þi teris ek a lite
And if þow write a goodely worde al softe
Though it be goode reherce it nought to ofte
¶ For though þe best ha[r]ppour vp-on lyue
wold on þe beste sowned Ioly hare
That euere was with alle his fyngeres fyue
Touche ay o strenge or ay o warbul ha[r]ppe
were his nayles poyntes neuere so charpe
I shold maken euery wyght to dulle
To here his glee and of his strokes fulle
¶ Ne Iompre ek ne discordant thyng yfere
As thus to vsen termes of fisyk
In loues termes / hold of thy matere
The forme alway / and do þat it be like
For if a peyntour wold peynte a pik
with asses feet and hedde it as an ape
It cordeth naught / so nere it put a Iape
¶ This conseil lyked wel vn to Troilus
But as a dredful louere he seyde this
Allas my dere brother Pandarus
I am aschamed for to wryte I-wis
Leste of myn Innocence I seyde amys
Or þat she nolde it for despit receyue
Than were I ded ther myght it no thyng weyue
¶ To that Pandare answerde If þe leste
Do þat I seye and lat me ther-with gon
For by that lord þat formed est and weste
I hope of if to brynge ansewere anoon
Of hire honde / and if that thow nylt noon
Lat be / and sory mote he ben his lyue
Aȝeyn thi lust þat helpeth þe to thriue
¶ Quod Troilus depardieux ich assente
Sith þat þe lest I wil a-rise and wryte
And blisful and pray ich with goode entente
Þe vyage and þe letre I shal endite
So spede it / and thow Mynerua the whyte
Ȝif thow me wit my letre to deuyse
And sette hym down and wrot right in þis wyse

LG.HEAD: (153) (Troilus's Letter.)
LG.L: ¶ First he gan hire his right lady calle
His hertes lif his lust his sorwes leche
His blisse / and ek thise other termes alle
Þat in swich cas þis louers alle seche
And in ful humble wyse as in his speche
He gan hym recomaunde vn-to hire grace
To telle alle how it axeth muchel space
¶ And efter þis ful lowely he hire preyde
To be nought wroth / theigh he of his folye
So hardy was to hire to write and seyde
Þat loue it made or elles moost he dye
And pitously gan mercy for to crye
And efter he seyde and leigh ful lowde
Hym self was litel worth and lesse he koudo
¶ And at she shold han his konnynge excused
Þat litel was and ek he dradde hire so
And his vnworthynesse he ay acused
And after þat þan gan he telle his wo
But þat was endeles with-outen hoo
And seyde he wolde in throuth al-way hym holde
And radde it ouer and gan þe letre folde
¶ And with hise salt teris gan he bathe
the ruby in his signet and it sette
Vp-on þe wex deliuerliche and rathe
Ther-with a thousand tymes er he [first, Ire]
He kiste tho the letre that he shette
And seyd letre a blisful destyne
The shapen is my lady shal þe se
¶ This Pandare tooke þe letre and þat by tyme
a-morwe / and to his neces paleys sterte
And faste he swore þat it was passed prime
And faste he swore þat it was passed prime
And gan to Ioye / and seyde y-wys myn herte
So fresshe it is alle though it soore smerte
I may naught slepe neuere a mayes morwe
I haue a Ioly wo a lusty sorwe.
¶ Creseyde when þat she hire vncle herde
with dredeful herte and desirous to here
Þe cause of his comynge thus answerde
Now by ȝoure fey myn vncle quod she dere
What maner wyndes gideth ȝow now here
Tel us ioure Ioly wo and Ioure penaunce
How fer forth be ȝe put in loues daunce
¶ By god quod [he] I hoppe alway by-hynde
And she to laugh it thoughte hire herte breste
Quod Pandarus looke alwey ȝe fynde
Game in myn hood but herkenet if ȝow leste
Ther is right now come in to towne a gest
A greke aspie and telleth newe thynges
For wich I come telle ȝow new tydynges
¶ In to þe gardyn go we and ȝe shal here
Al pryuely of þis a longe sermon
With þat þei wenten arm in arm yfere
In to þe gardyn from þe chaumbre doun
And when þat he so fer was þat þe soun
Of þat he spake no man heren myghte
He seyd hire thus and out þe letre plyghte
¶ Lo he þat is al holly ȝoures free
Hym recomaundeth lowly to ȝoure grace
And sent ȝow þis letre hire by me
Avyseth ȝow on it when ȝe han sp[a]ce
And of som goodely answere ȝow purchace
Or helpe me god so pleynly for to seyne
He may not lange lyuen for his peyne
¶ Ful dredfully tho gan she stonde stylle
And toke it nough[t] but al hire humble chere
Gan for to chaunge and seyde scrit ne bille
For loue of god þat toucheth swiche mat[e]re
Ne brynge me noon / and also vncle dere
To myn estat haue more rewarde I preye
Þan to hise lust what shold I more seye
¶ And looketh now if þis be resonable
and lette[t]h nought for fauour ne for slouthe
To seyne a sothe now were it couenable
To myn estat by god and by ȝoure trouthe
To taken it or to han of hym routhe
In harmynge of my self or in reproue
Ber it aȝeyn for hym þat ȝe on leue
¶ This Pandarus gan on hire for to stare
And seyde now is this grettest wonder
That euere I seygh lat be þis nyce fare
To deth mote I smyten be with thonder
If for þe Cite which stondeth ȝonder
walde I a letre vn-to ȝow brynge or take
To harm of ȝow what list ȝow þus it make
¶ But þus ȝe faren wel neigh al and some
Þat he þat moste desireth ȝow to serue
Of hym ȝe reche leest wher he bycome
And whether þat he lyue or elles sterue
But for al þat þat euere I may deserue
Refuse it naughte quod he and hynte hire faste
And in hire bosom þe letre doun he thraste
¶ And seyde hire now caste a-wey a-noon
Þat folke may seyne and gauren on vs tweye
Quod she I kan abide til they be gone
And gan to smyle and seyde hym Em I preye
Swiche answer as ȝow list ȝoure self purueye
For trewely I nyl no letre wryte
No than wol. .I quod he so ȝe endite
¶ Ther-with she lough and seyde go we dyne
And he gan at hym self to Iape faste
and seyde nece I haue so grete a pyne
For loue þat euere-ich other day I faste
And gan his best Iapes forth to caste
And made hire so to laughe at his folye
Þat she for laughtere wende for to deye
¶ And whan þat she was comen in to halle
Now Em quod she we wol go dyne a-non
And gan some of hire wommen to hire calle
And streght in-to hire chaumber gan she gon
But of hire besynesse þis was oon
Amonge other þynges out of drede
Ful pryuely this letre for to rede
¶ Auysed word by word in euery lyne
And fonde no lakke she thoughte he koude goode
And vp it putte and wente hire in to dyne
But Pandarus that in a stodye stode
Er he was war she toke by þe hoode
And seyde ȝe war caughte er þat ȝe wiste
I vouche sauf quod he do what ȝow liste
¶ Tho wesshen they and sette hem doun and ete
And after noon ful sleighly Pandarus
Gan drawe hym to þe wyndow next þe strete
And seyde nece who hath arrayed thus
The ȝonder house þat stant a-forȝeynes vs
which house quod she / and gan for to byholde
And knewe it wele and whas it was hym tolde
¶ And fillen forthe in speche of thynges smale
And seten in þe wyndowe bothe tweye
When Pandarus saugh tyme vnto his tale
And saugh wel þat hire folk weren al aweye
Now nece myne tel on quod he I seye
How liketh ȝow þe letre that ȝe woote
Kan he þer-on for by my trouthe I noot /
¶ Ther-with al rosy hewed tho wex she
And gan to homme and seid so I trowe
A-quyte hym wel for goddes loue quod he
My self to medes wol þe letre sowe
And helde his hondes vp and satt on knowe
Now gode nece be it neuer so lite
Ȝif me þe labour it to sow and plyte
¶ Ȝe for I kan so wryten quod she tho
And ek I noot what I shold to hym seye
Nay nece quod pandare sey not so
Ȝett at þe leest thonketh hym I preye
Of his goode wil / and doth hym not to dye
Now for þe loue of me my nece dere
Refuseth nat at þis tyme my preyere
¶ Depar-dieux quod she god leue al be wele
God helpe me so this is þe firste lettre
Þat euer I wrote ȝe al or any dele
and in-to a closett for tauyse hire bettre
She wente allone and gan her herte vnfettre
Out of desdayns prison but a lite
And sette hire doun and gan a letre write
¶ Of which to telle in shorte is myn entent
Theffect as fer as I kan vnderstonde
She thankes hym of al þat he wel mente
Towardes hire / but holden hym in honde
She nolde nought ne make hire selfen bonde
In loue / but as his sister hym to plese
She wold fayne to don his herte an ese
¶ Sche shette it and in to Pandare gan gone
Ther as he satte and loked in to þe strete
And doun she sette hire by hym on a stone
Of Iapery / vp on a quysshen gold y-bette
And seyde as wysly help me god the grete
I neuere dide a thynge with more peyne
Than writyn this / to whiche ȝe me constreyne
And toke it hym / he thanked hire and seyde
God woot of thynge ful often loth by-gonne
Comth ende goode and nece myn Creseyde
That ȝe to hym of harde now ben ywonne
Ought he be gladde / by god and ȝonder sonne
For why men seith impressyons lighte
Ful lightely ben ay redy to þe flyghte
¶ But ȝe han pleyed tiraunt neigh to longe
And harde was it ȝoure herte for to graue
Now stynte þat ȝe no longer on it honge
Al walde ȝe þe fourme of daunger saue
But hasteth ȝow to don hym Ioye haue
For trusteht wel to longe ydon hardnesse
Causeth despite ful often for destresse
¶ And right as they declamed þis matere
Lo Troylus right at þe stretes ende
Com ridynge with his tenthe sonne yfeere
Al softely and thiderward gan bende
Þer as þei sete as was his wey to wende
To payleysseward / and Pandarus hym aspiede
and seyde nece I-see who comth here ryde
¶ O fle nought In he seth vs I suppose
Lest he may thynken þat ȝe hym eschewe
Nay quod she and wex as rede as rose
with þat he gan hire humbly to salwe
with dredeful chere and oft his hewes muwe
And up his look debonairly he caste
And bekked on Pandare and forth he paste
¶ God woot If he satt on his hors aright
Or goodely was by-seyn that ilke day
God woot wher he was like a manly knyghte
what shold I dretche or telle of his array
Criseyde whiche þat al þis thynges sey
To telle in short hire liked alle y-feere
His persone his array his look his chere
¶ His goodely manere and his gentilesse
So wel þat neuere sith þat she was borne
Ne hadde she swiche routhe of his distresse
And how so sche harde ben here biforne
To god hope I she hath nowe caught a thorne
She shal nought pul it out this next weke
God send mo swich thornes on to pyke
¶ Pandare which þat stood hire fast by
Felt Iren hoot and he bigan to smyte
And seyde nece I preye ȝow hertly
Telle me þat I shal axen ȝow a lyte
a womman þat were of his deth to wyte
with-outen his gylte but for hire lakked routhe
were it wele don quod she nay by my trouthe
¶ God help me so quod he ȝe say me soth
Ȝe felen wele ȝoure self þat I naught lye
loo ȝonde he ride quod she ȝe so he doth
wele quod Pandare as I haue tolde ȝow thrye
Lat be ȝoure nyce shame and ȝoure folye
And spek with hym in esynge of his herte
Lat nycete nat do bathe ȝow smerte
¶ But þer-on was to heuen and to doone
Considered al thynge it may nat be
And why for shame and it were eke to soene
To graunten hym so grete a liberte
For pleynly hire entente as seyde she
was for to loue hym vnwyste if she myghte
and guerdon hym with no thynge but with sighte
¶ But Pandarus thought it shal nough[t] be so
Ȝif þat I may this nyce opinyon
Schal nought be holden fully ȝeres tweye
what shold I mak of þis a longe sermone
He most assente on þat conclusioun
As for þe tyme / and when þat it was euen
And alle was wele he roos and toke his leue
¶ And on his wey ful fast homwarde he spedde
And right for Ioye he felt his herte daunce
And Troilus he fond allone a-bedde
Þat lay as dose þis louers in a traunce
Bytwyxen hope and derke desesperaunce
But Pandarus right at hys in comynge
He song as who seith somwhat I brynge
¶ And seyde who is in his bed so soone
I-buryed thus it am I frende quod he
who Troilus nay help me so þe moone
Quod Pandarus thow shalt arise and se
a charme / þat was sent right now to þe
Þe whiche kan helen þe of thyn accesse
If þow do forth with al þi besynesse
¶ Ye thought þe myght of god quod Troilus
And Pandarus gan hym þe letre take
And seyde pardee god hath holpen vs
Haue here a light and loke on alle þe blake
But oft gan the herte glade and qwake
Of Troilus / whil þat he gan it rede
So as þe wordes ȝaue hym hope or drede
¶ But finaly he toke al for þe beste
Þat she hym wroot for somwhat he bihelde
On which hym thought he myght his herte reste
Al couered she þe wordes vnder shelde
Þus to þe more worthy part he helde
Þat what for hope and Pandarus biheste
His grete wo for-ȝede he at þe leeste
¶ But as we may alday oure seluen see
Thorw mor wode or cole more fire
Right so encrees of hope of what it be
Þer-with ful ofte encreesseth ek desire
Or as an ook comth of a litel spire
So thorwgh þis letre which þat she hym sente
Encressen gan desir of which he brente
¶ wher-for I seye alwey þat day and nyghte
Þis Troilus gan to desir moore
Þan he dide arst thorugh hope and his myghte
To pressen on as by Pandarus lore
And wryten to hire of his sorwes soore
Fro day to day he leet it nought refreyde
Þat by Pandare he wroot somwhat or seyde
¶ And dide also his other obseruaunce
Þat tille a louer longeth in þis cas
And efter þat thise dees torned on chaunce
So was he outher glad or seyde allas
And helde efter his gestes ay his pas
As eftir swich answere as he hadde
So were his dayes sory outher gladde
¶ But to Pandare alwey was his recours
And pitously gan ay til hym to pleyne
And hym bisoughte of rede and som socours
And Pandarus þat sey his woode peyne
wex wel neigh dede for routhe soth to seyne
And bisily with al his herte caste
Som of his wo to slen and þat as faste
¶ And seyd lorde and frende and brother dere
God woot þat þi disese doth me wo
But wiltow stynten al þis woful chere
And by my trouthe er it be dayes two
And god to-forn ȝet shal I shape it so
Þat þow schalt come in to a certeyn place
Þer as þow maist þi selft hire preye of grace
¶ And certeynly I noot If thow it woste
But þo þat ben expert in loue it seye
It is oon of þe thynges forthreth moste
A man to have a leyser for to preye
And syker place his wo for to by-wreye
For in good hert it moot som routhe impresse
To here and se the giltelees in distresse
¶ Paraunter thynkestow though it be so
Þat kynde wolde don hire to begynne
To han a maner routh vp-on my wo
Seith daunger nay thow shalt me neuere wynne
So reuleth hire hire hertes goost wiþ-Inne
Þat though she bende ȝet she stant on roote
what in effect is þis vn-to my boote
¶ Thenk here aȝenis when that the stordy ooke
On which men hakketh oft[e] for the nones
Receyued hath the happy fallynge stroke
The grete swough doth it to come al at ones
As don þise rokkes or thise mylne stones
For swifter coures cometh thynge þat is of wyghte
when it descendeth than don thynges lyghte
¶ And ried that boweth dowen for euery blaste
Ful lightly cesse wynde it wil a-rise
But so nyl nought an ook when it is cast
It nedeth me nought þe longe to forbise
Men shal reioysen of a grete empryse
A-cheued wel and stant with-outen doute
Al han men ben þe longer ther aboute
¶ But Troilus þat tel me if þe lest
A thynge now which þat I shal axen þe
whiche is þi brother þat thow louest best
as in þi verray hertes pryuyte
I-wis my brother deiphebus quod he
Now quod Pandare er houres twies twelue
He shal þe ese vnwyst of it hym selue
¶ Now lat malone and werken as I may
Quod he / and to deiphebus wente he tho
Which hadde his lord and grete frend ben ay
Saue Troilus / no man he loued so
To tel in shorte wit-outen wordes mo
Quod Pandarus I preye ȝow þat ȝe be
Frende to a cause which þat toucheth me
¶ Ȝis parde quod deiphebus wel thow woost
In al þat euer y may and god to-fore
Al nere it but for man I loue moost
My brother Troilus / but sey wher-fore
It is / for sith þat day þat I was bore
I nas ne neuere mo to ben I thynke
a-ȝeins a thynge þat mygth þe for-thynke
¶ Pandare gan hym thanke and to hym seyde
Lo sire I haue a lady in þis town
Þat is my nece and called is Cryseyde
which som men wolden don oppression
And wrongfully han hire possession
wher-for I of ȝour lordchip ȝow besheche
Te ben oure frend with-outen more speche
¶ Deiphebus hym answerde o is nat this
Þat þow spekest of to me þus schraungely
Criseyde my frende he seyde this
Than nedeth quod deiphebus Hardely
Namore to speke / for trusteth wel þat I
wol be hire champyon with spere and ȝerde
I rought naught though alle hire foos it herde
¶ But telle me thow þat woost alle þis matere
How I myght beste auaylen now lat se
Quod pandarus if ȝe my lord so dere
wolden as now do þis honour to me
To preyen hire to mo[r]we lo þat she
Com vn-to ȝow hire pleyntes to deuyse
Hire aduersaries wold of it agryse
¶ And ȝif I more dorst preye ȝow as now
And charden ȝow to han so grete trauelle
To han some of ȝoure brethern here with ȝow
Þat myght to hire cause bet auayle
Þan woot I wele she myght neuere fayle
For to ben holpen what at ȝoure instaunce
what with hire other frendes generaunce
¶ Deiphebus which þat comen was of kynde
To alle honour and bounte to consente
Answerde it shal be don and I kan fynde
Ȝette grettere hepe to þis in myn entente
what wiltow seyn if I for Eleyne sente
To speke of þis I trow it be þe beste
For she may leden paris as hire lyste
¶ Of Ector wiche þat is my lorde my brother
It nedeth nought to preye hym frende to be
For I haue herde hym o tyme and ek other
Speke of Criseyde swich honour þat he
Þat he may sey no bet / swich hap to hym hath she
It nedeth nought hise helpes for [to] craue
He shal be swiche right as we wol hym haue
¶ Spek thow þi self also to troylus
On my bihalue and preye hym with vs dyne
Sir al þis shal be don quod Pandarus
And took his leue / and neuere gan to fyne
But to his neces house as streght as lyne
He com / and fond hire fro þe mete arise
And sette hym down and spak right in þis wyse
¶ He seyde o verray god so haue I ronne
Lo nece myn se ȝe nought how I swete
I not whether ȝe þe more thank me konne
Be nought ware how fals polyphete
Is now aboute eft sones for to plete
And brynge on ȝow aduocacies newe
I no quod she and chaunged al hire hewe
¶ what is he more aboute me to dereche
and don me wronge what shal I don allas
Ȝet of hym self no thynge ne wolde I reche
Nere it for antenor and Eneas
Þat ben his frendes in swich manere cas
But for þe loue of god Myn vncle dere
No fors of þat lat hym han alle I-fere
¶ with-outen þat I haue a-nough for vs
Nay quod pandare it shal no thyng be so
For I haue ben right now at deiphebus
And Ector / and myne other lordes mo
And shortly makes eche of hym his foo
Þat by my thryft he shal it neuere wynne
For aught he kan when þat so he bygynne
¶ And as þei casten what was best to done
Deiphebus of his owen curtasye
Com hire to preye in his propere persone
To holde hym on þe morwe compaignie
At dyner / which she wold nought denye
But goodely gan to his preyer obeye
He thanked hire and wente vp on his weye
¶ when þis was don this Pandare vp anon
To telle in shorte and forth gan for to wende
To Troilus / as stille as any stoone
And þis thynge he told hym word and ende
And how þat he deiphebus gan to blende
And seyde hym / now is tyme if þat thow konne
To bere þe wele to morwe and alle is wonne
¶ Now speke now preye now pitously compleyne
lat nough[t] for nyce shame or drede or slouthe
Some tyme a man mot telle his sweue peyne
Bileue it / and she shal han on þe routhe
Thow shalt be saued by þi feithe in trouth
But wel woot I thow art now in drede
And what it is I leye I kanne arede
¶ Thow thynkest now how sholde I don al this
For by my cheres mosten folk aspye
Þat for hire loue is þat I fare amys
Ȝet hadde I leuere vnwyste for sorwe die
Now thynke nought so for þow dost grete folye
For I right now haue founden a manere
Of sleight / for to coueren al þi chere
¶ Thow shalt gon ouer nyght and þat blyue
Vn-to deiphebus house as the to pleye
Thy malady awey þe bet to dryue
For-why thou semest sike soth for to seye
And after þat don in þi bedde þe leye
And seye thou maiste no longer vp endure
And lye right þare and byd þin auenture
¶ Sey þat þi feuere is wonte the for to take
Þe same tyme and lasten tyl on morwe
And lat se now how wel þow kanst it make
For parde sik is he þat is in sorwe
Go now fare wel / and venus here to borwe
I hope and thow þis purpos holde ferme
Þi grace she shal fully ther conferme
¶ Quod Troilus I-wis thow nedeles
Conseylest me / þat sikliche I me feyne
For I am sik in ernest douteles
So þat wel neigh I sterue for þe peyne
Quod Pandarus thow shalt þe bettere pleyne
And hast lasse nede conterfete
For hym men demen hoote þat men seen swete
¶ Lo holde þe at thi triste cloos and I
Shal wel the deere vn-to þi bowe dryue
Ther-with he took hise leue al softly
And Troilus to paleys wente blyue
So glad ne was he neuere in alle his lyue
And to Pandarus reede gan al assente
And to Deiphebus hous at nyght he wente
¶ What nedeth ȝow [to] tellen alle þe chere
Þat deiphebus vnto his brother made
Or his accesse or his siklych manere
How men gan hym with clothes for to lade
Þan he was leyde and how men wolde hym glade
But al for noughte he helde forth ay the wyse
That ȝe han herde Pandare er þis deuyse
¶ But certein is er Troilus hym leyde
Deiphebus had hym preyed ouer nyght
To ben a frend and helpynge to Criseyde
God woot þat he it graunted anon right
To ben hire ful frende with al his myght
But swich a nede was to prey hym thenne
As for to bidde a woode man for to renne
¶ The morwen com and neighen gan þe tyme
Qf meelited / þat þe faire queene Eleyne
Shapte hire to ben an houre efter þe prime
with deiphebus / to whom she nolde feyne
But as his suster homly soth to seyne
She come to dyner in hire pleyne entent
But god and pandare wiste what al þis mente
¶ Com ek Criseyde al Innocent of þis
Antigone hire suster Tharbe al-so
But flee we now prolixite beste is
For loue of god and lat vs faste go
Right to theffect with-outen tales mo
why al þis folk assemlede in þis place
And lat vs of hire saluynges pace
Grete honour dide hym deiphebus certein
And fedde hym wel with al þat myghte like
But euere mo allas was his refreyne
My goode brother Troilus the sike
Lyth ȝet / and þer-with-alle he gan to sike
And efter þat he peyned hym to glade
Hym as he mygth and chere goode he made
¶ Compleyned ek Eleyne of his sikenesse
So feithfully that pite was to here
And euery wight gan wexen for accesse
A leche anon / and seyde in þis manere
Men curen folk / this charme I wol ȝow leere
But þer sat oon al liste hire naught to teche
Þat thoughte / beste koude I ȝet ben his leche
¶ After compleynte hym gonnen they to preyse
As folk don ȝet when somwight hath by-gonne
To preyse a man and with prys hym rayse
A thousande fold ȝet heighere þan þe sonne
He is he kan that fewe lordes konne
And Pandarus / of þat þei wold afferme
He naught for-gat hire preysynge to conferme
Herde al þis thynge Criseyd wel Inough
And euery word gan for to notifie
For wiche with sobre chere hire herte lough
For who is þat ne wold hire glorifie
To mowen swich a knyght don lyue or dye
But al passe I list ȝe to longe dwelle
For for quia propter o fyn is alle that euer y telle
¶ The tyme com fro dyner for to rise
And as hem aughte arisen euerychon
And gonne a while of þis and þat deuyse
But Pandarus brak al þis speche anon
And seyde to deiphebus wol ȝe gone
If ȝoure wille be as I yow preyde
To speke here of þe nedes of criseyde
¶ Eleyne whiche þat by þe honde hire holde
Took first þe tale and sayde go we blyue
And goodely on criseyde she byhelde
And seyde Ioyes lat hym neuere thryue
Þat doth ȝow harm and brynge hym sone of lyue
And ȝeue me sorwe but he schal it rewe
If that I may and al folk be trewe
¶ Tel how þi neces cas quod deiphebus
To Pandarus / for thow kanst best it telle
My lordes and my ladys it stant thus
what shold I longer quod he do ȝow dwelle
He rong hym oute a proces like a belle
Vp-on hire fo þat highte poliphete
So heynous þat men myghte on it spete
¶ Answerde of þis ich werse of hem þan other
And poliphete they gonnen thus to waryen
Anhonged be swich oon were he my brother
And so he shal for it ne may naughte varyen
what sholde I longer in þis tale taryen
Pleynlich al atones they hire highten
To ben hire help in al þat euere þei myghten
¶ Spake þanne Eleyne and seyde Pandarus
woot oughte my lorde my brother þis matere
I mene Ector or woot it Troilus
he seyde ȝe / but wole ȝe now me here
Me thynketh þis sith Troilus is here
It were good If þat ȝe wolde assente
She told hire self hym al this er she wente
¶ For he wol haue þe more hire grief at herte
By cause lo þat she a lady is
And by ȝoure loue I wol but in right sterte
And do ȝow wyte and that anon I-wis
If þat he sl[e]pe or wol ought here of þis
And In he lepte and seyde bym in his ere
God have þi soule I-brought haue I þi beere
¶ To smylen of þis gon tho Troilus
And Pandarus with-outen rekenynge
Out wente anon to Eleyne and deiphebus
And seyde hem so ther be no taryinge
Ne more prees he wol wele þat ȝe brynge
Criseyda my lady that is here
And as he may enduren he wol here
¶ But wol ȝe wot þe chaumber is but lyte
And fewe folk may lightly mak it warm
Now loketh ȝe for I wol haue no wyte
To brynge In prees þat myghten don harm
Or hym disesen for my bettre arm
Wher it be bet she bide til eft sones
Now lakketh ȝe þat knowen what to doon is
¶ I sey for me best is as I kan knowe
Þat no wyght in ne wente but ȝe tweie
But it were for I kan in a throwe
Reherce hire cas vnlike þat she kan seye
And efter þis she may hym ones preye
To ben god lord in short and take hire leue
This may nought muchel of his ese hym reue
¶ And ek for she is straunge he wol for-bere
His ese / which þat hym thar nough[t] for ȝow
Ek other thynge þat toucheth nought to here
He wol me telle I woot it wele right now
That secrete is and for the townes prow
And they þat no thynge knewe of this entente
with-outen more is Troilus In they wente
¶ Eleyn in al hire goodly soft [corrected] wyse
Gan hym salue and wommanly to pleye
And seyde I-wis ȝe most alwayes arise
Now fayre brother both al hool I preye
And gan hire arm right ouer his shulder leye
And hym with al hire wit to reconforte
As she best koude she gan hym to disporte
¶ So after þis quod she we ȝow bisike
My deere brother deiphebus and I
For loue of god and so doth pandare eke
To ben goode lord and frende right hertely
Vn-to Criseyde which that certeinly
Receyueth wrong as woot wel here Pandare
That kan hire cas bet than I declare
¶ This Pandarus gan new his tonge affile
And al hire cas reherce and þat anon
when it was seyde soone after in a while
Quod Troilus as soon as [I] may gon
I wol right fayn with al my myght ben on
Haue god my trouth hire cause to sustene
Goode thrift have ȝe quod Eleyne þe quene
¶ Quod Pandarus and it ȝoure wille be
Þat she may take hire leue or þat she go
O[r] elles god forbede it tho quod he
If that she voucheth sauf for to do so
And with þat worde quod Troilus ȝe two
Deiphebus and my suster leef and dere
To ȝow haue .I. to speke of a matere
¶ To ben a-uysede by ȝoure reede þe bettere
And fond as hap was at his beddes hed
Þe copie of a tretis and a lettre
Þat Ector hadde hym sent to axen red
If shwiche a man was worthy to ben ded
Who I naught wo but in a grysely wyse
He preyed hym anon / on it auyse
¶ Deiphebus gan þis letre for tonfolde
In ernest gret so dide Eleyne þe quene
And rouynge outward fast it gonne biholde
Downward a steyre in to an erber grene
Þis ilke thynge þei redden hem bitwene
And largely þe mountaunce of an houre
Þei gonne it to reden and to poure
¶ Now lat hem rede and torne we anon
To Pandarus / þat gan ful fast preye
Þat al was wel / and out he gan to gon
In to þe grete chaumber and þat in hye
And seyde / god saue al þis compaignye
Com nece myn my lady quene Eleyne
Abideth ȝow / and ek my lordes Tweyne
¶ Ris tak with ȝowe ȝowre nece antigone
Or whom ȝow lest or no fors hardily
The lesse prees þe bet com forth with me
And loke þat ȝe thonken humblely
Hem alle thre / and when ȝe may goodely
Ȝoure tyme se taketh of hem ȝoure leue
Lest we to longe his restes hym by-reue
¶ Al Innocent of Pandarus entente
Quod tho Criseyde go we Vncle dere
And arm in arm inward with hym she wente
Auysed wel hire wordes and hire chere
And Pandarus in ernestful manere
Seyde alle folk for goddes loue I preye
Stynteth right here and softly
¶ Auyseth ȝow what folk ben here with-Inne
And in what plit oon is god hym amende
And inwarde thus softly bygynne
Nece I coniure and heighly ȝow defende
On his half with that same vs al sende
And in þe vertu of þe corones tweyne
Sle nought bis man þat hath for ȝow þis peyne
¶ Fye on þe deuel thynke which oone he is
And in what plit he lith com onon
Thynk alle swich taried tyd but lost it nys
Þat wol ȝ[e] both seyne when ȝe ben oon
Secoundly ther ȝet deuyneth noon
Vp-on ȝow two com of now If ȝe kanne
whil folk is blent lo al þe tyme is wonne
¶ In titerynge and pursuyte and delayes
Þe folk deuyne at waggynge of stre
And though yo [MS. þo] wol have aftyr merye dayes
Þan dar ȝe naught and why for she and she
Spak [Pak scratcht out] swich a word thus loked he and he
Las tyme I-lost I dar naught with ȝow dele
Com of þer-fore and bryngeth hym to hele
¶ But now to ȝow ȝe louers þat ben here
was Troilus naught in a kankedort
Þat lay and myghte whIsprynge of hem here
And thought o lord right now rennet my sort
Fully to deye or han o-non conforte
And was þe firste tyme he shold hire preye
Of loue / o myghty god what shal he seye

HEADNOTE.P: [2 leaves have been cut out of the Cambridge Univ. Libr MS. Gg. 4. 27.]
[Leaves 28 and 29 have been cut out of this MS., Gg. 4. 27.]

LG.L: ¶ Madame quod pandaris god ȝow se
With al ȝoure bok & al þe cumpanye
Ey vnkele quo sche god ȝow saue & se
And vp sche ros & bi þe hond in hye
Sche tok hym faste & seyde þis nyȝt þrye
To goode mote it turne of ȝow I mette
And with þat word sche doun on bench 1 hym sette 1 [1-1 corrector]
// Ȝa nece ȝe schul fare wel þe bette
Ȝyf god wil al þis ȝyr qud Pandarus
But I am sori þat I haue ȝow lette
To herkyn on ȝoure bok þe pryse þus
ffor goddis loue what seith it telle it vs
It is of loue or sum good ȝe me lere
Vnkele quod sche ȝoure maystresse is not here
¶ With þat þey gunne lawhe & þo sche seyde
Þis romauns is of þebes þat we rede
And we han herd how þat kyng layes deyede
Þour Edippus his sone and al þat dede
And here we stentyn at þis lettere rede
How þe bischop as þe bok tellith
Amphiorax fel þour þe ground to helle
// Quod pandare al þis knowe I myn selve
And al þe sege of Thebes & þe care
ffor herof be þere makyd bokis twelue
But lat be þis & tel me how ȝe fare
Do a-woy ȝoure wimpil & schew ȝoure face bare
Do a-woy ȝoure bok rys vp & lat vs daunce
And lat vs don to may sum obseruaunce
¶ I god forbede quod sche be ȝe madde
Is þat a wedewis lyf so god ȝow saue
Ȝe makyn me be iouys sore adradde
Ȝe ben so wilde it semyth as ȝe raue
It sat me wel bet ay in a caue
To bidde & rede on holy seyntis lyuys
Lat maydenys gon daunce & ȝonge wyuis
¶ As euere þryue I quod þis Pandarus
Ȝit coude I telle a þyng to don ȝow pleye
Now Vnkele dere telle it vs
ffor goddis loue is þanne þe sege a-weye
I am of grekis aferid so þat I deye
Nay na / quod he al so euere mote I þryue
It is a þyng bettyr þan sweche fyue
// Ȝa holy god quod sche what þyng is þat
What bet þan swiche fiue I nay I-wis
ffor al þis word ne can I rede what
It schulde ben sum iape I trowe is þis
And but ȝowre selve telle vs what it is
Myn wit is forto arede al til eue
As help me god as I [n, corrector] not what ȝe meue
¶ And I ȝoure borw ne neuere schal for me
Þis þyng ben told to ȝow so mote I þryue
And whi so vnkele myn whi so quod sche
By god he seyþ þat wele I telle as blyue
ffor proudere woman is þere non on lyue
And ȝe wiste it / ne in þe toun of troye
I iape not so euere haue I ioye
// Þo gan sche wonderyn wel more þan be-forn
A þousent fold & doun hire eyȝen caste
ffor neuere syn þe tyde þat sche was born
To knowe þyng desired sche so faste
And with a sik sche seyde him at þe laste
Now vnkele myn I nil þe not displese
Nor askyn more þat may don ȝow disese
¶ So aftyr þis with manye wordis glade
And frendeli talis & with merie chere
Of þis & þat þey pleyede & gone wade
In manye vncouth glad & dep matere
As frendis don when þey ben mette in fere
Til sche gan axen hym how ector ferde
Þat was þe tounys wall & þe grekys ȝerde
¶ fful wel I þanke god quod þandaris
Saue in his arm he haþ a lytil wounde
And ek his frosche broþer Troilis
Þe wise wary ector þe secunde
In hom þat vertu euere in corrector] lust haþ bounde
As al treuthe & al gentillesse
Wisdom honour fredom & worþinesse
// In good feyþ em quod sche þat likyþ me
Þey fare wel god saue hem boþe to
ffor trewely i holde it gret deynte
A kyngis sone in armys wel to do
And ben of goode condisciounys þerto
ffor gret power & moral vertu here
Is selde seyn in on persone in fere
¶ In good fayþ þat is soþ quod Pandaris
But be myn trouthe þe kyng haþ sonys tweye
Þat is to mene ector & troylis
Þat serteynly þov þat I schulde deye
Þey ben as voyde of vicis dare I seye
As ony men þat leuyn vndir þe sunne
Here myȝt is meche knowe & what þey cunne
// Oof ector nediþ nouȝt for to telle
In al þe world þere ne is a betere knyȝt
As he þat is of worþinesse welle
And he wel more vertu haþ þan myȝt
Þis knowith many a wys & worþi wyȝt
Þe same prys of troylis I seye
So god helpe me I knowe not sweche tweye
¶ By god quod sche of ector þat is soþ
Of Troylus þe same þyng trowe I
ffor dredles men telle þat he doþ
In armys day be day so worþily
And berith hym at hom here so gentilly
Til euery wyȝt þat al þe prys haþ he
Of hem þat me were leuest preysed be
¶ Ȝe seyn ryȝt wel I-wis quod Pandaris
ffor þis day who so hadde with hym ben
Miȝte han wonderd vp on troylis
ffor neuere ȝit so þikke a swarm of ben
Ne fley as grekys gunne from him flen
And þour þe feld in euery wiȝtis ere
Þere was non cry but troylis is þere
// Now here now þat he / huntede hem so faste
Þer nas but grekis blud & Troylis
Now hym he hitte hym doun he cast
Ay where he wente it was a-rayed þus
He was here deþ & schild & spere for vs
Þat as þat day þere durste non with-stonde
Whil þat he hild his blodi swerd in honde
¶ Þerto he is þe frendlyeste man
Of gret stat þat euere I say myn lyue
And where hym leste best felauschepe can
To swich as hym þynkyþ abele for to þryue
And with þat word þo pandaris as blyue
He tok his leue & seyde he wolde gon henne
Nay blame haue I myn vnkele quod sche þanne
// What eylyth ȝow to ben þus wery sone
And nameliche of wemen wele ȝe so
Nay sittyþ doun bi god I haue to done
With ȝow to speke of wisdom or ȝe go
And euery wiȝt þat was a-boute hem to
Þat herde þat gan fer awey to stonde
Whil þey to haddyn al þat hem luste on hende
¶ Whan þat here talk was brouȝt al to an ende
Of here estat & of here gouernaunce
Quod Pandarus now is it tyme I wende
But I seye aryseþ & lat vs daunce
And cast ȝoure wedewis abite to myschaunce
What list ȝoure self þus to disfygure
Syþe ȝow is tyd so glad an auenture
¶ A wel be-þouȝt for loue of god quod sche
Schal I now wetyn what ȝe mene of þis
No þis þyng askyþ leyser þo quod he
And ek me wolde meche greue I-wis
Ȝif I it tolde & ȝe it toke amys
Ȝit were it bet myn tunge for to stylle
Þan seyn a soþ þat were a-ȝens ȝoure wille
// ffor nece by þe goddes Menerue
And Iupiter þat makyth þe þondyr to rynge
Þat blysful venus þat I serue
Ȝe ben þe woman in þis world leuenge
With-oute paramouris as to myn wetynge
Þat I best loue & loþest am to greue
And þat ȝe wete wel ȝoure self I lene
¶ I-wis myn vnkele quod sche graunt mercy
Ȝoure frenschepe haue I founde euere ȝit
I am to no man holde trewely
So meche as to ȝow & haue so lityl quit
And with þe grace of god hene forþ & myn wit
As in myn gilt I schal ȝow neuere offende
And ȝif I haue or þis I wele amende
// But for þe loue of god I schal ȝow be-seche
As ȝe ben he I most loue & trust
Let ben to me ȝoure frendely manere speche
And sey to me ȝoure nece whhat ȝow lyst
And with þat word hire vnkele a-non hire kyst
And seyde gladly leue nece dere
Take it for gode þat I schal seyn ȝow here
¶ With þat sche gan hire eyȝyn doun to caste
And Pandaris to couhe [couye alterd to couhe] gan a lyte
And seyde nece alwoy lo to þe laste
How so it be þat sum men hem delyte
With sotyl art here talys to endite
Ȝit for al þat in here entencioun
Here tale is al for sum conclusioun
¶ And syþe þe ende is euery talis strenthe [This leaving-out of the g is now Lancashire, says Prof. Skeat. He has heard Mr. Gladstone do it.]
And þis matyr is so behouely
What schulde I it pente or drawe it on lenthe [This leaving-out of the g is now Lancashire, says Prof. Skeat. He has heard Mr. Gladstone do it.]
To ȝow þat ben myn frend so feyþfully
And with þat word he gan ryȝt inwardly
By-heldyn hire & lokyn on hire face
And seyde on swich a merour good grace
// þanne þouȝte he þus ȝif I myn tale endite
Ouȝt hard or make a proces ony while
Sche schal non sauour han þerin but lite
And trowe I wolde here in myn wil begile
ffor tendere wittys wenyn al be wile
Where as þey can not pleyn vndirstonde
fforþy hire wit to serue wele I fonde
¶ And lokyd on hire in a besy wise
And sche was war þat he be-hild here so
And seyde lord so faste ȝe me auyse
Sey ȝe me neuer er now what sey ȝe no
Ȝis ȝis quod he & bet wele er I go
But be my treuthe I þouȝte not ȝif ȝe
Ben fortunat for now men schal it se
// ffor to eueryche wight sum goodliche auenture
Sumtyme is scape ȝif he it can receyue
And ȝif he ne wil take of it no cure
Whan þat it comyth but wilfully it weyue
Lo neyþer cas ne fortune him disseyue
But riȝt his owene slouthe & wrechedenes
And swich a wiȝt is for to blame I ges
¶ Good auenture bele nece haue ȝe
Ful lyȝtely founde & ȝe cunne it take
And for þe loue of god & ek of me
Tache it a-non lest auenture slake
What schulde I lengere proces of it make
Ȝif me ȝoure hond for in þis world is non
Ȝif þat ȝow lyst a wyȝt so wel be-gon
¶ And syþe I speke of good entencioun
As I to ȝow h[a]ue told ȝu here be-fore
And loue as wel ȝoure honour & renoun
As criatour in al þis world I-bore
By al þe oþis þat I haue ȝow swore
And ȝe ben wroþ þerfore or wene I lie
Ne schal I neuere se ȝow eft with eyȝe
¶ Beþ not a-gast ne quakyþ not wherto
Ne changith nouȝt for fere so ȝoure hewe
ffor hardeli þe werste of þis is do
And þow myn tale as now be to ȝow newe
Ȝit trist alwey ȝe schul me finde trewe
And were it þat me þouȝte vnsittynge
To ȝow wolde I non swich tale brynge
¶ Now myn em for goddis loue I preye
Quod sche cum of & tel me what it is
ffor boþe I am a-gast what ȝe wil seye
And ek me longith it to wetyn I-wis
ffor wheþer it be wel or be amys
Sey on let me not in þis fere dwelle
So wil I don now herkenyth I schal telle
// Now nece myn þe kyngis dere sone
Þe goode wise worþi frosch & fre
Which alwoy for to don weɫɫ is wone
Þe noble troilis so sore louyþ þe
Þat but ȝe loue his bane it wele be
Lo here is al what schulde I more seye
Do what ȝow lust to make him lyue or deye
¶ But ȝif ȝe late him deye I wele sterue
Haue here myn trouthe nece I nil not lyen
Al schulde I with þis knyf myn þrote keruen
With þat þe teris brostyn out of hise eyȝen
And seyde ȝif þat ȝe don vs boþe deyen
Þus gilteles þanne haue ȝe fiched fayre
What mende ȝe o þow we beþe a peyre
¶ Allas he wich þat is myn lord so dere
Þat trewe man þat nobele & worþi knyȝt
Þat nouȝt desirith but ȝoure frendeli chere
I se hym dye þere þat he goþ vp ryȝt
And hastyþ him with alle his fulle myȝt
ffor to be slayn / ȝif fortune wil asent
Allas þat god ȝow swich a beaute sent
// ȝif it be so þat ȝe so crewel be
Þat of his deþ ȝe liste not to reche
Þat is so trewe & worþeli as ȝe se
No more þan of a iapere or a wreche
Ȝif ȝe ben swich ȝoure beute may not streche
To make an ende of so crewel a dede
Auysement is good be-fore Þe nede
¶ Wo worþi þe fayre gom vertules
Wo worþi þat erbe þat doþ no bote
Wo worþi þat beute is reutheles
Wo worþe þat wiȝt þat tret vch vndir fote
And ȝe þat ben of beute crop & rote
Ȝif þerwithal in ȝow ne be no reuthe
Þanne is it harm ȝe liuyn be myn treuthe
// And also þynkyth wel þat it is no gaude
ffor me were leuere þou & I & he
Were hangit þan I schulde ben his baude
As hye as men myȝte on vs alle se
I am þyn em þe schame were to me
As wale as ȝe ȝif þat I schulde asent
Þour myn a-bek þat he þyn honour schent
¶ Now vndyr-stond for I now not require
To bynde ȝow to him þour non beheste
But only þat ȝe make hym bettyr chere
Þan ȝe han don or þis & more festis
So þat his lyf be sauid at þe leste
Þis al and sum & pleynli oure entente
God help me so / I neuere oþer mente
¶ Lo þis request is not but skil I-wis
Ne doute of tresoun parde is þere non
I sette þe werste þat ȝe drede þis
Men woldyn wonderyn to sen hym comyn & gon
Þere aȝen answere I þus a-non
Þat euery wiȝt but he be fol of kende
Wele deme it loue or frenschepe in his mende
// What who wele deme þow he se a man
To temple gon / þat he þe emagis ettyþ
Þynk ek how wel & wisely þat he can
Gouernyn him self þat he no þyng forȝetith
Þat where he comyth he pris & þank him getiþ
And ek þerto he schal come here so selde
What fors were it þow al þe toun be-helde
¶ Swich loue of frendis regnyth þour al þis toun
And wri ȝow in þat mentil euere mo
And god so wis be myn sauacioun
As I haue seyd þe best is to don so
But goode nece alwoy to stynte his wo
Lat ȝoure daungere swerd bende a lite
Þat of his deþ ȝe ben not for to wite
// Cresseide which þat herde him in þis wyse
Now I schal fele what ȝe 1 mene I-wys 1 [1-1 corrector]
Now em quod sche what wolde ȝe deuyse
What is ȝoure red I schulde don of þis
Þat is wel seyd serteyn quod he best is
Þat ȝe hym loue a-ȝin for his louyng
As loue for loue / is skilful guerdounnyng
¶ Þink ek how eld wastyþ euery oure
In eche of ȝow a parti of beaute
And þerfore er þat age þe deuoure
Go loue for old. þere wele no wiȝt of þe
Lat þis prouerbe a lore onto ȝow be
To late war quod beaute whan it paste
And olde dauntyþ daunger at þe laste
¶ Þe kyngis fol is wone to crye froude
Whan þat hym þynkith a woman berith hire hie
So longe mote ȝe leuen & alle proude
Til crowis fet hem waxen vndir ȝoure eyen
Whi sende ȝow þanne a mereur in to preyen
In wich ȝe may se ȝoure face a morwe
I bidde with / ȝow no more sorwe
// With þis he stint & cast a-doun his hed
And sche be-gan to breste & wepe a-non
And seide allas for wo whi nere I ded
ffor of þis world þe feith is al a-gon
Allas what schulde straunge men to me don
Whan he þat for myn beste frend I wende
Rediþ me to loue / & schulde it me defende
¶ Allas I wolde a trustid douteles
Þat ȝif þat I þour myn dis-auenture
Hadde louyd him or eɫɫ [ellis] achilles
Ector or ony manys creature
Ȝe nylde an had non mercy ne mesure
On me but alwoi me in repreue
Þis false world allas ho may it leue
// What is þis al þe ioye & al þe feste
Is þis ȝoure red is þis myn blisful cas
Is þis þe veray mede of ȝoure be-heste
Is al þis peyntede proces seid allas
Ryȝt for þis fyn o ladi myn pallas
Þow in dredful cas for me purueye
for so a-stonid am I þat I deye
¶ With þat sche gan ful sorwefulli to sike
O may it ben no bet quod pandaris
By god I schal no more comyn here þis wike
And god to-forn þat I am mystrostid þus
I se wel þat ȝe sette lite of vs
Or of oure deþ allas I woful wreche
Miȝt he ȝit liue of me is not to reche
¶ O cruel god O dispituse marte
O furies yre of helle on ȝow I crye
So lat me neuere out of þis hous departe
Ȝif þat I mente harm or welany
But syþe I se myn lord mote nede dey
And I with hym here I me schriue & seye
Þat wekedeli ȝe don vs boþe deye
But siþe It like ȝow þat I be ded
Be neptunus þat god is of þe se
ffrom þis forþ / schal I neuere ete bred
Til I myn ouene herte blod may se
ffor serteyn I wele deie as sone as he
And vp he stirte & on his waye he rauȝte.
Til sche a-geyn him 1 by the lappe cauhte. 1 [1-1 corrector]
¶ Crisseyde which þat wol ner sterf for fer
So as sche was þe sorwefuleste wiȝt
Þat myȝte be & herde ek with hire ere
And say þe sorweful ernest of þe knyȝt
And in hise preieris ek say non on-riȝt
And for þe harm þat myȝte ek falle more
Sche gan to rewe & dredde hire wondir sore
// And þouȝte þus vnhappis falle þekke
Alday for loue & in swich a maner cas
And men ben crewel in hem self & weke
ffor ȝif þis man sle hire hym self allas
In myn presence it wele be no solas
What men wolde of it don I can not seye
It nediþ me ful sleli for to pleie
¶ And with sorweful sike seide þrie
A lord what me is tid a sori chaunce
ffor myn estat lith in iupardie
And ek myn emis lyf [? lyth alterd to lyf, t dotted out] in a balaunce
But neuere þe les with good gouernaunce
I schal so don I schal myn honour kepe
And ek his lyf & stinte for to wepe
¶ Of harmis too þe lasse is for to chese [se corrector]
Ȝit hadde I leuere to makyn him good chere
In honour þan myn Emys lif to lese
Ȝe seyn ȝe noþing eɫɫ me requere
No wis he seith myn owene nece dere
Now wel quod sche & I wele don myn peyne
I schal myn hest a-ȝen myn lust constreyne
// But þat I nyl not holdyn him in honde
Ne louyn no man þat can no wiȝt ne may
A-ȝen his wil but eɫɫ wil I fonde
Myn honour saue plese hym from day to day
Þerto nolde .I. not onis sey nay
But þat I drede as in myn fantasie
But sese cause þan seseþ þe maladye
¶ But here I make a protestacioun
Þat in þis mater ȝif ȝe deppere go
Þat serteynli for no sauacioun
Of ȝow þow ȝe sterue boþe to
Þow al þe world on oo day be myn fo
Ne schal I neuere on him han oþer reuthe
I graunte wel quod Pandaris be myn treuthe
// But I may troste wel to ȝow quod he
Þat of þe þing þat ȝe han hiȝt me here
Ȝe wele & it holdyn trorwely here
Ȝa douteles quod sche myn vnkele dere
Ne þat I schal han cause in þis matere
Qud he to pline ne aftir ȝow to preche
Whi no parde what nedith more speche
¶ Þo fellyn ȝit in oþere talis glade
Til at þe laste o goode em quod sche þo
ffor loue of god which þat vs boþe made
Tel me how first ȝe wistyn of his wo
Wot not of it but ȝit ȝe seide no
Can he wel speke of loue I ȝow preie
Tel me for I þe bet me schal purueie
¶ Þo pandarus a litil gan to smy
And seyde be myn treuthe I schal ȝou telle
Þis oþerday not gon full long while
With-inne þe paleis gardyn be a welle
Gan he & I wel half a day to dwelle
So fer to spekyn of an ordenaunce
Howe we þe grekis myȝtyn don disauenaunce
// Sone aftir þat begunne for to lepe
And castyn with oure dartis to & fro
Til at þe laste he seide he wolde slepe
And on þe gres a-doun he leid hym þo
And I aftir gan rome to & fro
Til þat I herde as þat I welk a lone
How þat he gan ful wofully to grone
¶ Þo gan I stalke him softeli be-hinde
And sekirli þe soþe for to seyne
As I can clepe a-ȝen to myn mynde
Ryȝt þus to louyn he gan him for to pleyne
He seide lord haue mercy of myn peyne
Al haue I ben rebel in myn entent
Now mea culpa lord I me repent
// O god þat at þyn dispocicioun
Ledest þe fyn be iuste puruiaunce
Of euery wiȝt myn lowe confescioun
Accepte in gre & sende me swich pen[a]unce
As likiþ þe but from desperaunce
Þat may myn gost departe awoy from þe
Þou be myn schild for þyn benygnete
¶ ffor certis lord so sore haþ sche me woundet
Þat stod in blak with lokyng of hire eyȝen
Þat to myn herteis boteme it is foundit
Þour which I wot þat me muste nedis deyen
Þis is þe werste I dar me not be-wreien
And wel þe hattere ben þe gleden rede
Þat men hem wrien with asschin pale & dede
¶ With þat he smot his hed a-doun a-non
And gan to motere I not what treweli
And I with þat gan stille awoy to gon
And let þerof as no þing wost hadde I
And come a-geyn a-non & stod hym bi
And seide a-wake ȝe slepin al to longe
It semyth me nouȝt þat loue doþ ȝow longe
// Þat alepin so þat no man may ȝow wake
Ho say or þis euere so dul a man
Ȝa frend qud he doþ ȝe ȝoure hedis ake
For loue & lat me leuin as I can
But þow þat he for loue was pale & wan
Ȝit made he þo as frosch a cuntenaunce
As þow he schulde a led þe newe daunce
¶ Þis passed forþ til now þis oþer day
It fel þat I cam romynge al a lone
In to his chaumbir & fond how þat he lay
Vp on his bed but man so sore grone
Ne herde I not ne what þat was his mone
Ne wiste I not for as I was comynge
Al sodeynly he lefte his compleynynge
// Of wich I tok sumwhat suspecioun
And ner I come & fond he wepte sore
And god so wis be myn sauacioun
As euere of þing hadde I not reuthe more
ffor noþer with engyn ne with lore
Onneþis myȝte I from þe deþ him kepen
Þat ȝit fele I myn herte for hym wepyn
¶ And god wot neuere siþe þat I was borne
Was I so besi no man for to preche
Ne neuere was to wyȝt so depe I-sworne
Or he me told ho myȝte ben his leche
But now to ȝow rehersin al his speche
Or alle hise woful wordes for to sunne [n 1 first m]
Ne biddeþ me not but ȝe wele sen me swounne
¶ But for to saue his lyf or eɫɫ nouȝt
And to non harm of ȝow þus I dreuyn
And for þe loue of god þat vs haþ wrouȝt
Swich cher him doþ þat he & I may leuyn
Now haue I plat to ȝou myn herte schreuyn
And siþe ȝe wetyn þat myn entent is clene
Takyth hede þerof for I non euyl mene
// And ryȝt good þrift I preie to god haue ȝe
Þat haþ swich on lauȝt with-oute net
And be ȝe wyse as ȝe ben fayr to se
Wel in þe ryng þan is þe rebe set
Þere were neuere to so wel I-met
Whan ȝe ben his alhol as he is ȝoure
Þere myȝti god ȝit grau[n]te vs sen þat oure
¶ Nay þerof speke I not ha ha quod sche
As helpe me god ȝe schendyn euerydel
A merci dere nece a-non quod he
What so I speke I mente not but wel
By maris þe god þat helmyd is of stel
Now beþ not wroþ myn blod myn nece dere
Now wel quod sche forȝouyn be it here
// With þat he tok his leue & hom he wente
Ȝe lord how he was glad & wel be-gon
Cresseyde aros & neuere sche ne stente
But streit in to here closet sche wente a-non
And sette hire doun as stille as ony ston
And euery word gan vp & doun to wende
Þat he hadde seid as it come hire to mynde
¶ And wex sumdel a-stonyd in hire þouȝt
Ryȝt for þe newe cas but whan þat sche
Was ful auysed þo fond sche ryȝt nouȝt
Of periel whi þat sche auȝte a-fered for to be
ffor man may loue of possibilite
A woman so his herte may to-breste
And sche not love aȝyn but ȝif sche leste
¶ But as sche sat a lone & seyde þus
Þe acry a-ros at scharmus al with-oute
And men criedyn in þe strete se Troylis
Haþ riȝt now put to fleyht þe grekys route
With þat gan al hire mene for to shoute
A go we sen cast vp þe ȝatis wyde
ffor oþer weye is from þe ȝatys non
Of dardannis þervp-on is þe cheyne
With þat come he & al his folk a-non
An esi pas rydynge in routys twene
Ryȝt as his happi day was soþ to seyne
ffor wich men seyn may not disturbit be
Þat schal betydyn of necescite
¶ Þis Troilis vp on his bayȝe stede
Al armed saf hys heued ful rychely
And wounded hys hors & gan 1 for to blede 1 [1-1 corrector]
On quych he rod a pas ful softely
But swich a knyȝtely syȝte treweli
As was on hym was nouȝt with-outyn fayle
To lokyn on mars þat god is of batayle
// So lik a man of armys & a knyȝt
He was to sen fulfild of hey prowesse
ffor boþe he hade a bodi & a myȝt
To don þat þyng as wel as hardynesse
And ek to sen hym in his ger hym dresse
So frosch so ȝong so worþi semede he
It was an heuene vp-on him for to se
¶ His helm to-hewyn was in twenti placis
Þat in a tissen being his bak by-hynde
His scheld to-dast with swerdis & with macis
In wych men myȝte mane an arwe feynde
Þat þerled hadde hed & nerf & rynde
And ay þe peple cryed here comyþ oure ioyȝe
And next his broþer holdyn vpe of Troye
¶ ffor which he wex a litil red for schame
Whan he so herde þe peple on hym cryen
Þat to beholde it was a nobele game
How sobirli he cast a-doun his eyȝen
Cresseide gan al his cher aspyen
And let so softe it in hire herte synkyn
Þat to hire self sche seide ho ȝaf me drynken
// ffor of hire owene þought sche wex al red
Remembrynge hire ryȝt þus lo þis is he
Wych þat myn vnkele swerith he myȝte be ded
But I on hym haue merci & pete
And with þat þouȝt for pure schamyd sche
Gan in hire hed to pullyn & þat as faste
Whil he & al þe pepil forbi past
¶ An gan to castyn & rollyn vp & doun
With-inne hire þouȝt his excellent pruesse
And his estat & also his renoun
His wit his schap & ek his gentillesse
But hire fauour was for his distresse
Was al for hire & þouȝte it were a reuthe
To sle swichon ȝif þat he myȝte in trouthe
// Now myȝte sum enuyous Iangele þus
Þis was a sodeyn loue how myȝte þis be
Þat sche þus lyȝteli lovede Troylus
Ryȝt for þe ferste syȝt ȝa parde
Now ho so seith so neuere mote he þe
ffor euery þyng of gynnyng haþ it nede
Or it be wrouȝt with-outyn ony drede
¶ ffor I sey not þat sche so sodeynly
Ȝaf him here herte but þat sche gan enclyne
To lyke hym fyrst & I haue told ȝow why
And aftyr þat his manhod & his pyne
Made loue with-inne hire for to myne
ffor wich be proces & be good seruyse
He wan hire loue & in non sodeyn wise
¶ And also blisful venus / wel arayed
Sat in hire seuente hous of heuen þo
Disposed wel & with aspectis payed
To helpe seli troylis of his wo
And soþ to say sche nas not al a fo
To Troylis in his natiuite
God wot þat wel þe sonere spedde he
Now lat vs stinte of troylis a þrowe
Þat ridyþ forth & lat vs turne faste
Vn to Cresseyde þat hing hire hed so lowe
Þere as sche sat a lone & gan to cast
Wheron sche wolde a-poynt hire at þe last
Ȝif þat so were hire em wolde not sese
ffor Troylus vp on hire for to prece
¶ And lord how sche gan in hire þouȝt argue
Of þis mater of which I haue ȝow told
And what to done best & what to eschewe
Þat pleytede sche ful ofte in manye a fold
Now was hire herte warm now was it cold
And what sche þoute sumwhat schal I write
Al for myn autour leste for to endite
// Sche þouȝte ek þis / þat Troilus persone
Sche knew be seyth & ek bi gentillesse
And seide þus al were it not to done
To graunte him loue ȝit for his worþynesse
It were honour with play & gladnesse
In honeste with swich a lord to dele
ffor myn estat & also for his hele
¶ Ek wel wot I myn kyngis sone is he
And seyþ he hath to se me swich delite
Ȝif I wolde vttirliche his siȝt fle
Perauenture he myȝt han me in dispit
Þour which I myȝte stondyn in werse plyȝt
Now were I wis myn hate to purchase
With-outyn nede þere I may stonde in grace
¶ In euery þyng I wot þere lyȝt mesure
ffor þow a man forbede dronkenes
He nouȝt forbede þat euery creature
Be drynkeles for alwoy as I gesse
Ek soþ I wot for me is his distresse
I ne auȝte not for þat þing hym dispise
Syþe it is so he leuyth in good wise
// And ek I knowe of long tyme a gon
Hyse þewis goode & þat he is not nyse
Ne auauntour seyth men certeyn he is non
To wise is he to don so gret a vice
Ne also I nele him neuere so cherice
Þat he may make auaunt be iuste cause
He schal me neuere bynde in swich a clause
¶ Now sette a cas þe hardest is I-wis
Men myȝte demyn þat he louyth me
What dishonour were it on-to me þis
May I him lette of þat why nay parde
I knowe also & alday here & se
Men louyn women þour al þis toun aboute
Be þey þe wers whi nay with-outyn doute
// I þynke ek how abele he is for to haue
Of al þis nobele toun þe þryftyeste
Þat woman is so sche hire honour saue
ffor out & out he is þe worþiest
Saue onli ector wich þat is þe best
And ȝit his lyf now lyth al in myn cure
But swich is loue & ek myn auenture
¶ Ne me to louyn a wondir is it not
ffor wel I wot myn self so god me spede
Al wolde I þat no man woste of þis þouȝt
I am on of þe fayreste out of drede
And goodliest ho so takyþ hede
And so men seyn þour al þe toun of troye
What wondir ist þow he of me haue ioye
¶ I am myn owene woman wel at ese
I þanke god as aftyr myn estate
Ryȝt ȝong & stonde on-teyed in lusty lese
With-outyn ielusie & swich debate
Schal non husbonde sey to me chek mate
ffor oþer þey ben ful of ielousie
Or mastirful or louyn nouelrye
// What schal I don to what fyn leue I þus
Schal I not louyn in cas ȝif þat me lyst
What parde I am not religious
And þow þat I myn herte sette at reste
Vp on þis knyȝt þat is þe worþieste
And kepe alwoy myn honour & myn name
Be al riȝt it may don me non schame
¶ But riȝt as whan þe sunne schynyth bryȝt
In march þat chaungith oftyn time his face
And þat a cloude is put with wynd to flyȝt
Wich ouersprat þe sunne as for a space
A cloudi þouȝt gan þour here soule pase
Þat ouer-sprad hire bryȝte þouȝtis alle
So þat for fer almost sche gan to falle
// Þat þouȝt was þis al syþe þat I am fre
Schal I now loue & putte in iupardie
Myn sekirnes & þrallyn in liberte
Allas how durste I þinkyn þis folye
May I not wel in oþere folk aspye
Here dredful ioye here constaunt & here peyne
Þere louyt non þat sche ne haþ [later t put on to haþ and why] why [later t put on to haþ and why] to pleyne
¶ ffor loue is ȝit þe moste stormy lif
Ryȝt of him self þat euere was be-gunne
ffor euere mistrust or nyce stryf
Þere is in loue sum cloude is ouer þe sunne
Þerto we wreche wemen no þyng cunne
Whan vs is wo but sitte & wepe or þynke
Oure wreche is þis oure owene wo we drinke
¶ Also þese wekede tungis þey ben so prest
To spekyn vs harm ek men ben so ontrewe
Þat riȝt a-non as sesed is here lest
So seseþ loue & forth to loue a newe
But harm I-don is don ho so it rewe
ffor þow þese men for loue hem ferst to rende
fful scharpe beginnyng oftyn brekiþ an ende
// How ofte tyme may men rede & se
Þe tresoun þat to women haþ be do
To what fyn is swich loue I can not se
Oor where be-comeþ it whan þat it is go
Þere nys no wiȝt þat wot I trowe so
Wher it becomith lo non wiȝt on it spornyth
Þat erst was noþing in to noþying turnyt
¶ How besi ȝif I loue I muste be
To plese hem þat iangele of loue & demen
And coye hem þat seyn non harm of me
ffor þow þere be no cause ȝit hem semyþ
Al be for harm þat folk here frendes quemyn
And ho may stoppe euery wekede tunge
Or soun of belle whil þat þey ben I-runge
// And after þat hire þouȝt be-gan to clere
And seyde he wich þat no þing vndir-takyth
Non þing a-cheuyth be him loþ or dere
And with a noþer þouȝt hire herte quakiþ
Þanne slepiþ hope and aftir dred a-wakyth
Now hot now cold but þus be-twexe tweye
Sche rist hire vp / & wente for to pleye
¶ A doun þe steyȝere a-non riȝt þo sche went
In to þe gardyn with hire necis þre
And vp & doun þey madyn 1 many a went 1 [1-1 corrected]
fflexippe & Schetarbe & Antigone
To pleye þat it ioye was to se
And siþe of hire women a gret route
Hire folwede in þe gardyn al a boute
¶ Þis ȝerd large & railled alle þe aleys
And schadewid wel with blospened bowis grene
I-benchede newe & sondede alle þe weyes
In wich sche walkede arm in arm bi-twene
Til at þe laste antigone þe schene
Gan on a troyan lay to syngin clere
Þat it an heuene it was hire voys to here

LG.HEAD: (119) (Antigone's Song of Love. St. 1.)
LG.L: // Sche seyde loue to whom I haue & schal
Ben vmbele subiect trewe in myn entent
As I best can I ȝow lord ȝeue I al
ffor euere mo myn hertis lust to-rent
ffor neuere ȝit þyn grace nowyȝt sent
So blisful cause as me myn lif to lede
In al Ioyȝe & seurte out of drede

LG.HEAD: (120) (Antigone's Song of Love. St. 2.)
LG.L: ¶ Þe blisful god han me so wel beset
In loue I-wis þat al þat berith lyf
Imagine ne cunne how to be bete
ffor lord with-outyn Ielusie or stryf
I leue on wich þat is most ententif
To seruyn wel onworþi or onfeyned
Þat euere was with harm vice disteyned
// As he þat is þe welle of worþines
Of treuthe ground myrour of goodly-hed
Of wight appollo ston of sekyrnes
Of vertu rote of lust fingir & hed
Þour wiche as al sor fro me ded
I-wis I loue hym best so doþ he me
Now good þrif to haue he where so þat he be
¶ Whom schulde I þanke but ȝow god alone
Of al þis blis of wich I baþe begyn
And þanked be þow lord for þat I loue
Þis is þe ryȝte lif þat I am in
To flen alle maner vice & syn
Þis doþ me so to vertu for to entende
Þat day be da I in myn wil amende
¶ And who þat sayith þat for to loue is vice
Or þraldom þow he fele in his herte distres
He oþer inuyous is or riȝt nyse
Or his vnmyȝti for his schrewedenes
To louyn for swich maner of folk I ges
Diffamyn loue as no þyng of it knowe
Þey spekyn but þei bentyn neuere his bowe

LG.HEAD: (124) (Antigone's Song of Love. St. 6.)
LG.L: // What is þe sunne wers of kynde ryȝt
Þow a man for febilnesse of hese eyȝen
May not endure on it to se for bryȝt
Or loue þe wers þow wrechis on it cryȝen
No wele is worþi þat may no sorwe dryen
And forþi ho þat hauyth an heued of verre
ffrom cast of stonys war hym in þe werre
¶ But I wigh al myn herte & al myn myth
As I haue seyd wele loue vn to myn last
Myn dere herte & al myn owene knyht
In whiche myn / herte growyn is fast
And his herte in me þat it schal euere last
Al drede I fyrst loue him to beginne
Now wot I wel þere is no peryl inne
// And here song ryȝt with þat word sche stente
And þerwithal now nece quod Crisseide
Who made þis song with so good entente
Antegone answerde & seide
Madame I-wis þe godelieste mayde
Of gret estat in al þe toun of troye
And let hire lif in most honour & ioye
¶ ffor soþe so it semyth bi hire songe
Quod þo Crisseide & gan þerwith to sike
And seide lord is þere swich blisse a-mong
Þeese [second e corrected] loueris as þey cunne fayre endite
Ȝe I-wis quod frosche antegone þe white
ffor alle þe folk þat han or ben on liue
Ne kunne wil þe blisse of loue discriue
¶ But wene ȝe þat euery wreche wot
Þe parfit blisse of loue nay I-wis
Þey wene al be loue þere on be hot
Doway doway þei wot no þing of þis
Men miste axen at seyntis ȝif it is
Ouȝt fayr in heuene whi for þey can telle
An axith fendis ȝif if it be foul in helle
// Criceyde þerto no þing hire answerde
But seide I-wis it wele ben nyȝt as faste
But euery word þat sche of hire herde
Sche gan to prentin in h[i]re herte faste
And ay gan sche hire lasse for to agast
