Þan it dede erst & sinkyn in here herte
Þat sche wex sumwhat abele to conuerte
¶ Þe dayis honour & heuenis eye
Þe nyȝtis fo al þis clepe I þe sunne
Gan wrestyn fast & dounward for to wrie
As he þat hade þe daijs cours I-ronne
And white þyngis gunne to wexe dunne
ffor lak of lyȝt & sterys to apere
Þat sche & alle hire folk hom wente in fere
// So whan it likede hire to gon to rest
And woydeden werin þo þat wooldyn ouȝt
Sche seyde þat slepyn whil hire lest
Hire women sone on to hire bed hire brouȝt
Whan al was hust þo lay sche stille & þouȝt
Of al þis þyng þe maner & þe gyse
Rehersen it nediþ not for ȝe ben wise
¶ A nyȝtyngale vp on a sidere grene
Vndyr þe chaumbir was þere as sche lay
fful loude song a-ȝen þe mone schene
Perauntyr in his briddis wise a lay
Of loue wich þat made his herte gay
That herkened sche so longe en god entent
Til at þe laste þe dede slep hire hent
¶ And as sche slep a-non ryȝt þo sche mette
How þat an egele federid wit as mylk
Vndir hire brest hire longe clawis sette
And out hire herte rente & þat a-non
And dede his herte in to [to, first in] hire brest to gon
Of wich sche gros / nouȝt ne noþying sinerte
And forþ he fley herte left for herte
// Now lat here slep & we oure talis holde
Of troylis þat / is to paleys redyn
ffrom þe charmys of þe whiche I tolde
And in his chambyr sit & ay abidyn
Til too or thre on hire massage ridyn
ffor Pandarus & souȝte hym so faste
Tyil þey him founde & brouȝte him at þe laste
¶ Þis Pandarus come lepynge in a-tonys
And seide þus we han ben wel I-betyn
To day with swerdis & with slynging of stonys
But Troylis þat haþ cauȝt him an herte
And gan to iape & seyde lord ȝe smete
But ris & lat vs suppe & gon to rest
And he answerd do we as ȝe lest
// With al þe laste goodly þat þey myȝt
Þey spedde hem from soper & to bedde
And euery wiȝt out at þe dore hym diȝt
And where hym lust vp on his woye him spedde
Troylis þat þouȝte his herte bledde
ffor wo til þat he / herde sum tydynge
He seyde frend schal I now wepe or synge
¶ Quod Pandarus li stille & me singe
And do on þyn hod þyne nedis spedde be
And sches ȝif þou wilt synge daunce or lepe
At schorte wordis þou schal trostyn in me
Sire myn nese wele don wel bi þe
And loue þe best bi god & be myn treuthe
But lak of hire purseut makiþ it þour þin alouthe
¶ ffor þus fer forþ haue I þyn werke begunne
ffrom day to day til þis day be þe morwe
Hire loue of frenschepe haue I to þe wonne
And þerto haþ sche leyd hire feyþ to borwe
Algate a fote is hamelid of þyn sorwe
What schulde I lengere sarmoun of it holde
As ȝe han herd be-forn al he hym tolde
// But riȝt as flouris þour þe colde nyȝt
I-closede stoupe on here stalke lowe
Redressen hem a-ȝen-þe sunne bryȝt
And spryngin on here kynde cours be rowe
Ryȝt so gan þo his eyȝen vp to þrowe
Þis troilis & seyde venus dere
Þyn myȝt þyn grace I-heried be it here
¶ And to Pandaris he held vp boþe hese hondis
And seide lord al þyn be it þat I haue
ffor I am hol al brostyn ben myne woundis
A þousand Troyes who so þat me ȝaue
Sche aftyr oþer god so wis me saue
Ne myȝte so gladdyn so myn herte
It sprediþ so for ioye it wele to-sterte
// But lord how schal I do how schal I leuyn
Whanne schal I next myn dere herte se
How schal þis longe tyme a-woy be dreuyn
Til þat þou be aȝin at hire from me
Þow mayȝt answere & seyee abide quod he
Þat hangiþ bi þe nekke soþ to seyne
In gret disese abidiþ for þe peyne
¶ Al esili now for þe loue of marte
Quod pandarus euery þyng haþ tyme
So longe a-bit til þat þe nyȝt departe
ffor also sekyr as þou lyst here by me
And god toforn I wele be þere or pryme
And for þyn werk sumwhat as I schal say
Or on sum oþer wiȝt þis charge lay
¶ ffor parde god wot I haue euere ȝit
Ben redy þe to seruyn in to þis nyȝt
Haue I not feyned but euene with myn wit
Don al ȝyn lust & schal with al myn myȝt
Do now as I schal seyn & fare a ryȝt
And ȝif þou nylt wite al þyn self þyn care
On me is not along al þyn euele fare
// I wot wel þat þou art wisere þan I
A þousent fold but & I were as þou
God helpe me so as I wolde vttyrly
Ryȝt of myn owene hond write hire ryȝt now
A lettere in whiche I wolde hire telle how
I ferde a-mis & hire be-sechyn of routhe
Now help þyn self & leue it not for slouthe
¶ And I myn self schal þerwith to here gone
And whan þou wist I am with hire þere
Worþe vp on a courser ryȝt a-none
Ȝa hardily / and þat in þyn beste gere
And ryd forþ bi þe place as nouȝt ne were
And þou schal fynde vs ȝif I may sittynge
In sum wyndowe into þe strete lokynge
// And ȝif þe lyste þanne mayst þou vs salue
And vp on me make þyn cuntenaunce
But be þyn lif be war þat þou eschewe
To tarye ouȝt god schilde it fro myschance
Ryd forþ þyn way & hold þyn gouernaunce
And we schal speke of þe sumwhat I trowe
Whan þou art gon to don þyne eris glowe
¶ Touchynge þyn lettere þou art wys I-now
I wot þou nylt dyneleche ne mystileche endite
As to makynit with þese argumentis tow
Ne coryously ne craftyliche þou wryte
By-blotte it with þyne teris a lite
A ȝif þou write a goodli word al softe
Þow it be good reherse it not to ofte
¶ ffor þow þe beste harpour vp on lyue
Wolde vp on þe beste sounede ioly harpe
Þat euere was with alle hese fyngerys fyue
Touche ay on streng or ay on warbele harpe
Were hise naylis poyntede neuere so scharpe
It schulde make euery wiȝt to dullen
To heryn his gle & of his strokys fullyn
// Ne iumpere ek no discordaunt þyng in fere
As þus to vsen termys of fysik
In louys termys hold of þyn matere
Þe forme alwoy & do þat it be lyk
ffor ȝif a peyntour wolde peynte a pyk
With assis fet & hedit as an ape
It cordyth not so nere it but a iape
¶ Þis conseyl lykede wel to troylis
But as dredful louere seyde he þis
Allas myn dere broþer pandarus
I am a-schamyd for to wryte I-wis
Lest of myn ygnoraunce I seyde amys
Or þat sche nolde for dispit resseyue
Þanne were I ded þere myȝte no þyng veyue
// To þat answerde Pandarus ȝif þe lest
Do þat I say & lat me þerwith gone
ffor bi þat lord þat formede est & west
I hope of it to brynge answere a-non
Ryȝt of hire hond & ȝif þat þou nylt non
Let ben & sory mote he ben his lyue
A-ȝens þyn lust þat helpyþ þe to þryue
¶ Quod Troylus depardeus I assent
Syþe þat þe lyst I wele a-ryse & wryte
And blysful god preye I with good entent
Þe viage & þe lettere I schal endite
So spede it & mynerua þe whiȝte
Ȝif þou me wilt myn lettere to deuyse
And sat hym doun & wrot ryȝt in þis wise

LG.HEAD: (153) (Troilus's Letter.)
LG.L: ¶ ffyrst he gan hire his ryȝte lady calle
His hertis lyf his lust his sorwis leche
His blis & ek þese oþere termys alle
Þat in swich cas ȝe loueris alle seche
And in ful vmbele wise & in his speche
He gan him recommau[n]de on to hire grace
To telle al how it axeþ meche spase
// And aftyr þis ful lowely he hire preyed
To ben not wrorþ þow he of his folye
So hardy was to hire wryte & seyede
Þat loue it made or ell muste he deye
And pitously gan merci for to crye
And aftyrward he seyde & ley ful loude
Hym self was litil worþy & lesse he coude
¶ But þat sche schulde han his cunnynge excused
Þat litil was & ek he dradde hire so
And his onworþynesse he ay ascused
And aftyr þat þanne gan he telle his wo
But þat was enfeyned for ay & o
And how he wolde in treuthe alwoy hym holde
And his a dew made & gan it folde
// And with hise salte teris he gan bathe [the, corrector]
Þe rubye in his synet & it sette
Vp on þe wex deliuerly & raþe
Þerwith a þousent tymys or he lette
He kyste þe lettere whan he hadde it schette
And seyde a blysful desteny parde
Þe schapyn is myn lady schal þe se
¶ Þis Pandarus vp þerwith & þat be tyme
On morwe & to his necys paleys sterte
And seyde slepe ȝe & it is pryme
And gan to iape & seyde þus myn herte
So frosch is it þow loue do it smerte
I may not slepe neuere a mayis morwe
I haue a ioli wo a lusti sorwe
¶ Crisseyde whanne þat sche hire vnkele herde
With dredful herte & desyrous to here
Þe cause of þis comynge þus answerde
Now be myn fay vnkele quod sche dere
What manere wyndis gidiþ ȝow here
Tellith vs ȝoure ioli wo & ȝoure penaunce
How fer forþ be ȝe put in louis daunce
// By god quod he I hoppe alwey be-hynde
And sche to law & þouȝte hire herte brest
Quod Pandarus loke þat ȝe alwey fynde
Gamyn in myn hod / but herkenyþ ȝif þat ȝon lest
Þere is ryȝt now come in-to toune a gest
A greke a spie & telliþ newe þyngis
ffor wich come I to telle ȝow tydyngis
¶ In to þe gardyn go we & ȝe schal here
Al preuyli of þis a long sarmoun
With þat þey wentyn arm in arm in fere
In to þe gardyn from þe chambere doun
And whan þat he so fer was þat þe soun
Of his wordis no man here myȝte
He seyde þus & out þe lettere plyȝte
// Lo he þat is holli ȝouris fre
Hym recomaundyþ louli to ȝoure grace
And sent ȝow þis lettere here bi me
A-vise ȝow on it whan ȝe han space
And sum goodli answere ȝow purchase
Or helpe god so pleynli for to seyne
He ne may not longe leuyn for his peyne
¶ fful dredfulli þo / gan sche stonde stylle
And tok it not / but al hire vmbele chere
1 Gan to schaunge / and 1 [1-1 corrector] seide scrit ne bille
ffor loue of [of, corrector] god / þat touchith swich matere
Ne bryngyth me non / and also vnkele dere
To myn estat / hauyþ more reward I preyȝe
Þan to his lust / what schulde I more seye
¶ And lokith now ȝif þis be resonabele
And letyþ not for fauour ne for slouthe
To seyn a soþ now were it conabele
To myn estat bi god & be ȝoure trouthe
To takyn it or to han of him routhe
In harmynge of myn self or in repreue
Bere it a-ȝen to hym þat ȝe on leue
// Pandarus gan vp on hire for to stare
And seyde / now is þis þe moste wondir
Þat euere I hadde / let be þis nyse fare
To deþe mote I smete be with þundir
[. . . . . . . no gap in the MS.] caret
Wolde I a letter to ȝow brynge or take
To harm of ȝow what liste ȝow þus it make
¶ But þus ȝe fare alle & some
Þat he þat most desireþ / ȝow to serve
Of him ȝe reche lest where he become
Or wheþer þat he leue or ell sterve
But for al þat euere I may deserue
Refuse it not quod he & hente hire fast
And in hire bosom þe lettere doun he þrast
// And seide caste it now a-wey a-non
Þat folk may it se / & gaure on vs to
Quod sche .I can a-bide / til þey ben gon
And gan to smyle & seyde em I preye
Swich answere as ȝe list ȝoure self purueye
ffor treweliche I nyl non lettere write
No þanne wele I quod he / so ȝe endite
¶ Þerwith sche low / & seyde go we dyne
And Pandarus gan / at him self to iape fast
And seyde nece I haue so gret a pyne
ffor loue / þat euery oþer day I fast
And gan his beste / iapis forþ to cast
And made hire so / to lawhe at his folye
Þat sche for lauȝtere / wende for to deye
¶ And whan þat sche was com in to halle
Now em quod sche we wele go dyne a-non
And gan some of hire women for to calle
And streyt in-to hire chaumbere gan sche gon
But of hire besynesse was þis on
Amongis oþere þingis out of drede
fful preuyly þis lettere for to rede
// A-vysed euery word be word in euery lyne
And fond no lak sche þoute he coude good
And vp it putte & wente hire for to dyne
But pandarus þat in a stodie stod
Or he was war sche tok him be þe hond
And seyde ȝe were cauȝt or ȝe wiste
I vouche saf quod he do what ȝu liste
¶ Þo wesche þey & sette hem doun & ete
And aftyr non ful slyly þis pandaris
Gan drawe him tyl a window nyȝ þe strete
And seyde nece ho haþ arayed þus
Þe ȝondere hous þat stant a-forn vs
Wich hous quod sche & gan to beholde
And knew it wel & hos it was hym tolde
// And fellyn forþ in speche of þyngis smale
And setyn in þe windowe boþe tweyne
Whan Pandarus saw tyme to his tale
And saw wel þat hire folk were alle a-woye
Now nece myn tel on quod he I seye
How likyþ ȝow þe lettere þat ȝe wot
Can he þeron for be myn trouthe I not
¶ Þerwithal rosi hewid wex sche
And gan to humme & seyde so I trowe
Aquit it wel for godis loue seyþ he
Myn seluen þe medis wolde þe lettere sowe
And held his hondis vp & fel on knowe
Now goode nece be it neuere so lyte
Ȝif me þe labour I wil it sowe & plyte
¶ Ȝa for I can so write quod sche þo
And ek I not what I schulde him seye
Nay nece quod pandaris sey not so
Ȝit at þe leste þankiþ him I preye
Of his goode wil / o doþ him not to deye
Now for þe loue of god myn nece dere
Refuse it not at þis tyde be myn preyere
// Depardeus quod sche god leue al be wel
God help me so þis is þe ferste lettere
Þat euere I wrot ȝa al or euery del
And in to a closet forto auyse hire betere
Sche went a lone & gan hire herte onfetere
Out of disdaynys prisoun but a lite
And sat hire doun & gan a lettere wryte
¶ Of wych to telle in schort is myn entent
Þe effectis as fayre as I can vndyr-stonde
Sche þankede hym of al þat he wel ment
Towardis hire but holdyn him in holde
Sche nolde nouȝt ne makyn here self bonde
In loue but as his sustir him to plese
Sche wolde ay fayn don his hertete ese
// Sche schette it & to pandaris in [is in corrected] gan gon
Þere as he sat & lokede in to þe strete
Adoun sche sette hire bi him on a ston
Of iasper on a quysschyn gold I-bete
And seyde as wisely help [p corrected] me god þe grete
I neuere did a þyng with more peyne
Þan write þis to wich ȝe me constreyne
¶ And tok it him he þankede hire & seyde
God wot of þyngis ful ofte loþ be-gunne
Comyth ende god & nece myn Crisseyde
Þat ȝe to hym of hard now ben I-wonne
Auȝte he be glad by god & ȝoþer sonne
ffor whi men sey Impressiou[n]s lyȝt [Stanza 177 is repeated (but crosst out) on leaf 46. back, with 'ȝone' for 'ȝoþer' in l. 1237, and 'Impressions' in l. 1238.]
fful lyȝteli ben ay redi to þe flyȝt /
¶ But ȝe han pleyed þe tyraunt nyȝh to longe
And hard was it ȝoure herte for to graue
Now stynte þat ȝe no lengere on it honge
Al wolde ȝe þe forme of daunger saue
But hastyth ȝow to don him ioye haue
ffor trosteþ wel to longe don hardnesse
Causeþ dispit ful ofte for distresse
// And ryȝt as þey declamede þis matere
Lo Troylis riȝt at þe stretis ende
Come rydende with his tensum in fere
Al softely & þedirward gan bende
Þere as þey sete as was his way to wende
To paleys ward & Pandarus him aspiede
And seyde nece lo ho comyþ here rydende [dende corrected]
¶ O fle not in / he sey vs I suppose
Lest he may þynke þat ȝe him eschewe
Nay nay quod sche & wex as red as rose
With þat he gan hire / humili salue
With dredful chere & eft gan his hewis newe
And vp his lok debonerly he caste
And bekkede on Pandarus & forþ he passede
// God wot ȝif he sat on his hors a ryȝt
Or goodly was be-seyn þat ilke day
God wot where he was lyk a manli kn[y]ȝt
What schulde I dreche to telle of his aray
Cresseide with þay these [hese corrected] þyngis say
To tellyn schort / þey likede in fere
His person . his aray . his lok . his chere.
¶ His goodli maner & his gentilnesse
So wel þat neuere siþe þat sche was borne
Ne hadde sche swich reuthe of his distresse
And how so sche haþ hard ben here be-forne
To god hope / sche haþ now cauȝt a þorne
Sche schal not pulle it out þe nexte weyke
God sende ȝow sweche þornys on to pyke
// Pandarus with þat stod hire faste by
ffelte þe þorn hot & he be-gan to smyte
And seyde nece I prei ȝow hertely
Tel me þat I schal axe at ȝu a lite
A woman þat were of his deþ to wite
With-outyn his gilt but for here lak of reuthe
Were it wel don quod he / nay be myn treuthe
¶ God helpe me so quod he ȝe say me soþ
Ȝe fele wel ȝoure self þat I ne lye
Lo ȝondir he rit ȝa quod sche so he doþ
Wel quod pandar as I haue tolde ȝow þrye
Let ben ȝoure nyse schame & ȝoure folye
And speke with him in esynge of his herte
Let nysete not don ȝow boþe smerte
// But þeron was to heuyn & to done
Considerid alle þynge it may not be
And why{punctel} for speche / & it were ek to sone
To graunte him ȝit so gret a liberte
ffor pleynly hire entent as seyde sche
Was for to louyn him onwist ȝif sche myȝt
And guerdoun him with no þyng but with syȝt
¶ But pandarus þouȝte it schulde not ben so
Ȝif þat I may þis nyse opinioun
Schal not ben holde fully ȝeris too
What schuld I make of þis a long sarmoun
He muste asente on þat conclusioun
As for þe tyme & whanne þat it was eue
And al was wel / he ros & tok his leue
¶ And on his wey fulfaste homward he spedde
And ryȝt for ioye he felte his herte daunce
And troilus he fond a lone in bedde
Þat lay as don ȝe loueris in a traunce
Be-tweþe hope & derke disesperaunce
But Pandarus ryȝt at his incomynge
He song as ho seþ sumwhat I brynge
// And seyde who is in his bedde so sone
I-beried þus it am I þyn frende quod he
Who troylis nay help me so þe mone
Quod Pandarus þou schalt a-ryse & se
A charm þat was ryȝt now sent to þe
Þe whiche can hele þe of þyn accesse
So þat þou do forþ þyn besinesse
¶ Ȝa þour þe myȝt of god quod troilis
And pandarus gan him þe lettere take
And seyde parde god haþ holpin vs
Haue here a lettere & loke on alle þese blake
Lord ofte gan þe herte glade & quake
Of Troilus whil þat he gan it rede
So as þe wordis ȝeue hym hope & drede
// But finally he tok al for þe beste
Þat sche him wrot for sumwhat he be-hild
On whiche he þouȝte he myȝte his herte reste
Alle couered sche þo wordis vndyr schild
Þus to þe more worþi part he hel[d]
Þat what for hope & pandarus behest
His grete wo for-ȝede he at þe lest
¶ But as we may alda oure seluyn se
Þour more wode or cole þe more fere
Ryȝt so encreseþ hope of what it be
Þerwith ful oftyn creseþ ek desyre
Or as an ok comyþ of a lityl spyre
So þour þis lettere wich þat sche hym sende
Encresyn gan desyr of wych he brende
¶ Where-fore I say alway þat day & nyȝt
Þis Troylis gan to desiryn more
Þan he dede erst þour hope & dede his myȝt
To presen on as bi Pandarus lore
And writyn to hire of his sorwis sore
ffrom dai to day he let it not refreyde
Þat bi pandarus sumwhat he wrot & seyde
// And dede also hise oþere obseruauncis
Þat til a louere longiþ in þis cas
And aftyr þat his deis turnede on chauncis
So was he oþer glad oþer seyde allas
And held aftyr / hise gestis ay hise pas
And aftyr swiche answeris as he had
So were hise dais sori oþer glad
¶ But to pandarus was alwey his recours
And pitousli gan ay to him pleyne
And hym besoute of red or sum socours
And Pandarus þat say his wode peyne
Wex wol ner ded soþ to seyne
And busili with al his herte caste
Sum of his wo to slen an þat as faste
// And seide lord & frend & broþer dere
God wot þat þyn disese doþ me wo
But wilt þou stynt al þis woful chere
And be myn trouthe or it be dayis to
And god to-fore ȝit schal I schape it so
Þat þou schalt come into a certeyn place
Þere as þou mayst þyn self / preye hire of grace
¶ And certeynli I not ȝif þou it wost
But þo þat ben expert in loue it seye
Þat on of þe þyngis þat fer-rerith most
A man to han a leyser for to preye
And secret place his wo to be-wreye
ffor in good herte it mot sum reuthe in presse
To here & se þe gilteles in distrese
¶ Perauntyr þinkist þou þow it be so
Þat kynde wolde don hire for to begynne
To han a maner reuthe vp-on myn wo
Seyth daunger nay þou schalt me neuere wynne
So prenely hire herte goþ with-inne
Þat þow sche bende ȝit sche stond onrote
What [af corrected] affect is þis vnto myn bete
// Þynke here a-ȝens whan þat þe sturdi ok
On wich men hakke [hakke, hese, corrected] ofte for þe nonys
Receyuid haþ hese [hakke, hese, corrected] happy fallynge strok
Þe grete swey makiþ it to falle al at onys
3 As don þe rochis or þe melle stonys
ffor swiftere cours comyth thyng that is on weyghte
Whan it discendyth than don thyngis lyght
// But red that doun wyth euery blast doun
fful lyghtly sese wynd it wil aryse 3 [3-3 by a corrector]
But so wele not an ok whan it is cast
It nediþ me not longe þe forbise
Men schal reioye of a gret empresse
Acheuyd wel & stont with-outyn doute
Al han men ben þe lengere þereaboute
// But Troylis telle me now ȝif þe lyst
A þyng wich þat I schal axens [x, first 3 þe
Wich is þyn broper þat þou louis best
As in þyn veray herteis priuite
I-wis myn broþer deiphebus quod he
Quod Pandarus or ouris twies twelwe
He schal þe ese onwist of it hym selue
¶ Now let me a lone & werke as I may
Quod he & to deiphebus wente þo
Which hadde his lord & gret frend ben ay
Saue Troylis no man he louyd so
To telle in schort with-oute wordis mo
Quod Pandarus I preye þat ȝe be
ffrend to a cause which þat touchiþ me
¶ Ȝis parde quod deiphebus wel þou wist
In al þat euere I may & god to-fore
Al nere it but for man I loue most
Myn broþer troylus but sey wherefore
It is forsoþe þe day þat I was bore
I nas / neueuermore / to ben I þynke
A-ȝens a þyng þat myȝte þe forþynke
// Pandarus gan hym þanke & to hym seyde
Lo sere I haue a ladi in þis toun
Þat is myn nece & called is Cresseide
Wich summe men woldyn don oppressioun
And wrongli han hire possescioun
Wherfore I of ȝoure lordschepe I ȝow be-seche
To ben oure frend with-outyn more speche
¶ Deiphebus him answered o ist not þis
Þat þou spekist of to me þus straungely
Crisseyde myn frend he seide ȝis
Þanne nediþ quod deiphebus hardeli
No more of þis for trostiþ wel þat I
Wolde be hire chaumpioun with spere & ȝerde
I rouȝte not þow alle hire fois it herde
// But telle me how þou wolt of þis matere
If myȝte best auaile now lat se
Qod Pandarus / ȝif ȝe myn lord so dere
Woldin as now don þis honour to me
And preyin hire to morwe lo þat sche
Come on to þow hire pleyntis to deuyse
Hyre aduersarie wolde of it agryse
¶ And ȝif I more durste preye as now
And chargyn ȝu to han so gret trauayle
To han some of ȝoure breþeryn here with ȝu
Þat myȝtyn in hire cause bet auayle
Þat wot I wel sche myȝte neuere fayle
ffor to ben holpin what at ȝoure instaunce
What with hire oþere frendis gouernaunce
¶ Deiphebus with þat comyn was of kynde
To alle honour & bounte to consent
Answerede it schal be don & I can fynde
Ȝit grettere helpe to þis in myn entent
What wilt þou seyn ȝif I for eline sent
To speke of þis I trowe it be þe best
ffor sche may lede paris as hire lest
// Ector with þat is myn lord myn broþer
It nediþ not to prey him oure frend to be
ffor I haue herd him o tyme & ek oþer
Spokyn of cresseyde swich honour þat he
May seyn no bet swich hap to hym haþ sche
It nediþ not his helpe more craue
He schal ben swich riȝt as we welyn him haue
¶ Spek þou þyn self also to troilis
On myn behalue & prey him with vs dyne
Sire al þis schal be don quod pandarus
And tok his leue & neuere gan to fyne
But he to his necis hous streit as lyne
He come & fond hire at mete a-ryse
And sat him doun & spak riȝt in þis wise
// He seide o veray god so haue I ronne
lo nece myn lo how I swete
I not wher ȝe þe more þank me cunne
Be ȝe not war how fals Poliphete
Is now eft-sonys a-boute for to plete
And brynge on ȝow aduocatis newe
I not quod sche & chonged al hire hewe
¶ What is he more a-boute me to drech
And don me wrong what schal I do allas
Ȝit of him self ȝit wolde I no þyng rech
Ne were it for antenore & eneas
Þat ben his frendis in swich cas
But for þe loue of god myn vnkele dere
No fors of þat let him han al in fere
¶ With-outyn þat I haue i-now for vs
Nay quod pandarus it schal no þyng ben so
ffor I haue ryȝt now ben at deiphebus
At ector & at myne oþere lordis mo
And schortli mad eche of hem his fo
Þat bi myn þrift he schal it neuere wynne
ffor ouȝt he can whan so euere he gynne
// And as þey castyn what was best to done
Deiphebus of his owene curteysi
Come hire to preie in his owene propere persone
To holde him on þe morwe cumpany
At dyner which sche nulde not deny
But goodely gan to his preyer obeye
He þankede hire & wente forþ his weye
¶ Whan þis was don þis pandarus vp a non
To telle in schort & forþ he gan to wende
To troilus as stille as ony ston
And al þis þyng he told hym word & ende
And how þat he deiphebus gan to blende
And seide now is tyme ȝif þat þou cunne
To bere þe wel to morw & al is wonne
// Now speke now preye & pitously compleyne
Let not for nyse schame or dred or slouthe
Sumtime a man mote telle his peyne [peyne corrected]
Beleue & sche schal han on þe routhe
Þou schalt ben sauyd be þyn feyþ in trouthe
But wel I wot þat þow art now in drede
And what it is I ley i can it rede
¶ Þow þynkist now how schulde I do al þis
ffor bi swiche cheris mustyn folk aspie
Þat for hire loue is þat I fare a mys
Ȝit hadde I leuere vnwyst for sorwe to deye
Non þyng soo [thyng soo corrected] / for þou dost gret folye
ffor I riȝt now haue fonden on manere
Off sleyȝt for to keueren al þyn chere
¶ Þou schat gon ouer nyȝt & þat beluye
On-to deiphebus hous as þe to pleye
Þyn malady a-woy þe bet to dryue
ffor whi þou semyst sik soþ for to seye
Sone aftyr þat doun in þin bed þe leie
And sei þou mayȝt no lengere vp endure
And ly riȝt þere & abyd þyn auenture
// Sey þat feuere iswont þe to taken
Þe same tyme & lestyn til on þe morwe
And lat it sen how þou canst it makyn
ffor parde syk is he þat is in sorwyn
So now far wel & venus here to borwe
I hope & þou þis purpos hold ferme
Þyn grace sche schal þe fulli conferme
¶ Qud Troilus I-wis now nedeles
Conseilist me þat sekly I me feyne
ffor I am sek in ernest douteles
So þat wol nyh I sterue for þe peyne
Quod Pandarus þou schalt þe betere pleyne
And hast lasse nede þe to countyrfete
ffor hym men deme hot þat men sen swete

Soone after þis for þat fortune it wolde.
I-comen was þe blysful tyme swete.
That Troylus was warned þat he shulde.
Ther he was erst Criseyde his lady mete.
For which he felt his herte in Ioye flete.
And feythfully gan alle þe goddes herye.
And lat se now yf þat he kan be merye.
And holden was þe forme and al þe wyse.
Of here comynge. and of his also.
As it was erst whych nedeth nought deuyse.
But playnly to þe effect right for to go.
In Ioye and seurte Pandarus hem two.
A-bedde brought whan þat hem boþe leste.
And þei ben in quyete and yn reste.
Nought nedeþ it to yow syn þey ben met.
To aske at me yf þat þey blyþe were.
For yf it erst was wel þo was it bet.
A þousand fold þis nedeþ not enquere.
A gon was euery sorwe and euery fere.
And boþe y-wys þey hadde and so þey wende.
As muche Ioye as herte may complende.
This is no litel þyng of for to seye.
This passeth euery wyt for to deuyse.
For eche of hem gan oþeres lust obeye.
Felicite which þat þese clerkes wyse.
Commenden so. ne may not here suffice.
This Ioye may not y-wrete ben with Inke.
This passeth al þat herte may by-þenke.
But cruel day so wel-awey þe stounde.
Gan for to a-proche as þey by synes knewe.
For which hem þoughte felen dethes wounde.
So wo was hem þat changen gan here hewe.
And day þey gonnen to dispise al newe.
Callyng it traytous enuyous and worse.
And bitterly þe dayes light þey curse.
Quod Troylus now am I war.
That Piros and þo swyfte stedes þre.
which þat drawen forth þe sonnes char.
Han gon som by-path in despit of me.
That makeþ it so soone day to be.
And for þe sonne hym hasteth þus to ryse.
Ne shal I neuere don here sacrifice.
But nedes day departe moste hem soone.
And whanne here speche don was and here chere.
They twynne a-noon as þey were woned to done.
And setten tyme of metyng eft y-fere.
And many a nyght þey wrought yn þis manere.
And þus Fortune a tyme ladde In Ioye.
Criseyde and ek þis kynges sone of Troye.
In suffisaunce In blisse and in syngynges.
This Troylus gan al his lyf to lede.
He spendeth Iusteth maketh festeynynges.
He yeueth frely ofte. and chaungeth wede.
And held hym aboute alwey out of drede.
A world of folk. as kam hym wel of kynde.
The fresshest and þe beste he koude fynde.
Þat swych a voys was of hym and [a] steuene.
Thorugh-out þe world of honour and largesse.
That it rong vp in-to þe yate of heuene.
And as in loue he was yn swych gladnesse.
That in his herte he demede as I gesse.
That þere nys louere in þis world at ese.
So wel as he and þus gan loue hym plese.
The goodlihede or beaute which þat kynde.
In ony oþer lady hadde y-set.
Kan not þe mountaunce of a knot vnbynde.
A-boute his herte of al Criseydes net.
He was so narwe y-maked and y-knet.
That it vndon on any manere syde.
That nyl not ben for ought þat may be-tide.
And by þe hond ful ofte he wolde take.
This Pandarus and in-to gardeyn lede.
And swych a feste and swych a proces make.
Hym of Criseyde / and of here womanhede.
And of here beaute / þat with-outen drede.
It was an heuene his wordes for to here.
And þanne he wolde synge in þis manere.

LG.HEAD: (250) (Troilus's Song of Love, 1; adapted from Boethius.)
LG.L: Loue þat of erþe and se hath gouernaunce.
Loue þat his heste hath in heuene hye.
Love þat with an holsom alliaunce.
Halt peples Ioyned as hem lyst hym gye.
Loue þat knetteth lawe of companye.
And couples doth in vertu for to dwelle.
Bynd þis a-cord / þat I haue told and telle.

LG.HEAD: (251) (Troilus's Song. 2.)
LG.L: That þat þe world with feyth which þat is stable.
Dyuerseth so his stoundes concordynge.
That elementes þat ben so discordable.
Holden a bond perpetuely durynge.
That Phebus mot his rosy day forth brynge.
And þat þe mone hath lordship ouer þe nyghtes.
Al þis doth loue. ay heryed be his myghtes.

LG.HEAD: (252) (Troilus's Song. 3.)
LG.L: That þat þe se þat gredy is to flowen.
Constreyne to a certeyn ende so.
His flodes þat freshly þey ne growen.
To drenchen erthe / and al for euere mo.
And yf þat loue ought late his bridel go.
Al þat now loueth a-sonder sholde lepe.
And al were lost þat loue halt now to hepe.

LG.HEAD: (253) (Troilus's Song. 4.)
LG.L: So wolde god þat Auctor is of kynde.
That with his bond / loue of his vertu liste.
To cerchen hertes alle and faste bynde.
That from his bond no wight þe weye out wyste.
And hertes colde hem wolde I þat he it wyste.
To make hem loue. and þat hem lest ay rewe.
On hertes sore / and kep hem þat ben trewe.
In alle nedes for þe townes werre.
He was and ay þe firste in armes dight.
And certaynly but if þat bokes erre.
Saue Ector most y-drad of ony wight.
And þis encres of hardinesse & myght.
Cam hym of loue. his ladyes þank to wynne.
That altered his spirit so with-Inne.

LG.HEAD: (255) [Caxton puts st. 255 after 259. Herl. 1239 has it here.]
LG.L: In tyme of trewe. on haukynge wolde ryde.
Or elles hunten. bore. beere. or lyoun.
The smale bestes leet he gon by syde.
And whan þat he com rydynge in to town.
Ful ofte his lady from hire wyndow down.
As frescħ as fawkon cometh out of muwe.
Ful redy was hym goodly to saluwe.
And most of loue and vertu was his speche.
And in despit hadde alle wrecchednesse.
And douteles no nede was hym byseche.
To honouren hem þat hadde worthynesse.
And esen hem þat weren in distresse.
And glad was he yf any wyght wel ferde.
That louere was. whan he it wyste or herde.
For soth to seyn he lost held euery wyght.
But yf he were in loues heyghe seruyse.
I. mene folk þat oughte it ben of right.
And ouer al þis so wel koude he deuyse.
Of sentement. and in so vnkow wyse.
Al his aray. þat euery louere þoughte.
That al was wel what-so he seyde or wroughte.
And þough þat he be come of blod royal.
Lyst hym of pride at no wyght for to chase.
Benygne he was to ech yn general.
For which he gat hym þank in euery place.
Thus wold loue y-heryed be his grace.
That Pride / enuye / Ire / and auaryce.
He gan to fle. and euery oþer vice.
Thow lady bryght þe doughter to Dyone.
Thy blynde and wynged sone ek daun Cupide.
Ye sustren nyne ek þat by Elycone.
I. hil parnaso lysten for to a-byde.
That ye þus fer han deyned me to gyde.
I kan no more but syn þat ye wol wende.
Ye heryed ben for ay with-outen ende.
Thourgh yow haue I seyd fully in my song.
Theffect and Ioye of Troylus seruyce.
Al be þat þere was som dishese a-mong.
As to myn Auctor listeþ to deuyse.
My þridde book now ende Ich in þis wys.
And Troylus in lust and in quiete.
Is with Criseyde his owne herte swete.

HEADNOTE.P: [Harleian MS. 2280, leaf 35.]
[The tagd f, g, k, t, of the MS. are not printed in this 3rd book.]

LG.L: Oblisful light of which þe bemes clere
Adorneth all the thridde heuene fayre
O sonnes lief o Ioues doughter dere
Plesaunce o love o godely debonaire
In gentil hertes ay redy to repayre
O verray cause of hele and of gladdenesse
Iheried be þi myght and thy goodenesse
¶ In heuene and helle and erhte and salt se
Is felt þi myght If þat I wol descerne
As man / bryd / best / fissh / herbe and grene tre
The fele in tymes with vapour eterne
God loueth and to loue wol nougth werne
And in þis world no lyues creature
With-outen loue is worth or may endure
¶ Ye Ioues first to thike effectes glade
Thorugh which þat thynges lyuen al and be
Comeueden and amoreux hem made
On mortal thynge and as ȝow list ay ye
Ȝeue hym in loue ese or aduersite
And in a thousand formes down hym sente
For loue in erthe and ȝow list he hente
¶ Ye fierse mars apasen of his Ire
And as ȝow list . ȝe maken hertes digne
Algates hym þat ȝe wol sette a fyre
Þei dreden shame and vices þei resigne
Ȝe do hem curteis be fresshe and benigne
And heigh or lawe eftir a wight entendeth
Þe Ioies þat he hath ȝoure myght it sendeth
Ȝe holden regne and hous in vnite
Ȝe sothfast cause of frendschipe ben also
Ȝe knowe al þilke couerd qualite
Of thynges which þat folk on wondren so
when þei kan naught construe how it may Io
She loueth hym or why he loueth here [here later]
As why þis fish and naught cometh to were
¶ Ye folk a lawe han sette in vniuerse
And þis know I by hem þat loueres be
Þat who-so stryueth [first streyneth] with ȝow hath þe worse
Now lady bryght for þi benignite
At reuerence of hem þat seruen the
whos clerc I am so techeth me deuyse
Som Ioie of þat is felt in þi seruyse
¶ Ye in my naked herte sentement
In hielde / and do me shew of þi sweniesse [or swemesse]
Caliope thy uois be now presente
For now is nede sestow nought my distresse
How I mot telle a-non righ the gladnesse
Of troilus to Venus herynge
To which who nede hath god hym brynge

DIV3.P: Incipit liber tercius

LG.L: LAY al this mene while Troilus
Recordynge his lesson in this manere
Mayfey thought he thus wol I seye and thus
Thus wol I pleyne vn-to my lady deere
Þat worde is goode and þis shal be my chere
Þis nyl I nought forȝeten in no wyse
God leue hym werken as he gan deuyse
¶ And lord so þat his herte gan to quappe
Heryng hire com and short for to sike
And Pandarus þat ledde hire by þe lappe
Com ner and gan in at þe curtyn pike
And seyde god do bote on alle sike
Se who is here ȝow comen to vysite
lo here is she þat is ȝowre deth to wyte
¶ Þer-with it semed as he vepte almost
ha a quod Troilus so reufully
wher me be wo o myghty god thow wost
who is al ther I se nought trewly
Sire quod Criseyde it is Pandare and I
Ȝe swete herte allas I may nought rise
To knele and do ȝow honour in som wyse
¶ And dressed hym vpwarde and she right tho
Gan both hire hondes soft vp on hym leye
O for þe loue of god do ȝe nought so
To me quod she I what is þis to seye
Syr comen am I to ȝow for causes tweye
First ȝow to thanke and of ȝowre lordshipe eke
Continuaunce I wolde ȝow byseke
¶ This Troilus þat herde his lady preye
Of lordship hym wex neyther quyk ne dede
Ne myght o worde for shame to it seye
Al though men shold smyten of his hed
But lord so he wex so deynlyche rede
And sire his lesson þat he wende konne
To preyen hire is thorugh his wit yronne
¶ Criseyde al þis aspied wel ynough
For she was wis and loued hym neuere þe lasse
Al ner he malapert or made it tough
Or was to bold to synge a fole a masse
But when his shame gan somwhat to passe
His resons as I may my rymes holde
I ȝow wol telle as techen bokes olde
¶ In chaunged vois right for his verray drede
Which vois ek quook and ther-to his manere
Goodly abayst / and now his hewes rede
Now pale vnto Criseyde his lady deere
with loke down cast and humble I-ȝolden chere
Lo the alderfirst worde þat hym asferte [f alterd]
was tweyes mercy mercy swete herte
¶ And stynte a while and when he myght oute brynge
Þe next word was god woot for I haue
As faithfully as I haue hadde konnynge
Ben ȝoures alle god so my soule saue
and shal tyl þat I woful wight be graue
And though I dar ne kan vn to ȝow pleyne
I-wis I suffer naugh the lasse peyne.
¶ Thus muche as now o wommanlich wif
I may oute brynge and If this ȝowe displees
Þat shal I wreke vp-on myn owen lif
Right soon I trow and do ȝour herte an ese
If with my deth ȝoure herte may apese
But syn that ȝe han herd me somwhat seye
Now reche I neuere how soon þat I deye
¶ Ther-with his manly sorwe to be-holde
It myght han maad an herte of stone to rew
And Pandare wep as he to water wold
And puked euer his nece new and newe
And seyde wo bigon ben hertes trewe
For loue of god make of þis thyng an ende
Or sle vs both atones er þat ȝe wende
¶ I what quod she by god and by my trowthe
I not nat what ȝe wilne þat I seye
I what quod he þat ȝe han on hym rewthe
For goddes loue and doth hym nought to deye
Now þan thus quod she I wolde hym preye
To telle me þe fyn of his entente
Ȝet wiste I neuere wel what þat he mente
¶ what þat I mene o swete herte deere
Quod Troilus o goodely fressh fre
That with the stremes of ȝoure eighen clere
Ȝe wolde som tyme freshely on me se
And þanne a-green þat I may ben he
With-outen braunche of vyce on any wyse
In trowth alway to don ȝow my seruyse
¶ As to my lady right and chief resorte
Which al my wit and al my diligence
And to han right as ȝow list conforte
Vnder youre ȝerde egal to myn offence
as deth If þat I breke ȝoure defence
as þat ȝe deigne me so muchel honoure
Me to comaunden aught in any houre
¶ And I to ben ȝoure verray humble trewe
Secret / and in my peynes pacient
And euere mo desiren freshly newe
To seruen / and ben ay ylike diligent
And with goode herte al holly ȝoure talent
Receyuen wel how soore þat me smerte
Lo this mene .I. myn owen swete herte
¶ Quod pandarus lo here an hard requeste
And resonable a lady for to warne
Now nece myn by natal Ioues feste
Were I a god ȝe sholden sterue as ȝerne
Þat heren wel þis man wol no thyng desire ȝerne
But ȝour honoure and sen hym almost sterue
And ben so loth to suffre hym ȝow serue
¶ With that she gan hire eyen on hym caste
Ful esyly and ful debonayrly
Auysynge hire and hyed nought to faste
With neuere a word but seyde hym softly
Myn honour sauf I wol wel trewly
And in swiche forme as he gan now deuyse
Receyuen hym fully to my seruyse
¶ Besechynge hym for goddes loue þat he
wolden in honour of treuthe and gentilnesse
As I wol mene ek menen wele to me
and myn honour with wit and bysinesse
Ay kepe and if I may don hym gladdenesse
From hennes forth I-wis I nyl nought feyne
Now beth al hoole no longer ȝe ne pleyne
¶ But natheles þis werne I ȝow quod she
a kynge some although ȝe be I-wis
Ȝe shul namore han souereynte
Of me in loue than right in þat cas is
Ny nyl forbere if þat ȝe don amys
To wreth ȝow and whil þat ȝe me serue
Chericen ȝow right efter ȝe disserue
¶ And shortly deere herte and al my knyghte
Betht glad and drawet ȝow to lustinesse
And I shal trewly with al my myght
Ȝour bittre tornen al in to swettenesse
If I be she at may ȝow do gladnesse
For euery wo ȝe shal recouere a blisse
And hym in armes took and gan hym kysse
¶ Fil Pandarus on knees and vp his yen
To heuene trewe and helde hise hondes highe
Inmortal god quod he that maist nought dyen
Cupide I mene of this maist glorifye
And venus thow maist maken melodye
with-outen honde me semeth that in þe towne
For þis merueille ich here ich belle sowne
¶ But ho namore as now of þis matere
For-why þis folk wol comen vp a-non
Þat han þe lettre red lo I hem here
But I coniure þe Crisseyde and oon
And two thow Troilus when thow maist gon
That at myn hous ȝe ben at my warnynge
For I ful wele shal shape ȝoure comynge
¶ And eseth there ȝoure hertes right ynough
And lat se which of ȝow shal here þe belle
To speke of loue a-right and ther-with he lough
For ther have ȝe a layser for to telle
Quod Troilus how longe shal I dwelle
Er this be don quod he whan thou maist rise
This thyng shal be / right as I ȝow deuyse
¶ With þat Eleyne and also Deiphebus
Tho comen vpward right at þe steyres ende
And lord so schame gan greuen Troilus
His brother and his suster for to blende
Quod Pandarus it tyme is þat we wende
Tak nece myn ȝoure leue at alle thre
And lat hem spek and cometh forth with me
¶ She toke hire leue at hem ful thriftily
as she wel koude / and they hire reuerence
Vn to þe fulle / diden hardily
and wonder wel speken in hire absens
Of hire in preysynge of hire excellence
Hire governaunce hire wit and hire manere
Comendiden it Ioie was to here
¶ Now lat hire wende vnto hire owen place
And torne we Troilus a-ȝeyn
Þat ful lightly / gan of þe letre pace
Þat Deiphebus hadde in þe gardyn seyn
And of Eleyne and hym deiphebus he wolde feyne
Deluled ben and seyde þat hym leste
To slepe and efter tales han reste
¶ Eleyne hym kyste and toke hire leue blyue
Deiphebus ek and hom wente euery wyght
and Pandarus as fast as he may dryue
To Troilus tho com as lyne right
and on a pailet al þat glade nyght
By Troilus he lay with mery chere
To tale / and wel was hym þei were Ifere
Whan euery wyght was voyded but þey two.
And alle þe dores were faste y-shette.
To telle in short with-oute wordes mo.
This Pandarus with-outen ony lette.
Vp ros and on his beddes side hym sette.
And gan to speke in a sobre wyse.
To Troylus as I shal yow deuyse.
Myn alderleuest lord and broþer dere.
God wot and þow þat it sat me sore.
when I þe saw so langwysshyng to yere.
For loue of which þi wo wax alwey more.
That I with al my myght and al my lore.
Haue euere sethen do my bysynesse.
To brynge þe to Ioye out of distresse
¶ And haue it brought to swicho plit as thow woost
So þat thorugh me thow stondest now in weye
To faren wel I seye it for no boste
And wostow why for shame it is to seye
For the haue I bigonne a gamen pleye
whiche þat I neuere do shal eft for othere
Al-though he were a thousand fold my brother
¶ Þat is to seye for þe am I bicomen
By-twyxen gam and ernest swich a meene
As maken wommen vnto men to comen
Al seye I nought thow wost wel what I mene
For the haue I my nece of vices clene
So fully maad thy gentileste triste
Þat al be shal right as thy seluen liste
¶ But god þat al woote tak I to wittenesse
Þat neuere I þis for coueytise Iwroughte
But onely for tabregge that distresse
For which wel neigh thow dydest as me thoughte
But goode brother do now as the aughte
For goddes loue and kepe hyre oute of blame
Syn thow art wis and saue alwey hire name
¶ For wele thow woost þe name as ȝet of here
Among þe peple as who soith halowed is
For þat man is vn-bore I dar wel swere
Þat euere wiste þat she dide amys
But wo is me þat I þat cause al this
May thenken þat she is my nece deere
And I hire em and tractor ek Ifeere
¶ And were it wist þat I thorwh myn eyen
Hadde in my nece y-put þis fantasye
To don þi luste and holly to ben thyn
why al þe worlde vp-on it wolde crye
And seyn þat I / the werste trecherye
Dide in þis cas þat euere was bygonne
and she for-loste / and thow right nought ywonne
¶ Wher-fore er I wol forther gon a pas
Ȝet eft y the biseche and fully seye
Þat pryuete go with vs in this caas
Þat is to seyn / þat thow vs neuere wreye
And be not wroth though I þe oft preye
To holden secre swich an heigh matere [erasure: tere writ∣ten in the margin.]
For skylful is thow woost wel my preyere
¶ And thynk what wo þer hath bityd or this
For makynge of auauntes as men rede
And what meschaunce in þis worlde ȝet þer is
Fro day to day right for þat wikked dede
For which þis wise clerkes that ben dede
han euere this prouerbed to vs ȝong
Þat first vertu is to kepe tonge
¶ And ner it þat I wilne as now tabregge
Diffusion of speche I koude al-moost
a thousand olde stories the alegge
Of wommen lost thorugh fals and fooles bost
Prouerbes kanst þi self I-now and woost
Aȝeyns þat vice for to ben a labbe
Al seyd men soth as often as they gabbe
¶ O tong allas so often here biforne
Hastow made many a lady bright of hewe
Seyd waylawey þe day þat I was born
And many a maydes sorwes for to newe
And for þe more part al is vntrewe
Þat men of ȝelpe / and It were brought to preue
Of kynde non auauntour is to leue
¶ Auauntour and a lyer al is oone
As thus I pose womman graunte me
Hire loue / and seith þat other wol she noon
And I am sworn to holden it secree
And efter I go telle it two or thre
I-wis I am auauntour at þe leeste
And lyer for I breke my byheste
¶ Now loke þan If they be nought to blame
Swich manere folk what shal I clepe hem what
Þat hem auaunte wommen and by name
Þat ȝet biheighte hem neuere þis ne þat
Ne knew hem more þan myn old hatte
No wonder is so god me sende hele
Though wommen dreden with vs men to deele
¶ I seye nought þis for no mystruste of ȝowe
Ne for no wyse men but for fooles nyce
And for þe harme þat in þe world is now
as wol for folye oft as for malice
For wel woot I in wyse folk þat vice
No womman drat if she be wel avised
For wise ben by foles harm chastised
¶ But now to purpos leeue brother deere
Haue al þis thyng / þat I haue seyde in mynde
And kepe þe clos and be now of goode chere
For at þi day thow shalt me trew fynde
I shal þi processe sette in swiche a kynde
and god to-forn þat it shal þe suffise
For it shal ben right as þow wolt deuyse
¶ For wel I woot thow menest wel parde
Þer-for I dar this fully vndertake
Thow woost ek what thy lady graunted þe
And day is set þe charres vp to make
Haue now goode nyght I may no longer wake
and bid for me syn thow ert now in blisse
Þat god me sende deth or soone lesse
¶ Who myghte tellen half þe Ioye or feest
whiche þat þe soule of Troilus tho felte
Herynge theffecte of Pandarus biheste
His old wo þat made his herte swelte
Gan tho for Ioye wasten and to-melte
And al þe rechesse of [his] sikes soore
Atones fledde he felte of hem namore
¶ But right so as þis holtes and þis hayis
Þat han in wynter dede ben and drye
Reuesten hem in greene when þat may is
When euery lusty lyketh best to pleye
Righte in þat selue wyse soth for to seye
Wax sodeynliche his herte ful of Ioie
Þat gladdere was þer neuer man in Troye
¶ And gan his looke on Pandarus vp caste
Ful sobrely and frendly for to se
And seyde frend in aperil the laste
as wel thow woost if it remembre the
How neigh þe deth for wo thow founde me
And how thow didest al þi besynesse
To know of me þe cause of my distresse
¶ Thow woost how longe ich for-bare to seye
To þe þat ert þe man þat I best triste
And peril non was it to þe biwreye
Þat wiste I wele but telle me if þe liste
Sith I so loth was þat þi self it wiste
How dorst I mo tellen of þis matere
Þat quake now and no wight may us here
¶ But natheles by þat god I the sweere
Þat as hym list may al þis world gouerne
And if I lye achilles with his speere
Myn herte clene alle were my lyfe eterne
as I am mortal If I late or ȝene
wold it biwreye or dorst or sholde konne
For alle þe goode þat god made vnder sonne
¶ Þat rather deye I wolde and determyne
As thynketh me now stokked in prisone
In wrechednesse in filthe and vermyne
Caytif to cruel kinge agamenoun
And þis in alle þe temples of þis town
Vp-on þe goddes alle I wil the swere
To morwe day if þat it liketh þe here
¶ And þat thow hast so much I-do for me
Þat I ne may it neuere more disserue
Þis knowe I wel al myghte I now for þe
A thousand tymes on a morwen sterue
I kan namore but þat I wol þe serue
Right as þi sclaue whider so thow wende
For euere more vnto my lyues ende
¶ But here with al myn herte I þe biche
Þat neuere in me thow deme swiche folye
As I shal seyn me thoughte by thy speche
Þat þis whiche thow me doste for companye
I shold wene it were a bauderye
I am nought wode alle If I lewed be
It is nought so þat woot I wel parde
¶ But he þat goth for gold or for richesse
On swich message cal hem what þe liste
and þis þat thow dost calle it gentilnesse
Compassyon and felawshyp and truste
Departe it so for wide where is wiste
How þat þer is dyuersite requered
Bytwexen thynges lyke as I haue lered
¶ And þat thow knowe I thynke nought ne wene
Þat þis seruyse a shame be or Iape
I have my faire suster Polixene
Cassandre Eleyne or any of þe frape
Be she neuere so faire or wel I-shape
Tel which thow wilt of euerychon
To han for thyn and lat me þanne allone
¶ But sith þat þow hast don me þis seruyse
My lif to saue and for non hope of mede
So for þe loue of god þis grete emprise
Parforne it out for now is most nede
For heigh a lough with-outen any drede
I wol alway þine hestis alle kepe
Haue now gode nyght and lat vs both slepe
¶ Þus held hym ich of other wel apayed
Þat al the world ne myghte it bet amende
And on þe morwen when they were arayed
Ech to his owen nedes gan entende
But Troilus thought as þe fire he brende
For sharpe desire of hope and o plesaunce
He nought for-gat his goode gouernaunce
¶ But in hym self with manhode gan restreyne
Ech rackle dede and ech vnbrideled chere
Þat al tho þat lyuen soth to seyne
Ne sholde han wiste by word or by manere
what þat he mente as touchynge þis matere
From euery wyght as fer as is þe cloude
He was so wele dissimulen he koude
¶ And al þe while which þat I ȝow deuyse
Þis was his lyf with al his ful myghte
By day he was in martes heighe seruyse
Þis is to seyn in armes as a knyghte
And for þe more part þe longe nyght
He lay and thought how þat he myght serue
His lady best hire thonke for to deserue
¶ Nyl I nought swere al-though he lay soft
Þat in his thought he nas somwhat disesede
Ne þat he torned on his pilous oft
And wald of þat he myssed han ben sesed
But in swich cas men is nought alwey plesed
For ought I woot namore þan was he
Þat kan I deme of possibilite
¶ But certeyn is to purpos for to go
Þat in þis whiche as writen is in geste
Ȝe say his lady som tyme and also
She with hym spake when þat she dorst or liste
And by hire bothe auys as was þe beste
apoynteden ful warly in þis nede
So as they dorst / how they wolden procede
¶ But it was spoken in so short a wyse
In swich awayt alwey and in swich fere
Lest any wight deuynen or deuyse
wold of hem two or to it ley an ere
Þat al þis world so leue to hem ne were
As þat cupide wold hem grace sende
To maken of hire speche a-right an ende
¶ But þilk litel þat they spake or wrought
His wis goost took ay of al swich hede
It semed hire he west what she thought
with-outen word so þat was no nede
To bid hym ought to don or ought forbede
For which she tought þat loue al come it late
Of al Ioie hadde opned hire þe ȝate
¶ And shortly of þis proces for to pace
So wel his werk and wordes he bisette
Þat he so ful stood in his lady grace
Þat twenti thousand tymes or she lette
She thanked god þat euere she with hym mette
So koude he hym gouerne in swich seruyse
Þat al þe world ne myght it bet auyse
¶ For-why she fonde hym so discrete in al
So secrete and of swich obeysaunce
Þat wel she felte he was to hire a wal
Of stiel / and shield from euery displesaunce
That to be in his good gouernaunce
So wis he was she was namore afered
I mene as fer as ought ben requered
¶ And Pandarus to quyke alwey þe fire
was euere yhold prest and diligent
To ese his frende was sette al his desire
He shof ay on he to and fro was sent
He lettres bar whan Troilus was absente
Þat neuere man as in his frendes nede
Ne ber hym bet þanne he with-outen drede
¶ But now paraunter som man wayten wolde
Þat euery worde or sond or looke or chere
Of Troilus / that I rehercen sholde
In al þis while vn-to his lady deere
I trowe it were a longe thynge for to here
Or of what wight þat stant in swich disioynte
His wordes alle or euery look / to poynte
¶ For soth I haue naught herd it don er this
In stone non / ne no man here I weene
And though I wolde I koude nought I-wis
For þer was som Epistel hem bytwene
Þat walde as seith myn auctour wele contene
Neigh half þis boke of which hym liste nought wryte
How shol I þanne a lyne of it endite
¶ But to þe grete effect / þanne sey I þus
Þat stondyng / in concord and in quiete
Þis ilk two . Criseide and Troilus
As I haue tolde / and in þis tyme swete
Saue only often myghte they not mete
Ne layser haue hire speches to fulfille
Þat it befel right as I shal ȝow telle
¶ Þat Pandarus þat euere dide his myght
Right for þe fyn that I shal spek of here
As for to bryngen to his hous som nyghte
His faire nece and Troilus yfere
Wher as at layser al þis he matere
Touchynge hire loue wer at þe fulle vp bounde
Hadde oute of doute a tyme to it founde
¶ For he with grete deliberacioun
hadde euery thynge þat here-to myght availle
Forncast and put in execucioun
And noither left for cost ne for trauaile
Come if hem lest hym shold no thynge faille
And for to ben in oughte aspied thare
Þat wiste he wel an impossible were
¶ Dredeles it clere was in the wynde
Of euery pie And euery lette game
Now alle is wel for al þe world is blynde
In þis matere both fremed and tame
Þis tymbyr is al redy vp to frame
Vs lakketh nought but þat we witen wolde
A certein oure in whiche she comen sholde
¶ And Troilus þat al this purveiaunce
And at þe fulle and waited on it ay
Hadde here-vp-on ek / made grete ordinaunce
And fonde his cause and ther-to his aray
If that he were myssed nyght or day
Ther while he was a-bouten þis seruyse
Þat he was gon to don his sacrifise
¶ And moste at swhich a temple allone wake
Answerde of apollo for to be
And first to sen the holy laurer quake
Er þat appollo spake oute of the tre
To telle hym next when grekes shold fle
And for-thi lette hym no man god for-bede
But preye apollo helpen in þis nede
¶ Now is ther litel more for to doone
But Pandare vp and shortily for to seyne
Right soone vp-on the chaungynge of þe moone
when lightlees is þe world a nyght or tweyne
And þat þe walken shope hym for to reyne
He streight o morwe vn-to his nece wente
Ȝe han wel herde þe fyn of his entente
¶ Whan he was come he gan a-non to pleye
As he was wont and of hym self to Iape
And finaly he swore and gan hire seye
Bi this and þat she shold hym nought escape
Ne lenger don hym efter hire to cape
But certeinly she most by hire leue
Come soupen in his hous with hym at eue
¶ At which she lough and gan hire faste excuse
And seyde it reyneth lo how shold I gon
Lat be quod he ne stant nought þus to muse
Þis mot be done ȝe shal be þer onon
So at þe last here-of they fel attone
Or elles soft he swor hire in hire ere
He nolde neuere comen ther she were
¶ Soone after þis she to hym gan to rowne
And axed hym if Troilus wer there
He swor hire nay for he was oute of town
And seyde nece I pose þat he were
Þow thruste neuere han þe more fere
For rather þan men myght hym ther aspie
Me were leuer a thousand folde deye
¶ Nough list myn auctour fully to declare
what þat she þought when he seyde so
Þat Troilus was oute of town I-fare
As if he seyde ther-of soth or no
But þat with a-wayt with hym to go
She graunted hym sith he hire þat bisoughte
And as his nece obeyed as hire oughte
¶ But natheles ȝett gan she hym biseche
Al-though with hym to gon it was no fere
For it to be war of goosish peples speche
Þat dremen thynges which as neuere were
And wel auyse hym whom he brought there
And seyde hym Em syn I most on ȝow triste
Look al be wel do / now as ȝow liste
¶ He swor hire þis by stokkes and by stones
And by the goddes þat in heuene dwelle
Or elles were hym leuere soule and bones
with Pluto kynge as depe ben in helle
as Tantalus what shold I more telle
when alle was wel he roos and tooke his leue
And she to soper come when it was eue
¶ With a certeyn of hire own men
And with hire faire nece antigone
And other of hire wommen nyne or ten
But who was glade now who as trowe ȝe
But troilus þat stood and myght it se
Thorugh-out a litel wyndowe in a stewe
Ther he bishet sen myndnyght was in muwe
¶ Wnwist of euery wyght but of Pandare
But to þe pointe now when she was come
with alle Ioie [and] alle frendes fare
Hire Em anon in armes hath hire nome
And efter to the soper alle and some
when tyme was ful soft they hem sette
God woot ther was no deynte for to fette
¶ And after soper gonnen they to ryse
At ese wele with herte fresshe and glade
And wel was hym þat koude beste deuyse
To liken hire or þat hire laughen made
He songh she pleyde he told tale of wade
But at þe last as euery thynge has ende
She tooke hire leue and nedes wald wende
¶ But o fortune executrice of wierdes
O Influences of þis heuenes hye
Soth is þat vnder god ȝe ben oure hierdes
Though to vs bestes ben þe causes wrye
Þis mene I now for she gan homward hye
But execut was al byside hire leue
At þe goddes wil for which she most bleue
¶ The bent moone with hire hoȝnes pale
Saturne and Ioue in Cancro Ioyned were
Þat swich a reyne from heuene gan auale
Þat euery manere womman þat was there
Hadde of þat smoky reyn a verray fere
At which Pandare þo lough and seyde thenne
Now were it tyme a lady to gette hende
¶ But goode nece If I myght euere plese
Ȝow any thynge þan preye ich ȝow quod he
To don myn herte as now so grete an ese
as for to dwelle here al þis nyght with me
For whi þis is ȝoure owene hous parde
For by my trowth I sey it nought a game
To wonde as now it were to me a shame
¶ Criseyde which þat as muche goode
As half a world took hede of his preyere
and syn it ron and alle was on a flode
She thought as good chep may I dwelle here
And graunte it gladly with a frendes chere
And haue a thank as gruche and þanne abide
For hom to gon it may nought wele bitide
¶ I wol quod she myn vncle lief and dere
Syn þat ȝow list it skyl is to be so
I am right glad with ȝow to dwellen here
I seyde but a game I wold go
I-wis graunte mercy nece quod he tho
were it a game or no soth for to telle
Now am I glad syn þat ȝow list to dwelle
¶ Þus al is wele / but þo bigan aright
Þe newe Ioie and al þe fest agayne
But Pandarus If goodly hadde he myght
He wold han hyed hire to bedde fayn
and seyde lord þis is an huge reyne
Þis were a weder for to slepen Inne
and þat I rede vs soon bygynne
¶ And nece woot ȝe where I wol ȝow leye
For þat we shullen not liggen fer a-sonder
And for ȝe neither shullen dar I seye
Heren noise of reynes nor of thonder
By god right in my lite closet ȝonder
And I wol in þat outter hous allone
Be warden of ȝoure wommen euerychon
¶ And in þis myddel chaumber þat ȝe se
Shal ȝoure wommen slepen wel and softe
And ther I seyde shal ȝoure seluen be
And if ȝe liggen wel to nyght come ofte
And careth nought what weder is a-lofte
The wyn anon and whan so þat ȝow leste
So go we slepe I trow it be þe beste
¶ Ther nys no more but here efter soone
The voide dronke and traueres drawe anon
Gan euery wyghte þat hadde nought to done
More in þe place oute of þe chaumber gone
And euere-mo so sternelich it ron
and blew ther-with so wonderliche loude
Þat wel neighe no man heren other koude
¶ Tho Pandarus hire Em right as hym oughte
with wommen swiche as were hire most aboute
Ful glad vn-to hire beddes syde hire brought
and took his leue and gan ful lowe loute
And seyde hire at þis closet dore with-oute
Right ouerthwart ȝoure wommen liggen alle
That whom ȝow list of hem ȝe may here calle
¶ So when þat she was in þe closet layde
and alle wommen forth by ordinaunce
A bedde weren ther as I haue seyde
There was namore to skipen nor to traunce
But boden go to bedde with mischaunce
If any wight was sterynge any where
and lat hem slepen that a bedde ware
¶ But Pandarus þat wel koude ech a deele
Þe olde daunce and euery poynt ther-Inne
when þat he seye þat alle thynge was wele
He thought he wolde vp-on his werk bygynne
And gan the stewe dore al soft vnpynne
as stille as stone with-outen langer lette
By Troilus a-down right he hym sette
¶ And shortly to þe pointe right for to gon
Of alle this werk he told hym worde and ende
And seyde make the redy righ anon
For thow shalt into heuene blisse wende
Now blisful Venus thow me grace sende
Quod Troilus / for neuere ȝet no nede
hadde ich er now / ne haluendeel þe drede
¶ Quod Pandarus ne drede the neuere a dele
For it shal be righ as thow wolt desire
So thryue I þis nyght shal I make it wele
Or casten al þe gruwel in þe fyre
Ȝet blisful Venus þis nyght thow me enspire
Quod Troilus as wys as I the serue
And euere bet and bet shal til I sterue
¶ And if ich hadde o Venus ful of myrthe
Aspectes hadde of mars or of Saturne
Or thow combust or let were in my byrth
Þi fader prey al thylke harme desturne
Of grace / and þat I glad a-ȝein may turne
For loue of hym thow louedest in þe shawe
I mene adon þat with þe bore was slawe
¶ O Ioue ek for þe loue of fayre Europe
Þe which in forme of bool a-wey thow fette
Now help / o mars thow with þi blody cope
For þe loue of Cypres thow me nought ne lette
O phebus thynke when dane hire seluen shette
Vnder þe bark and laurer wax for-drede
Ȝet for hire loue o help now at þis nede
¶ Mercure for þe love of hierse eke
For whiche Pallas was with a-glowros wroth
Now help and ek diane I þe biseke
Þat þis viage be nought to þe loth
O fatal sustren which er any cloth
Me shapen was my destenye me sponne
So helpeth to þis werk þat is bygonne
¶ Quod Pandarus thow wriched mowses herte
Art tow agast so þat she wil þe hite
wy don þis furred cloke vp on þi sherte
And folowe me for I wol han þe wyte
But bid and lat me gon by-forne a lyte
And with þat word he gan vn-don a trappe
And Troilus he brought in by þe lappe
¶ The sterne wynde so londe kan to route
Þat no wight other noise myght here
and they þat layen at þe dore with-oute
Ful sikirly they slepten al I-feere
And Pandarus with a ful sobre chere
Goth to þe dore anon with-outen lette
Þer as þey laye and softly it shette
¶ And as he come aȝeynward pryuely
His nece a-woke and axen who goth there
My dere nece quod he it am I
Ne wondereth nought ne haue of it no fare
And ner he com and seyde hire in hire ere
No word for loue of god I ȝow biseche
Lat no wight rise and heren of oure speche
¶ What whiche way be ȝe comen benedicite
Quod she and how vnwiste of hem alle
Here at this secre trappe dore quod he
Quod she Criseyde lat me som wight calle
I god forbede that it shold falle
Quod Pandarus / that ȝe shwich folye wroughte
They myghte demen thynge they neuere er thoughte
¶ It is nought goode a slepyng hounde to wake
Ne ȝeve a wyght a cause to deuyne
Ȝoure wommen slepen alle I vndertake
So þat hem þe hous men myghte myne
And slepen wollen til þe sonne shyne
And when my tale brought is to an ende
Wnwyst right as I com so wol I wende
¶ Now nece myn ȝe shal wel vnderstonde
Quod he so ye wommen demen alle
Þat for to [hold corrected] holde in loue a man in honde
And hym hire lief and dere herte calle
And maken hym an howue aboue a calle
I mene as loue a nother in þis mene while
She doth hire-self a shame and hym a gyle
¶ Now wherby þat I telle ȝow al this
Ȝe wot ȝoure-self as wel as any wyghte
How þat ȝoure loue alle fully graunted is
To Troilus the worthiest knyghte
Oon of þis word and þer-to trouthe I plighte
Þat but it were on hym a-longe ȝe nolde
Hym neuere falsen while ȝe lyuen sholde
¶ Now stant it thus þat sith I fro ȝow wente
This Troilus right platly for to seyn
Is thorwgh a goter by a pryue wente
Into my chaumber com in al þis reyn
Vnwist of euery manere wight certeyn
Saue of my self as wisly have I Ioye
And by þe feith I shal priam of Troye
¶ And he is come in swich [wich corrected; wo overline, later] wo and distresse
And but he be alle fully woode by this
He sodeynly mot falle in to wodenesse
But god help and cause whi þis is
He seith hym tolde is of a frende of his
How þat ȝe sholden louen oon þat hatte horaste
For sorwe of whiche þis nyght shal ben his laste
¶ Criseyde which þat al þis wonder herde
Gan sodeynly a-boute hire hert colde
And with a sik she sorwfully answerde
Allas I wende who-so tales tolde
My deere herte wold me nought holde
So lightly fals allas conseyues wronge
what harme they don for now lyue I to longe
¶ Horaste allas and falsen Troilus
I knowe hym nought god helpe me so quod she
allas what wikked spirit tolde hym thus
Now certes Em to morw and I hym se
I shal ther-of as ful excusen me
as euere dide womman if hym like
and with þat worde she gan ful sore sike
¶ O god quod she wordly selynesse
which clerkes tellen fals felicite
I-medled is with many a bitternesse
Ful angwyshous than is god woote quod she
Condicion of veyn prosperite
For oyther Ioies comen nought yfeere
Or elles no wight hath hym alwey here
¶ O brotel wele of manes Ioie vnstable
with what wight so thow be or how thow pleye
Oither he woot þat thow Ioie art muable
Or woot it nought it mot ben on of tweyen
Now if he woot. how may he seyen
That he hath verray Ioie and selynesse
Þat is of ignoraunce ay in distresse
¶ Now if ȝe woote þat Ioie is transitorie
As euery Ioie or wordly thynge mot fle
Þanne euery tyme he þat hath in memorie
Þe drede of lesynge maketh hym þat he
May no parfite selynesse be
And If to lese his ioie he sette a myte
Than semeth it þat Ioie is worth ful lite
¶ Wher-for I wol deffyne in this matere
Þat trewly for aught I kan espie
Ther is no verray wele in this world here
But o thow wikked serpent Iabousie
Thow mysbileued and enuyous folye
whi hastow made Troilus to me vntruste
Þat neuere ȝet a-gylte hym that I wyste
¶ Quod Pandarus thus fallen is this cas
why vncle myn quod she who tolde hym þis
why doth my deere herte thus allas
Ȝe woote ȝe nece myn quod he what is
I hope alle shal be wel þat is a-mys
For ȝe may quenche alle þis if þat ȝow liste
And doth right so for I hold it for þe beste
¶ So shal I do to morw I-wis quod she
And god to-forn so þat it shal suffise
To morwe allas that were a fair quod he
Nay nay it may nought stonden in þis wyse
For nece myn thus writen clerkes wyse Mora trahit periculum
Þat peril is with drecchynge in ydrowe
Nay swich abedes ben nought worth an hawe
¶ Nece alle thynge hath tyme I dar auowe
For when a chaumbere a fire is or an halle
wel more now is it sodynly rescowe
Þan to disputen and axe amonges alle
How this candele in þe strow is falle
A benedicite for al a-monge þat fare
Þe harme is don and fare wel feldefare
¶ And nece myne ne take nought agrief
If þat ȝe suffre hym alle nyght in þis wo
God help me so ȝe hadde hym neuere lief
Þat dar I seyn now þer is but we two
But wel I woot þat ȝe wol nat do so
Ȝe ben to wis to don so grete folye
To put his lief alle nyght in Iupartye
¶ Hadde I hym neuere lief by god I wene
Ȝe hadde neuere thynge so lief quod she
Now bi my thrifte quod he þat shal be seene
For syn ȝe make þis ensaumple of me
If ich alle nyght wold hym in sorw se
For alle the tresour in þe town of troye
I bidde god I neuere mote haue Ioye
¶ Now loke þanne if ȝe ben his loue
Shul putte his lief alle nyght in Iupartye
For thynge of nought now by þat god above
Nought oonly this delay comth of folye
But of malice of þat I shal not lye
What platly and ȝe suffre hym in distresse
Ȝe noither bounte don ne gentilnesse
¶ Quod she Criseyde wele ȝe don o thynge
And ȝe ther-with shal stynte alle his disese
Haue here and bereth hym þis blewe rynge
For ther is no thynge myght hym better plese
Saue I my self ne more his herte apese
And sey my dere herte þat his sorwe
Is causeles þat shal be seene to morwe
¶ A rynge quod he ȝe haselwodes shaken
Ȝe nece myne þat rygh most han a stoone
Þat myght dede men a-lyue maken
And swich a rynge trow I þat ȝe haue noon
Discrecion oute of ȝoure hed is gon
Þat fele I now quod he and þat is routhe
O tyme I-lost wel maystow corsen slouthe
¶ Whoot ȝe not wele þat noble and heigh corage
Ne seweth nought ne stynteht ek for lite
But if a foole were in a Ialous rage
I nold setten at his sow a myte
But feffe hym with a fewe wordes whyte
A nother day when þat I myght hym fynde
But this thynge stante al in a nother kynde
¶ Þis is so gentil and so tendre of herte
Þat with his deth he wol his sorwes wreke
For trusteth wel how sore þat hym smerte
He wol to ȝowe no Ialous wordes speke
And for-thy nece er þat his herte breke
So spek ȝoure self to hym If þis matere
For with a worde ȝe may his herte steere
¶ Now haue I told what peril he is Inne
And his comynge vnwiste is teuery wight
Ne parde harm may þer be non ne synne
I wol my-self be with ȝow al þis nyghte
Ȝe know ek how it is ȝoure owene knyght
And þat by right ȝe most vp on hym triste
And I alle prist to fetthe [tt meant for cc] hym when ȝow liste
¶ Þis accident so pitous was to here
And ek so like a soth at pryme face
And Troilus hire knyght to hire so dere
His priue comyng / and þe seker place
Þat though þat she dide hym as þanne a grace
Considered alle thynges as they stode
No wonder is syn she dide alle for goode
¶ Criseyde answerede as wysly god at reste
My soule brynge as me is for hym wo
And Em I-wis fayn wold I don þe beste
If þat ich grace had for to do so
But wheter þat ȝe dwel or for hym go
I am til god me bettere mynde sende
A dulcarnon right at my wittes ende
¶ Quod Pandarus ȝe nece wel ȝe here
Dulcarnon called is flemynge of wriches
It semeth hard for wreches wol nought lere
For verray slouthe or other wilful tecches
Þis seyde bi hem þat ben nought worth two fecches
But ȝe ben wis and þat we han on honde
Nis neither harde ne skylful to withstonde
¶ Þanne Em quod she doth here-of as ȝow liste
But or he come I wol vp firste a-rise
And for þe loue of god seyn al my triste
Is on ȝow two and ȝe ben bothe wise
So werketh now in so discrete a wyse
Þat I honour may haue and he plesaunce
For I am here alle in ȝoure gouerenaunce
¶ This is wel seyde quod he my nece deere
Þer good thrift on þat wise gentil herte
But liggeth stille and taketh hym right here
It nedeth nought no ferther for hym sterte
And ech of ȝow eseth otheres sorwes smerte
For love of god and venus I þe herye
For soon hope I we shul ben al merye
¶ This Troilus ful soone on knowes hym sette
Ful sobrely right by hire beddes hed
And in his beste wise his lady grette
But lord what she wex sodeynlyche rede
Ne though men sholde smythen of hire hed
She koude nought a word right out brynge
So sodeynly for his sodeyn comynge
¶ But Pandarus þat so wel koude feele
In euery thynge to pleye a-non biganne
And seyde nece se how þis lord knele
Now for ȝoure trouthe se this gentil man
And with þat worde he for a quysshen ran
And seyde kneleth now whil þat ȝow liste
Ther god ȝoure hertes brynge soone at reste
¶ Kån I nought seyn for she bad hym nought rise
If sorw it putte oute of hire remembraunce
Or elles þat she toke it in þe wyse
Of dwete as for his obseruaunce
But wel fynde I she did hym þis plesaunce
Þat she hym kyste although she siked soore
And bad him sitte adown with-outen more
¶ Quod Pandarus now wol ȝe wel bygynne
Now doth hym sitte good nece deere
Vp on ȝoure beddes syde al þer with-Inne
Þat ech of ȝow þe bette may other here
And with þat word he drew hym to þe fere
And took a light and fonde his contenaunce
as for to looke vp an old romaunce
¶ Criseyde þat was Troilus lady righte
And clere stoode on a grounde of sikernesse
Al though he hire seruaunt and hire knyghte
Ne shold of right non vntrouth in hire gesse
Ȝet natheles considered his distresse
And þat loue is in cause of swich folye
Þus to hym spake she of his Ialousye
¶ Lo herte myne as wold the excellence
Of loue / aȝenis þe whiche þat noman may
Ne aught ek goodly maken resistence
And ek by-cause I felte wel and say
Ȝoure grete trouthe and seruyse euery day
And that ȝoure herte al myn was soth to seyne
Þis drofe me for to rew vp-on ȝoure peyne
¶ And ȝoure goodenesse haue I founden alway ȝet
Of which my dere herte and al my knyght
I thonke it ȝow as fer as I haue witte
Al kan I nought as muche as it were right
and I emforth my konnynge and my myght
Haue and ay shal how soore þat me smerte
Ben to ȝow trew and hool with al myn herte
¶ And dredeles þat shal ben founde at preue
But herte myne what al þis is to seyne
Shal wel be tolde so that ȝe nought [t later] ȝow greue
Though I to ȝow right [t later] on ȝoure self compleyne
For þer-with mene I fynaly þe peyne
Þat halt ȝoure hert and myn in heuynesse
Fully to slen and euery wronge redresse
¶ My good myn not I for why ne how
That Ialousye allas þat wikked wyuere
Þus causeles is cropen in-to ȝow
Þe harm of which I wold fayn deluere
Allas þat he al hool or of hym slyuere
Shold han his refut in so digne a place
Þer Ioue hym soone oute of ȝoure herte arace
¶ But o thow Ioue o auctour of nature
Is þis an honour to thy deyte [te corrected]
Þat folk vngiltif suffre hire Iniure
And who þat giltif is al quyte goth he
O were it leful for to pleyn on the
Þat vndeserued suffrest Ialousye
Of þat I wolde vp-on þe pleyne and crye
¶ Ek al my wo is þis þat folk now vsen
To seyn right þus ȝe Ialousye is loue
And wold a busshel venym al excusen
For þat o greyn of loue is on it shoue
But þat woot heigh god þat is a-boue
If it be liker loue or hate or grame
And efter þat it ought bere his name
¶ But certeyn is som manere Ialousye
Is excusable more þanne som I-wis
As when cause is and som swich fantasie
which piete so wele repressed is
Þat it vnneth doth or seyth amys
But goodly drynketh vp al his distresse
And þat excuse I for þe gentilesse
¶ And som so ful of furie is and despite
Þat it surmountheth his repression
But hert myn ȝe be not in þat plite
Þat thonke I god for which ȝoure passion
I wol nought calle it but illusioun
Of abundaunce of loue and bisy cure
Þat doth ȝoure herte þis disese endure
¶ Of which I am right sory but nough wroth
But for my deuoure and ȝoure hertes reste
Where so ȝow list be ordal or by ooth
By sort or in what wyse so ȝow leste
For loue of god lat preue it for þe beste
And if þat be gilty do me deye
Allas what myght I more don or seyne
¶ witht þat a few bryght teres newe
Oute of hire eighen fille and þus she seyde
Now god thow woost in thought ne dede vntrewe
To Troilus / was neuere ȝet Criseyde
with þat hire hed down in þe bed she layde
And with þe shete it wreigh and sight soore
And held hire pees nought a word spak she more
¶ But now helpe god to quenchen al þis sorwe
So hope þat he shal for he best may
For I haue seyn of a ful mysty morwe
Follwen ful oft a merye someres day
And efter wynter folweth grene may
Men sen alday and reden ek in storyes
Þat efter sharpe shoures ben victories
¶ This Troilus when he hire wordes herde
Haue ȝe no care hym list nought to slepe
For it thought hym no strokes of a ȝerde
To here or sen Criseyde his lady wepe
But wel he felte aboute his herte crepe
For euery tere which þat criseyde a-sterte
Þe craumpe of deth to streyne hym by þe herte
¶ And in his mynde he gan þe tyme acorse
Þat he com þer and þat he was born
For now is wikked torned in-to worse
Lord al þat labour he hath don biforne
He wende it lost he thought he nas but lorne
O Pandarus thought he allas þi wile
Serueth of nought so walawey þe while
¶ And ther-with-al he henge a-down þe hed
And felle on knesse and sorwfully he sighte
what myght he seyn he felt he was but dede
For wroth was she þat shold his sorwes lighte
But natheles when þat he speken myght
Than seyde he þus god woot þat of þis game
when al is wiste þan am I nought to blame
¶ Ther-with þe sorwe so his herte shette
Þat from his eyen felle þar nought a tere
And euery spirit is vigour in knette
So they astoned or oppressed were
Þe felynge of his sorwe or of his feere
Or of aught elles fled were out of towne
And down he fel al sodeynly a-swoune
¶ Þis was no litel sorwe for to se
But al was hust and Pandare vp as faste
O nece pees or we be lost quod he
Beth nought agast but serteyn at þe laste
For þis or þat he into bed hym caste
And seyde o thef is þis a mannes herte
And of he rente al to his bare sherte
¶ And seyde nece but ȝe help vs now
Allas ȝoure owene Troilus is lorne
I-wis so wold I and I wiste how
Ful fayn quod she allas þat I was borne
Ȝe nece wille ȝe pulle oute þe thorne
Þat stikketh in his herte quod Pandare
Sey al for-ȝeuen and stynte al þis fare
¶ Ȝe þat to me quod she ful leuere were
Þanne al þe good þe sonne aboute goth
And ther-with-al she swor hym in his ere
I-wis my deere herte I am nought wroth
haue here my trouthe and many a nother ath
Now spek to me for it am I Criseyde
But al for nought ȝet myght he nought abrayde
¶ Þer-with his pous and pawmes of his hondes
Þei gan to frote and wete his temples tweyne
And to delyuer hym from bittre bondes
She oft hym kyste and shorthly for to seyne
hym to reuoken she did al hire peyne
And at þe laste he gan his breth to drawe
And of his swough sone efter þat dawe
¶ And gan bet mynde and reson to hym take
But wonder soore he was baiste I-wis
And with a syke when he gan awake
He seyde o mercy god what thynge is þis
whi do with ȝoure seluen þus amys
Quod she Criseyde is þis a mannes game
What Troilus wol ȝe do þus for shame
¶ And ther-with-al hire arm ouere hym she layde
And al for-ȝaf and of tyme hym kyssed
he thonked hire and to hire spak and seyde
As fil to purpos for his herte reste
And she to þat answerde hym as hire leste
And with hire goodly wordes hym disporte
She gan // and oft his sorwes to conforte
¶ Quod Pandarus for aught I kan aspien
Þis light nor I ne seruen here of nought
Light is nought goode for sike folk eyen
But for þe loue of god seyn ȝe ben broughte
In þis goode plite lat now no heuy thought
Ben hangynge in þe hertes of ȝow tweye
And bar þe candele to þe chymeneye
¶ Sone efter þis thought it no nede were
when she swiche othes swor as hire list deuyse
Hadde of hym take hire thought tho no fere
Ne cause ek non to bidde hym thennes ryse
Ȝet lesse thynge þan othes may suffise
In many a cas for euery wight I gesse
Þat loueth wel meneth but gentilnesse
¶ But in afect she wold wyte anon
Of what man / and ek where and also whi
he Ialous was / sen ther was cause non
And ek þe signe þat he toke it by
Sho bad hym for to tel þat hire bisily
Or elles certein she bar hym on honde
Þat þis was don of malice hire to fonde
¶ With-outen more shortly for to seyne
hym most obeye vn-to his lady liste
And for þe lesse harm he most feyne
He seyde hire when she was at swiche a feste
She myght on hym han loked at þe leste
Not I nought what aldeere ynough a ryshe
As he þat nedes most a cause fyshe
¶ And she answarde swete al were it so
With harm was þat seyn I non euele Imene
For by þat god þat bought vs bothe two
In al thynge is myn entente clene
Swiche argumentȝ ne ben nought worth a beene
wol ȝe the childishe Ialous contrefete
Now were it worthy that ȝe were y-bette
¶ Tho Troilus gan sorwfully to syke
Leste she be wroth hym thought his herte deyede
And seyde allas vp-on my sorwes syke
haue mercy swete herte myn criseyde
And if þat in tho wordes þat I seyde
Be any wronge I wol no more trespas
Do what ȝo liste I am al in ȝoure grace
¶ And she answerde of gylte misericord
Þat is to seyn / þat I for-ȝeue al this
And euere more on this lyght ȝow recorde
And beth wel war ȝe do nomore amyis
Nay deere herte myn quod he I-wis
And now quod she þat I haue don ȝow smerte
For-ȝeue it me myn swene swete herte
¶ This Troilus with blisse of þat supprise
Putte alle in goddes honde as he þat mente
No thyng but wel and sodeynly auysed
he hire in armes fast to hym hente
And Pandarus with a ful goode entente
layde hym to slepe and seyde If ȝe be wise
Swouneth nought now lest more folk arise
¶ what myght or may þe sely lark seye
when þat þe sparhauk hath hym in hire foot
I kan namore but of thise ilk tweye
To whom þis tale sucre be or soot
Though þat I tarie a yer som tyme I mote
After myn auctor tellen hire gladnesse
as wel as I haue told hire heuynesse
¶ Criseyde which þat felt hire thus ytake
as writen clerkes in hire bokes olde
Right as an aspes leef she gan to quake
when she hym felte hire in his armes folde
But Troilus al hool of cares colde
Gan thonken tho þe blisful goddes seuene
Þus sondry peynes bryngen folk in heuene
¶ This Troilus in armes gan hire streyne
And seyde swete as euere mot I gon
Now be ȝe caught new is ther but we tweyne
Now ȝeldeth ȝow for other boot is non
To that Criseyde answerde thus a-non
Ne hadde I er now my swete herte deere
Ben ȝolde I-wis I were now nough here
¶ O soth is seyde that heled for to be
as of a feuere or other grete syknesse
Men most drynke as men may oft se
Ful bittre drynke and for to han gladnesse
Men drynken oft peynes and grete distresse
I mene it here as for this auenture
Þat thorwgh a peyne hath fonden al his cure
¶ And now swetnesse semeth more swete
Þat bitternesse assayde was by-forne
For oute of wo in blisse now they flete
Non swich they felten syn they were borne
Now is this bet þanne both two be lorne
For loue of god take euery womman hede
To werken thus of it comyth to þe nede
¶ Criseyde al quyt from euery drede and teene
As she þat Iuste cause hadde hym to triste
Made hym swich feste it Ioie was to seene
When she his trouthe and clene entente wiste
And as aboute a tre with many a twiste
Bytrent and writhe þe soote wonbynde
Gan ich of hem in armes other wynde
¶ And as þe new abaysed nyghtyngale
Þat stynteth first when bygynneth synge
when þat she hereth any hard tale
Or in þe hegges any wight sterynge
and efter syker doth hire vois oute rynge
