Right so Criseyde when hire drede stente
Opned hire herte and told hym hire entente
¶ And right as he þat seth his deth y-shapen
And deyen mot in aught þat he may gesse
And sodeynly rescous doth hym escapen
And from his deth is brought in sykernesse
For alle þis world in swich present gladnesse
was Troilus and hath his lady swete
witht vois hap god lat vs neuere mete
¶ Hire armes smale hire streght bak and softe
Her sydes longe flessly smothe [h was first d] and white
He gan to stroke and good thrifte bad ful ofte
Hire snowissh throte hire brestes rounde and lite
Þus in þis heuene he gan hym to delyte
And ther-with-al a thousand tyme hire kyste
Þat what to don for Ioie vnneth he wyste
¶ Than seyde he thus o loue o charge
Þi moder ek Cythara the swete
After þi-self next heried be she
Venus mene I þe wel willy planete
And next þat Imeneus I þe grete Imeneus deus nupciarum.
For neuere man was to ȝow goddes holde
As I which ȝe han brought fro cares colde
¶ Benigne loue thow holy hond of thynges
who so wol grace and liste þe nought honouren
Lo his desir wol fle with-outen wynges
For noldestow of bounte hem socouron
Þat seruen best and most alway labouron
Ȝet were al lost þat dar I wel seyn certes
But of þi grace passed oure desertes
¶ And for thow me þat leest koude disserue
Of hem þat noumbred ben vn-to þi grace
Hast holpen / ther I likly was to sterue
And me bistowed in so heigh a place
Þat thilke boundes may no blisse pace
I kan namore but loude and reuerence
Be to thy bounte and thyn excellence
¶ And ther-with-alle Criseyde anon he kyste
Of which certeyn she felte no disese
And þus seyde he now wold god I wiste
Myn herte swete how I ȝow myght pleese
What man quod he was euere this ateste
As I / in wiche þe fairest and þe beste
Þat euere I sey deyneth hire herte reste
¶ Her may men sen þat mercy passeth right
Þe experience of þat is felt in me
Þat am vnworthy to so swete a wight
But hert myn of youre benignite
So thynk / þat though þat I vnworthy be
Ȝet mote I nede amenden in som wyse
Right thorugh vertu of ȝoure heigh seruyse
¶ And for þe loue of god my lady dere
Syn god hath wrought me for I shal ȝow serue
As þis I mene ȝe wol ȝe be my fere
To do me lyue If þat yow list or sterue
So techeth me how þat I may disserue
Ȝoure thonke / so þat I through myn ignoraunce
Ne do no thynge þat ȝow be displesaunce
¶ For certes fresshe wommanliche wyf
Þis dar I seye þat trouthe and diligence
Þat shal ȝe fynden in me al my lyue
Ny wol certein breken ȝoure diffence
And if I do presente or in absence
For loue of god lat sla me with the dede
If þat it like vn-to ȝoure wommanhede
¶ I-wis quod she myn own hertes liste
My grounde of ese and al myn herte deere
Gerramercy / for on þat is al my triste
But lat us fal away fro þis matere
For it suffisith þis þat seyde is here
and at o worde / with-outen repentaunce
wel-come my knyghte / my pees / my suffisaunce
¶ Of hire delite or Ioies oon þe leeste
Were impossibile to my wit to seye
But Iuggeth ȝe ȝat han ben at þe feste
Of swich gladnesse If that hem liste pleye
I kan namore but þus þis ilke tweweye
Þat nyght bitweyne drede and sykernesse
Felten in loue the grete worthynesse
¶ O blisful nyght of hem so longe I-soughte
How blithe vn-to hem bothe two þow were
Why nade I swich oon with my soule I-bought
Ȝe or þe leste Ioie þat was there
A why thow foule daunger and þow feere
And lat hem in this heuene blisse dwelle
Þat is so heigh þat al ne kan I telle
¶ But sothe is þat thought I kan nat talen alle
As kan myn auctor of his excellence
Þat haue I seyde and god to-forne and shal
In euery thynge al holly his sentence
And If þat ich at loues reuerence
Haue any word in eched for þe beste
Doth þer-with-al ryght as ȝoure-seluen leste
¶ For myne wordes here and euery parte
I speke hem alle vnder correccion
Of ȝow þat felynge han in loues arte
And putte it alle in ȝoure discrecion
Tencresce or maken dymynucion
Of my langage and þat I ȝow beche
But now to purpos of my rather speche
¶ This ilk two þat ben in armes laft
So loth to hem asonder gon it were
Þat ech hem other wenden ben biraft
Or elles lo this was hire most feere
Þat alle þis thynge but nyce dremes were
For whiche ful oft ech of hem seyde o swete
Clippe ich ȝow þus or elles I it meete [glost d]reme
¶ And lord so he gan goodely on hire se
Þat neuere his loke ne blynte from hire face
And seyde o deere herte may it be
Þat it be soth þat ȝe ben in þis place
Ȝe herte myne god thanke I of his grace
Quod tho Criseyde and þer-with-al hym kyste
Þat where his spirit was for Ioie he nyste
¶ Þis Troilus ful oft hire eyen two
Gan for to kisse / and seyde o eyen clere
It weren ȝe þat wrought me swich wo
Ȝe humble nettes of my lady deere
Though ther be mercy writen in ȝoure cheere
God woote þe tex ful hard is soth to fynde
How koude ȝe with-outen bonde me bynde
¶ Ther-with he gan hire in armes take
and wel an hondreth tymes gan he sike
Nought swiche sorwful sikes as men make
For wo / or elles when þat folk ben sike
But esy sikes swiche as ben to like
Þat shewed his affeccion with-Inne
Of swhich sykes koude nought bilynne
¶ Soon after this þei spak of sondry thynges
As fel to purpos of this auenture
And pleiynge entrechanden hire rynges
Of whiche I kan nought tellen no scripture
But wele I woot a broche gol and asure
In whiche a ruby set was like an herte
Criseyde hym ȝaf and stak it on his sherte
¶ Lord trow ȝe a coueytous or a wriche
Þat blameth loue and halt of it despite
Þat of tho pans þat he gan mokre and theche
was euer ȝet I-ȝeue hym swhich delite
As is in loue in o pointe in som plyte
Nay douteles for also god me saue
So parfite Ioie may no nygard haue
¶ They wol seyn yis but lor so they lye
Þo besy wreches ful of wo and drede
They callen loue a woondenes or folye
But it shal falle hem as I shal ȝow rede
They shal for-gon þe whyte and ek þe rede
And lyue in wo ther god ȝeue hem myschaunce
and euery louere in his trouthe auaunce
¶ As wold god þo wreches þat dispise
Seruyse of loue hadde erys also longe
as hadde Myda ful of coueityse
And ther-to dronken hadde as hote and stronge
as Crassus dide for hise affectos wronge
To techen hem þat they han in þe vyce
and louers nought al though they hold hem nyce
¶ Thise ilke two of whom þat I ȝowe seyde
when þat hirtes wol assured were
Tho gonne they to speken and to pleye
and ek rehersen how and whan and whare
They knowe hem first and euery wo or fere
Þat passed was / but al swich heuynesse
I thonke it god was torned in-to gladnesse
¶ And euer mo when þat hem fel to speke
Of any thynge of swich a tyme agon
with kyssynge al þat tale shold breke
and fallen in a new Ioie anon
and diden alle hire myght syn they were oon
For to recoueren blisse and ben at ese
And passed wo with ioie countrepese
¶ Reson wol nought þat I speke of slep
For it a-cordeth nought to my matere
God woot þei toke of þat ful litel kep
But list þis nyght þat was to hem so deere
Ne shold in veyn escape in no manere
It was by-set in Ioie and besynesse
Of al þat souneth in to gentilnesse
¶ But when þe kok comune astrologer ‖ vulgarus astrologus
Gan on his breste to bete and after crew
And lucifer þe dayes messager ‖ lucifer .I. stella matutinalis
Gan for to ryse and out hire bemye throwe
And estward roos to hym þat koude it knowe
Fortuna maior þat a-non Criseyde
wit herte soor to Troilus thus seyde
¶ Myne hertes lyf my triste al my plesaunce
Þat I was born allas what me is wo
Þat day of vs moot make disseueraunce
For tyme it is to rise and hennes go
Or elles I am lost for euer mo
O nyght allas why nyltow ouer vs houe
As longe / as almena lay by Ioue ‖ Almana mater heroulis
¶ O blake nyght as folk in bokes rede
Þat shapen art by god þis world to hyde
At certein tymes with thy derke wode
Þat vnder þat men myghte in rest abyde
wel aughten bestes and folk þe chide
Þat ther as day with labour wolde us breste
Þat thow thus fleest and deynest vs naught reste
¶ Thow dost allas to schortly thyn office
Þow rakle nyght ther god maker of kynde
Þe for thyn haste and þin vnkynde vice
So fast ay to oure hemysperie bynde
Þat neuere more vnder þe grounde thow wende
For now for thow so hyest out of troye
Haue I for-gon þus hastily My Ioie
¶ Þis Troilus þat with tho wordes felte
As thoughte hym tho for piteous distresse
Þe blody teres from his herte mette
As he þat neuere ȝet swiche heuynesse
Assaued hadde out of so grete gladnesse
Gan ther-with-al Criseyde his lady deere
In armes streyne and seyde in þis manere
¶ O cruwel day accusour of the Ioie
Þat nyght and loue han stole and faste y-wrien v. conered
Acorsed be þi comynge in to Troie
For euery bore hath oon of þi bryght eyen
Enuyous day what liste þe so to spyen
what hastow loste why sekestow þis place
Þer god thy light so quenche for his grace
¶ Allas what hath þis louers þe agylte
Dispitous day thyn be þe pyne of helle
For many a louer hastow slayn and whi
Þi pourynge in wel no wher lat hem dwelle
what profrestow þi light here for to selle
Go selle it hem that smale seles graue
we wol þe nought vs nedeth no day haue
¶ And ek þe sonne Titan gan he chyde
And seyde o fool wel may men the dispise
Þat hast þe dawnynge al nyght by þi side
And sooffriste hire so soone vp fro þe ryse
For to disese louers in þis wyse
what hold ȝoure bed ther thow and ek þi morw
I bidde god so ȝeue ȝow bothe sorwe
¶ þer-with ful soor he sighte and þus he seyde
My lady right and of my wel or wo
Þe welle and roote o goodely myn Criseyde
And shal I rise allas and shal I so
Now fele I þat myne herte mote a two
For how shold I my lyf an oure saue
Syn þat with ȝow is al þe lyfe ich haue
¶ What shal I don for certes I not how
Ne when allas I shal þe tyme se
Þat in þis plit I may ben eft with ȝow
And of my lyf god woot how þat shal be
Syn þat desir right now so bitleth me
Þat I am ded a-non but I retourne
how shal I longe allas fro ȝou soiourne
¶ But natheles myn swene lady bright
were it so that I wiste outerly
Þat I ȝour humble seruant and ȝoure kynght
were in ȝoure herte I-set so fermely
As ȝe in myn þe which thynge trewly
Me leuer were þan þis worldes tweyne
Ȝet shold I bet enduren al my payne
¶ To þat Criseyde answerde right anon
And with a sik she seyde o herte deere
Þe gam I-wis so fer foorth now is gon
Þat first shal phebus fallen fro his spere
And euerich Egle ben þe dowues fere
And euery roche out his place sterte
Er Troilus out of Criseydes herte.
¶ Ȝe ben so depe In-with myn herte graue
Þat though I wolde it torne out of my thought
As wysely verray god my soule saue
To dyen in þe peyne I koude nought
And for þe loue of god þat vs hath wrought
lat in ȝoure breyne non other fantasye
So crepe þat it cause me to dye
¶ And þat ȝe me wold han as faste in mynde
As I haue ȝow þat wold I ȝow beseche
And If I wiste sothely that to fynde
God myghte noughte a poynte my ioies eche
But herte myn with-outen more speche
Beth to me trewe or elles were it routhe
For I am þin by god and by my trowthe
¶ Beth glad for-þi and lyue in sykernesse
Þus seyde I neuere er þis ne shal to mo
And If to ȝowe it were a grete gladnesse
To torne aȝein soon after þat ȝe go
As fayn wolde I as ye it were so
as wisly god myn herte brynge to reste
And hym in armes took and oft kyste
¶ Aȝeyns his wille sith it moot nedes be
Þis Troilus vp roos and faste hym cledde
And in his armes took his lady fre
An hondred tyme and on his way hym spedde
And with swich wordes as his herte bledde
He seyde far wel my deere herte swete
Ther god vs graunte sownde and soone to mete
¶ To which no worde for sorw she answerde
So soore gan his partynge hire distreyne
And Troilus vn-to his paleys ferde
As wo-by-gan as she was soth to seyne
So hard hym wronge of sharp desire þe peyne
For to ben eft þer he was in plesaunce
Þat it may neuere out of his remembraunce
¶ Retorned to his real paleys soone
He soft in to his bed gan for to slynke
To slepe longe as he was wonte to doon
But al for nought he may wel ligge and wynke
But slepe ne may ther in his herte synke
Thynkynge how she for whom desire hym brende
A thousande fold was worth more than he wende
¶ And in his thought gan vp and down to wynde
Hire wordes alle and euery contenaunce
And fermely impresen in his mynde
Þe leste poynte that to hym plesaunce
And verrayliche of thilk remembraunce
Desire al newe hym brende and lust to brede
Gan more þan erst and ȝet took he non hede
¶ Criseyde also right in þe same wyse
Of Troilus gan in hire herte shette
His worthinesse his lust his dedes wyse
His gentilesse and how she with hym mette
Thonkynge loue she so wal hire bisette
Desiry[n]ge efte to han hire herte deere
In swiche a plit she dorst make hym chere
¶ Pandare o morw which þat comyn was
Vn-to his nece and gan hire fayre grete
Seyde al þis nyght so reyned it allas
Þat al my drede is þat ȝe nece swete
Han litel layser had to slepe and mete
Al nyght quod he hath reyn so do wak
Þat som of vs I trowe hire heddes ake
¶ And ner he com and seyde how stant it nowe
Þis murye morwe nece how kan ȝe fare
Criseyde answerde neuere þe bet for ȝowe
Fox that ȝe ben god ȝeue ȝoure herte care
Gan helpe me so ȝe caused al þis fare
Trow I quod she / for al ȝoure wordes white
O who so seth ȝow knoweth ȝow ful lite
¶ With þat sche gan hire face for to wyre i. couere
with þe shette and wex for shame al rede
And Pandarus gan vnder for to prye
And seyde nece If þat I shal be dede
Haue here a swerde and smyte of myn hed
With þat has armes al sodeynly he thryste
Wnder hire nekke and at þe last hire kyste
¶ I passe alle þat whiche chargeth nought to seye
What god for-ȝafe his deth and she also
For-ȝaf / and whiche hire vncle gan to pleye
For other cause was ther non than [so]
But of þis thynge right to theffect for to go
when tyme was home til hire hous she wente
And Pandarus hath fully his entente
Now torne we aȝeyn to Troilus
Þat resteles ful longe a bedde lay
And priuely sente after Pandarus
To hym to com in alle þe hast he may
He com a-non nought ones seyde he nay
And Troilus ful sobrely he grette
And down vp on his bedde syde hym sette
¶ Thus Troilus with alle thaffeccion
Of frendes loue þat herte may deuyse
To Pandarus on knowes fil a-down
And er þat he wold of þe place aryse
And gan hym thonken in his beste wyse
An hondred sithe he gan þe tyme blisse
Þat he was borne to brynge hym fro distresse
¶ He seyde o frend of frendes þe alder beste
Þat euere was þe soth for to telle
Thow haste in heuene y-brought my soule at reste
Fro flagitoun þe fery floode of helle
Þat though I myght a thousand tymes selle
Vp-on a day my lyf in þi seruyse
It might nought a moote in þat suffice
Þe sonne which þat al þe world may se
Saughe neuere ȝet my lyf þat dar I laye
So Inly fayre and goodly as is she
Whos I am alle and shal til þat I dye
And þat I þus am hires dar I saye
Þat thonked be þe heigh worthynesse
of loue / and ek thy kynde bysinesse
¶ Þus hastow mo no litel thyng I-ȝeue
For-why to þe obliged be for ay
My lyf and whi for thorwh hym help I lyue
Or elles ded had I ben many a day
And with þat worde down in his bed he lay
And Pandarus ful sobrely hym herde
Til alle was seyde and þan he hym answerde
¶ My dere frende If I haue don for þe
In any cas god woot it is me lief
And am as glade as man may of it be
God help me so / but take now not agrefe
Þat I shal seyne be war of þis meschefe
Þat þar as þow now brought art in þi blisse
Þat þow þi-self ne cause it nat to mysse
¶ For of fortunes sharp aduersite
The worste kynde of infortune is þis
A man to han ben in prosperite
And it remembred when it passed is
Thart wyse y-nowgh for-þi do not a-mys
Be nought to rakel theigh thow sitte warme
For if þow be certein it wol the harme
¶ Thow art at ese and hold þe wel þer-Inne
For also seur as rede is euer fire
As grete a craft is kepe wele as wynne
Bridle alway wel þi speche and þi desire
For wordly ioie halt nought but by a wyre
Þat preueth wel it brest al day so ofte
For-thy nede is to werken with it soft
¶ Quod Troilus I hope and god to-forne
My deere freend þat I shal so me bere
Þat in my gilt þer shal no thynge be lorne
Ny nyl naught rakle as for to greuen hire
It nedeth nought þis matere oft to tere
For wistow myn herte wele Pandare
God woot of þis thow woldest litel care
¶ Tho gan he telle hym of his glad nyght
And wher-of first hire hert dred and how
And seyde frend as I am trewe knyght
And by that feith I shal to god and ȝow
I hadde it neuere half so hoote as now
And ay þe more þat desire me bitheth
To loue hire beste þe more it me deliteth
¶ I not my self nought wysely what it is
But now I feele a newe qualite
Ȝe al a nother þan I dide er þis
Pandare answerde and seyde þus þat he
Þat ones may in heuenes blisse be
he feleth othere wayes dar I leye
Than thylk tyme he first herde of it seye
¶ This is a worde for al þat Troilus
Was neuere ful to speke of þis matere
and for to preysen vn-to Pandarus
Þe bounte of his right lady deere
And Pandarus to thank and maken chere
Þis tale ay was span newe to begynne
Til þat þe nyght departed hem a-twynne
¶ Soone after þis for þat fortune it wolde
I-comen was þe blisful tyme swete
Þat Troilus was warned þat he sholde
Ther he was arst Criseyde his lady mete
For whiche he felt his herte in Ioie flete
And faithfully gan alle þe goddes herye
And lat se nowe if þat he kan be merys
¶ And holden was the ferme and al the wyse
Of hire comynge and of his also
as it was erst which nedeth nought deuyse
But pleynly to theffect right for to go
In Ioie and seurte Pandarus hem two
a-bedde brought when þat hem bothe leste
And þus they ben in quyete and in reste
¶ Nought nedeth it to ȝow syn they ben met
To ax at me If þat they blythe were
For if erst was wel tho was it bet
A thousand folde / þis nedeth nought enquere
A-go was euery sorwe and euery feere
And both I-wis they hadde and so they wende
As muche Ioie as herte may comprehende
¶ Þis nys no litel thynge of for to seye
Þis passeth euery wit for to deuyse
For ich of hem gan otheres luste obeye
Felicite which þat þise clerkes wyse
Comenden so / ne may nought here suffise
Þis Ioie may nought wryten be with Inke
Þis passeth al þat herte may bithynke
¶ But cruel day so walaway the stounde
Gan for taproche as they by signes knowe
For which hem thought felen dethes wounde
So wo was hem þat changen gan hire hew
And day they gonnen to dispise al newe
Callynge it traytour envyous and worse
And Bitterly þe dayes light they corse
¶ Quod Troilus now am I ware
That Pirors and the swyfte stedes thre
which þat drawn forth þe sonnes chare
han gon som by-path in dispite of me
Þat maketh it so sone day to be
And for þe sonne hym hasteth þus to ryse
Ne shal I neuere don hire sacrifise
¶ But nedes day depart hem most soone
And when hire speche don was and hire chere
they twynne a-non as they were wonte to doone
And setten tyme of metyng eft y-fere
And many nyght they wrought in þis manere
And þus Fortune a tyme ledde in Ioie
Criseyde and ek þis kynges sone of Troie
¶ In suffisaunce in blisse and in syngynges
Þis Troilus gan alle his lyf to lede
He spendeth Iousteth / maketh festeynynges
He ȝeueth frely olte and chaungeth wede
And hold aboute hym alway out of drede
A world of folk as com hym wel of kynde
Þe fresshiste and þe beste he koude fynde
¶ Þat swich a vois was of hym and a neuene
Thorugh-out þe world of honour and largesse
Þat it vp rong vn-to þe ȝate of heuene
And as in loue he was in swich gladnesse
Þat in his herte he demed as I gesse
That ther nys louere in þis world at ese
So wel as he / and thus gan loue hym to plese
¶ Þe goodlyhed or beaute which þat kynde
In any other lady hadde I-set
Kan nought þe mountaunce of a knotte vn-bynde
Aboute his herte of alle Criseydes net
He was so narwe Ymasked and I-knet
Þat it vn-don on any manere syde
Þat nyl nought ben for aught that may bitede
¶ And by þe hond ful oft he wolde take
Þis Pandarus and to gardyn lede
and swich a feste and swiche proces make
Hym of Criseyde and of hire wommanhede
And of hire beaute þat with-outen drede
It was an heuene his wordes for to here
And thanne he wolde synge in þis manere

LG.HEAD: (250) (Troilus's Song of Love, 1; adapted from Boethius.)
LG.L: ¶ Loue that of erith and se hath gouernaunce
Loue þat hise hestes hath in heuene hye
Loue þat with an holsom alliaunce
Halt peples Ioyned as hym liste hem gye
Loue þat knettheth law and compaignye
And couples doth in vertu for to dwelle
Bynd þis acorde þat I haue told and telle

LG.HEAD: (251) (Troilus's Song. 2.)
LG.L: ¶ Þat that the world with faith which þat is stable
Dyuerseth so his stoundes concordynge
Þat Elementȝ þat ben so discordable
holden a bond perpetualy durynge
Þat Phebus mot his rosy carte forth brynge
And þat þe mone hath lorchip ouere þe nyghtes
Al þis doth loue ay heryed be his myght

LG.HEAD: (252) (Troilus's song. 3.)
LG.L: ¶ That that þe se þat gredy is to flewen
Constreyneth to a certeyn ende so
Hise flodes þat so fiersly they ne growen
To dreuchen erth and alle for euere mo
And if þat love aught lete his brydel go
Al þat now loueth a-sonder shold lepe
And lost were al þat loue halt now to hepe

LG.HEAD: (253) (Troilus's Song. 4.)
LG.L: ¶ Soo wold god þat auctour of his kynde
Þat with his bond / loue of his vertu liste
To cerclen hertes alle and fast bynde
Þat from his bonde ne wiste þe wey out wyste
And hertes colde hem wold I þat he twiste
To make hem loue and þat hem li-te ay rewe
On hertes soore and kepe hem þat ben trewe
¶ In alle the nedes for þe townes werre
He was / and ay þe firste in armes dighte
And certeynly but-if þat bokes erre
Saue ector most I-drede of any wight
And þis encres of hardynesse and myght
Com hym of loue his ladyes thank to wynne
Þat altered his spirit so with-Inne
¶ In tyme of trewe on haukynge wold he ryde
Or elles hunte boore / beere or lyon
Þe smale bestes leete he gon bysyde
And when þat he com rydynge in to town
Ful oft his lady from hire wyndow down
As fresh as faucon comen out of muwe
Ful redy was hym goodly to salwe
¶ And most of loue and vertu was his speche
And in dispit hadde alle wrechednesse
And douteles no nede was hym biseche
To honouren hem þat hadds worthynesse
And esen hem þat weren in distresse
And glad was he if any wight wel feerde
Þat louer was when he it wiste or herde
¶ For soth to seyn he lost held euery wight
But if he were in loues heigh seruyse
I mene folk þat ought it ben of right
And ouere alle þis so wele koude he deuyse
Of sentement / and in so vnkouthe wyse
Al his array / þat euery louer thoughte
Þat al was wel what so he seyde or wroughte
¶ And though þat he com of blode royal
Hym liste of pride at no wight for to chace
Beninge he was to eche in general
For which he gat hym thanke in euery place
Thus wold loue I-heried be his grace
Þat pride and Ire enuye and auarice
he gan to fle and euery-ich other vice
¶ Thow laydy bryght the doughter to Dyon
Thy blynde and vynged sone ek dam opide
Ȝe sustren nyne ek þat by Elycone
In hil Parnaso listen for tabide
Þat ȝe þus fer hem deyned me to gyde
I kan namore but syn þat ye wol wende
Ȝe heried ben for ay with-outen ende
¶ Thorwgh ȝow haue I seyde fully in my songe
Theffect and Ioie of Troilus seruyse
Al bi þat þer was som disese among
As to myn auctour listeth to deuyse
My thridde book now ende ich in þis wyse
And Troilus in luste and in quiete
Is with Criseyde his owen herte swete

HEADNOTE.P: [A leaf has been cut out of the Cambridge Univ. Libr. MS. Gg. 4. 27.]
[Leaf 54 has been cut out of this MS.]

LG.L: ¶ And lord how þat his herte gan to quappe
Herynge hire come & schorte for to sike
And Pandarus þat ledde hire bi þe lape
Come ner & gan in at þe curteyn pike
And seyde god do bote on alle sike
Se who is here ȝow come to visite
Lo here is sche þat is ȝore deþ to wite
// Þerewith it semed as he wept almost
Ha. a. a. quod Troilus so reufully
Where me be wo o myȝti god þou wost
Who is al þere I se not trewely
Sere quod Crisseide it is pandarus & I
Ȝa swete herte allas I may not rise
To knele and don ȝow honour in sumwise
¶ And dressede him vpward & sche ryȝt þo
Gan boþe hire hondis softe on him leye
O for þe loue of god do ȝe not so
To me quod he I what is þis to saye
Sire comyn am I to ȝow for causis tweie
ffyrst ȝow to þanken & of ȝoure lordschepe ek
Contynuaunce & wolde ȝow be-sek
// Þis Troilus his ladi [by corrector] that herde preye [by corrector]
Of lordschepe him wex neyþer quik ne ded
Ne myȝte a word for schame to it seye
Al-þow men schūlden smytyn of his hed
But lord so he wex sodeynli red
And sire his lessoun þat he wende cunne
To preyȝen hire was þour his 2 wit ronne 2 [2-2 by corrector]
¶ Crisseide al þis a-spiede wel I-now
ffor sche was wis & loued him neuer þe les
Al nere he maleapert or made it tough
Or was to bold to synge a fol a masse
But whan his schame gan sumwhat to passe
His werkis as I may myne ryme holde
I wil ȝow tellyn as techin bokis olde
¶ In chaunnged vois riȝt for his verrai drede
Wich voys ek quok & þerto his manere
Goodli a-bassed & now his hewis rede
Now pale on to Crisseide his ladi dere
With lok doun cast & vmbele & ȝoldyn chere
Lo þe aldir ferste word þat him ouersterte
Was twiȝis mercy mercy swete herte
// And stynte a while & whan ne myȝte ouȝt brynge
Þe nexte word was god wot for I haue
As fer-forþ-lich as I haue had cunnynge
Ben ȝouris al god so myn soule saue
And schal til þat I woful wiȝt be graue
And þow I dar ne can on to ȝow pleyne
I-wis I suffere not þe lasse peyne
¶ Þus meche as now I womanliche wyf
I may ouȝt brynge & ȝif þis ȝow displese
Þat schal I wrekyn ryȝt on myn owene lyf
Ryȝt sone I trowe & don ȝoure selue an ese
Ȝif with myn deþ ȝoure wreþe I may a-pese
ffor siþe ȝe han herd me sumwhat seye
Now reche I neuere how sone þat I deye
// Þerwith his manli sorwe to be-holde
It myȝte a mad an herte of ston to rewe
And pandarus wepte as he to watyr wolde
And pokede euere his nece newe & newe
And seide wo begon ben hertis trewe
ffor loue of god mak of þis þyng an ende
Or slo vs boþe atonys or ȝe winde
¶ I what quod sche bi god & be myn treuthe
I not what ȝe wiln þat I seye
I wot quod he þat ȝe on him 1 han routhe 1 [1-1 by corrector]
ffor goddis loue & do him not to deye
Now þanne þus quod sche I wolde him preiȝe
To telle me þe fyn of his entent
Ȝit woste I neuere wil what þat he ment
¶ What þat I mene o swete herte dere
Qud troilus o goodeli frosche fre
Þat with þe stremys of ȝoure eynyn clere
Ȝe woldyn frenli sumtyme on me se
And þanne a-gren þat I may ben he
With-outyn braunche of vice in ony wise
In trouthe alwoi to don ȝow myn seruise
// As to myn lady · riȝt & chif resort
With al myn wit & al myn diligence
And I to han riȝt as ȝow list confort
Vndir ȝoure ȝerde egal to myn offense
As deþ ȝif þat I breke ȝoure defence
And þat ȝow digne me so mechil honour
Me to mendin ouȝt in ony our
¶ And to ben ȝoure verray humbele trewe
Secret & in myne peynis pacient
And eueremore to desiryn frosch newe
To seruyn and ay ben I-lik diligent
And with good herte al holly ȝoure talent
Resseiuyn wel how sore þat me smert
Lo þis mene I myn owene swete hert
// Quod Pandarus lo here an hard request
And resonabele a ladi for to werne
Now nece myn be natal Iouis fest
Were I god ȝe schulde sterue as ȝerne
Þat heryn wil þis man wil noþyng ȝerne
But ȝoure honour & sen him almost sterue
An ben so loþ to sufferyn him ȝow to serue
¶ With þat sche gan hire eyen on him cast
fful esili & ful debonerli
And send hire & hied not to fast
With neuere a word but seid him sekyrly
Myn honour sauyn I wil wel trewely
And in swich forme as ȝe can now deuyse
Resseyuyn him fulli to myn seruyse
¶ Be-sechyng hym for goddis loue þat he
Wolde in honour of treuthe & gentillesse
As I wel mene / mene wel to me
And myn honour with wit & busynesse
Ay kepyn & ȝif I may don him gladnesse
ffrom henys forþ I-wis I nyl not feyne
Now beþ al hol no lengere ȝe ne peyne
// But neuer-þeles þis warne I ȝow quod sche
A kyngis sone al-þow ȝe ben I-wis
Ȝe schal no more han seurete of me
In loue þan ryt in þat cas is
Ne I nil not forbere ȝif ȝe don amis
To wrathe ȝow & [h by corrector] whil þat ȝe me serue
Cherise yow riȝt as ȝe deserue
¶ And schortli dere herte & al myn knyȝt
Beþ glad & drawiþ ȝow to lustinesse
And I schal trewely with al myn fulle myȝt
Ȝure bittyr turne al in-to swetnesse
Ȝif I be sche þat may ȝow don gladnesse
ffor euery wo ȝe schul recouere a blisse
And him in armys tok & gan him kisse
// ffel Pandarus on kneis & vp his eyȝyn
To heuene þrew & hild his hondis hyȝe
O inmortal god quod he þat mayst not deyȝen
Cupide I mene of þis mayst þou glorifie
And venus maist þou make melodie
With-outyn hond me semyþ þat in tounne
ffor þis merakele I here iche belle sounne
¶ But ho no more now of þis matere
ffor whi þese folk wele comyn vp a-non
Þat han þe lettere red lo I hem here
But I coniourre þe Crisseide a-non
And þe þou Troilus whan þou mayȝt gon
Þat at myn hous ȝe ben at myn warnynge
ffor I schal ful wel scape ȝoure commynge
¶ And ese ȝow þere ryȝt I-now
And lat sen wich of ȝow schal bere þe belle
To speke of loue and ryȝt þerwith he low
ffor þere haue ȝe a leiser for to telle
Quod Troilus how longe schal I dwelle
Or þis be don quod he er þou mayȝt ryse
Þis þyng schal ben riȝt as þou wilt deuyse
// With þat Elyne & also Deiphebus
Þo comyn vpward riȝt at þe steiȝeris ende
And lord so þo / gan gronyn troilus
His broþer & his sustir to blende
Quod pandarus it tyme is þat we wende
Takyþ nece myn / ȝourre leue at alle þre
And lat hem speke / & comyþ forþ with me
¶ Sche tok hire leue at hem ful þriftyly
As sche wel coude & þey hire reuerence
Vn-to þe fulle dudyn hardily
And spekyn wondir wel in hire absence
Of hire preisyng of hire excellence
Hire gouernaunce hire wit & hire manere
Comendenyt ioye was to here
// Now let hire wende onto hire owene place
And turne we to troilis a-ȝein
Þat gan ful lyȝtely of þis lettere passe
Þat deiphebus hadde in þe gardyn seyn
And of elyne & him he wolde feyn
Delyuerid ben & seide þat hym list
Slepe & aftyr talis hauyn rest
¶ Elyne hym kist & tok hire leue blyue
Deiphebus & hom wente euery wiȝt
And pandarus as faste as he may dryue
To Troilus þo come as lyne ryȝt
And on a paylet al þat glade nyȝt
By Troilus he lay with ful blisful chere
To tale & wel was hem þat þey weryn in fere
¶ Whan eueri wyȝt was woyd but þey to
And alle þe doris were faste schette
To tellyn in schort with-outyn wordis mo
Þis pandarus with-outyn ony lette
Vp ros & on his beddis syde him sette
And gan to spekyn in sobere wise
To troilus as I schal ȝow deuyse
// Myn aldir leueste lord & broþer dere
God wot þat it sat me so sore
Whan I þe say so languissyng to ȝere
ffor loue of wich þyn wo waxeþ alwey more
Þat I wot al myn wit & al myn lore
Haue sythe don euere myn besinesse
To brynge þe to ioye out of distresse
¶ And haue it brouȝt to swich plyȝt as þou wost
So þat þour me þou stondist in þe weye
To fare wel I seye it for no bost
And wost þou whi for schame it is to seye
ffor þe haue I be-gunne a game pleye
Wich þat I schal neuere for oþer
Al-þow he were a þousent fold myn broþer
// Þat is to seyne for þe I am be-comyn
Be-twixe game & ernest swich a mene
As makyn women on-to men comyn
Þou wost þyn seluyn what I wolde mene
ffor þe I haue myn nece of vicis clene
So fulli mad þin gentilnesse trist [i corrected]
Þat al schal ben riȝt as þyn seluyn list
¶ But god þat al wot take I to witnesse
Þat neuere I þis for coueitise wrouȝt
But only to abregge þat distresse
ffor wich wol ny þou deyedist as mo þouȝt
But goode broþer do now as ȝe ouȝt
ffor goddis loue & kepe hire out of blame
Syþe þou art wis so kep alwoy hire name
¶ ffor wel þou wost þe name ȝit of hire
A-mong þe pepil as ho seiþ halwid is
ffor neuere was þere wiȝt I dare wel swere
Þat euere wiste þat sche dede a-mys
But wo is me þat I þat cause al þis
May þynkyn þat sche is myn nece dere
And I hire em & tretour ek in fere
// And were it wost þat I þour myn engyn
Hadde in myn nece put þyn fantesie
To don þyn lust & holli to ben þyne
Whi al þe world wolde on it gaure & crie
And seyn þat I þe werste trecherie
Dede in þis cas þat euere was begunne
And sche forlost & þow ryȝt nouȝt Iwonne
¶ Wherfore or I wele ferþere gon a pas
Ȝit eft I þe be-seche & fully seye
Þat priuite go with vs in þis cas
Þat is to seine þat þou vs neuere wreye
And be not wroþ þus I þe ofte preie
To holdyn secre swich an hey matere
ffor skilful is / þou wost wel þis preiere
// And þink what wo þere haþ be-tid or þis
ffor makynge of auauntis as men rede
And what myschauns in þis world ȝit is
ffrom day to day riȝt for þat wekkede dede
ffor whi þese wise clerkis þat ben dede
Han euere ȝit prouerbid to vs ȝonge
Þat fyrst vertu is to kepe tunge
¶ And neuere ȝit þat I wilne as now to a-bregge
Diffusioun of speche I coude almost
A þousent olde storijs to a-legge
Of whom men loste þour false & folis bost
Prouerbis canst þou þyn seluyn & wost
A-ȝens þat vis for to ben a labbe
Þow men soþ seidyn as oftyn as þei gabbe
¶ O tonge allas so oftyn here be-forn
Hast þou mad manye a ladi bryȝt of hewe
Sayd welleawey þat euere I was born
And manye a maydenys sorwe for to newe
And for þe more part al is vn-trewe
Þat men of ȝelp & it were brouȝt to preue
Of kynde non auauntour is to leue
// Awauntour & a liere is al on
As þus I pose a woman grauntede me
Hire loue & seyþ þat oþer wil sche non
And I am sworn to holdyn it secre
And aftyr I go telle it to or þre
I-wis I am auantour at þe leste
And lire for I breke myn beheste
¶ Now loke þanne ȝif þey ben ouȝt to blane
Swiche maner folk what schal I clepe hem what
Þat hem auauntyn of women & be name
Þat neuere ȝit be-hyȝt hem þis ne þat
Ne knowyn hym more þan myn olde hat
No wondir ist so god me sende hele
Þey wemen dredin with vs men to dele
// I sei not þis for no mys-trost of ȝow
Ne for no wis man but for folis nyce
And for þe harm þat in þe world is now
As wel for folye oftyn as for maleys
ffor wel wot I in wise folk þat vise
No woman drat ȝif sche be wel auysed
ffor wise ben be folys harm chastised
¶ But now to purpos leue broþer dere
Haue al þis þyng þat I haue seid in mynde
And kep þe clos & be now of good chere
ffor at myn day þou schat me trewe fynde
I schal þyn proces settyn in swich a kynde
And god to-forn þat it schal þe suffise
ffor it schal be riȝt as þou wilt deuyse
¶ ffor I wot wel þou menist wel parde
Þerfore I dare wel þis vndir-take
Þou wost ek what þyn ladi graunted þe
And day is set þe charteris vp to make
Haue now good nyȝt I may no lengere wake
And bid for me siþe þow art now in blisse
Þat god me sende deþ or sone lisse
// Ho myȝte tellyn half þe ioye of feste
Which þat þe soule of Troilus felte
Herynge þe effectis of Pandarus behest
His olde wo þat made his herte to swelte
Gan þo for ioye wastyn & to-melte
And al þe richesse of his sikis sore
At onys fledde he felte of hem no more
¶ But riȝt so as þei se holtis & þis halis
Þat han in wyntir ded ben & drye
Reuestyn hem in grene whan þat may is
Whan euery lusty lestyþ best to pleye
Ryȝt in þat selwe wise soþ to seye
Wex sodeynli his herte ful of ioye
Þat gladere was þan ony man in troye
// And gan his lok on pandarus vp cast
fful soberely & frenly on to se
And seyde frend in aprille þe last
As wel þou wost ȝif it rememberid be
How ney þe deþ / for wo þou fond me
And how þou dedist al þyn besinesse
To knowyn of me þe cause of þin distresse
¶ Þou wost wel longe i it for-bar to seye
To þe þat art þe man þat I best trost
And peril wast non it to þe be-wreye
Þat wost i wel but tel me þif þou lest
Sey I soþ loþ wast þat þyn self it wost
How durste I more tellyn of þis matere
Þat quake now & no wyȝt may vs here
¶ But neuere þe les be þat god I þe swere
Þat as him lyst may al þe world gouerne
And ȝif I lye achilles with his spere
Myn herte clene al were myn lif eterne
As I am mortal ȝif I late or ȝerne
Wolde it be wereye or durste or schulde cunne
ffor al þe good þat god made vndir sunne
// What raþere deye I wolde þan determyne
As þynkyþ me now stokked in presoun
In wrechedenesse in felthe & in vermyne
Captyf to crewel kyng agamenoun
And þis in alle þe tempelis of þis toun
Vp-on þe goddys alle I wele ȝow swere
To morwe day ȝif þat it likiþ þe here
¶ And þat þou hast so meche don for me
Þat I it may it neuere more deserue
Þis knowe I wel al myȝte I not for þe
A þousent tymys on a morwyn steruyn
I can no more but þat I wil þe seruyn
Ryȝt as þyn knaue whedyr so þow wynde
ffor euere on-to myn lyuys ende
// But here with al myn herte I þe be-seche
Þat neuere in me þou deme swich folye
As I schal seye me þouȝt be þyn speche
Þat þis which þou me dost for cumpanye
I schulde wene it were a bauderye
I am not wod al-þow I lewid be
It is nouȝt on þat wot I wel parde
¶ But he þat goþ for gold or for rychesse
On swich massage cal him as þe lyst
And þis as þow dost cal it gentilnesse
Compascioun & felauschepe & trist
Departe it so / for weyde wher is wist
How þat þere is diuersite requyred
Be-tweþe twey þyngis as I haue lernyd
¶ And þat þou knowe I þynke not ne wene
Þat þis seruyse a schame be or iape
I haue myn fayre sistir pollexene
Cassaundir Elyne or ony of þe frape
Be sche neuere so fayr ne so wel schape
Tel me which þou wilt of euerychon
To han for þyn & let me þanne a-lon
// But siþe þou hast me don þis seruyse
Myn lyf to saue & for non hope of mede
So for þe loue of god þis grete emprise
Parforne it out for now is most nede
ffor hey & low with-outyn ony drede
I wil alwoy þynne hestis alle kepe
Haue now good nyȝt & lat vs boþe slepe
¶ Þus halt hem eche of oþer wel a-payed
Þat al þe world ne myȝt it bet a-mende
And on þe morwe whan þey were a-raied
Eche to his owene nede gan entende
But troylus þo as þe fyr brende
ffor scharp desyr of hope & of plesaunce
He not for-ȝat his wise gouernaunce
// But in him self with manhod gan restreyne
Eche rakil dede & eche onbrydelid chere
Þat alle þo þat lyuyn soþ to seyne
Ne schulde a wist be word ne by manere
What þat he ment as touchynge þis matere
ffrom iche in þat as fer as is þe cloude
He was so wel / dissimulyn he coude
¶ And al þis while which þat I deuyse
Þis was his lyf with al his fulle myȝt
By day he was in martis hey seruyse
Þat is to seyn in armys as a knyȝt
And for þe moste part þe longe nyȝt
He lay & þouȝte how þat he myȝt serue
His ladi best hire þonk for to deserue
¶ Nyl I not swere al-þow he lay softe
Þat in his þouȝt he was sumwhat desesed
Ne þat he turned on his pilwis ofte
And wolde of þat hym mysesid / han ben esed
But in swich cas man is not wel plesed
ffor ouȝt I wot nomore þan was he
Þat can I deme of possibilite
// But serteyn is / to purpos fo to go
Þat in þis while as wretyn is in geste
He say his lady sumtyme & also
Sche with him spak whan þat sche durste or leste
Ay be here boþe auys as was beste
Apoyntende ful warly in þis nede
So as þey durste so as þey wolde procede
¶ But it was spokyn in so schort a wyse
In swich a wayt al day & swich a fere
Lest ony wyȝt deuynyn or deuyse
Wolde in þis speche or to it leyn an ere
Þat al þis word so lef to hem ne were
As þat Cupide wolde hem spase synde
To makyn of here spech aryȝt an ende
// But þe ilke lityl þat þei speke or wrouȝt
His wise gost tok of alle sweche hede
It semede hire he worste what sche þouȝt
With-outyn word so þat it was non nede
To bid him out to don or ouȝt forbede
ffor wich sche þouȝte þat loue al come it late
Of alle Ioye hadde openyd hire þe ȝate
¶ And schortly of þis proces for to pase
So wel his werk & wordis he be-set
Þat he so ful stod in his ladi grace
Þat twenty þousent tymys or sche let
Sche þankede god sche euere with hym met
So coude he him gouerne in þat serwyse
Þat al þe world ne myȝte it bet deuyse
¶ ffor why sche fond him so discret in al
So secret & of swich obeysaunce
Þat wel sche wiste he was to hire a wal
Of stel & schild from eueri displesaunce
Þat to ben in his goode gouernaunce
So wys he was sche was no more aferid
I mene as fer as auȝte to ben requeryd
// And pandarus to queke alwoy þe fyre
Was euere I-lik prest & diligent
To esyn his frend was alwoy his desyre
He schof ay on he to & fro was sent
He letteris bar whan Troylus was absent
Þat neuere man as in his frendis nede
Ne bar him bet as he with-outyn drede
¶ But now parantyr summan waytyn wolde
Þat euery word soun or lok or chere
Of troylus þat I reherse schulde
In al þis while onto his ladi dere
I trowe it were a long tyme for to here
Or of what wit þat stant in swich disioynte
Hise wordis alle or euery lok to peynte
// ffor soþe I haue not herd don or þis
In story ne no man here I wene
And þow I coude I wolde not I-wis
ffor þere was sum pistil hem be-twene
As wolde as seyth myn autour wel conteyne
Nyȝ half þis bok of wich hym list not write
How schulde I þanne a lyne þerof endite
¶ But to þe grete affect þan seyde I þus
Þat stondyng in concord & in quiete
Þese ilke too Cresseide & ek troilus
As I haue told & in þis tyme swete
Saue only ofte wel myȝte þey me
No leiser haue here speche to fulfille
Þat it be fel riȝt as I schal ȝow telle
¶ Þat Pandarus wich euere dede his myȝt
Ryȝt for þe fyn þat I schal speke of here
As for to bryngyn to his hous sum nyȝt
His fayre nece & troilus in fere
Where as at leyser al þis heye matere
Touchynge hire loue were at þe fulle vp bounde
Lad out of doute a tyme to it founde
// ffor he with gret deliberacioun
Hadde euery þyng þat herto myȝte auaylyn
fforn cast & put in execucioun
And neyþer lest for cost ne for travayle
Come of hem lyst / hem schulde no þyng fayle
Ne for to ben in auȝt aspyed þere
Þat wist he wel & impossibele were
¶ Dredeles it cler was in þe wynde
Of euery pye of euery lette game
Now al is wel for al þe world is blynd
In þis matere boþe frend & tame
Þis tymbir is / al redi vp to frame
Vs lakkyth not but we wetyn wolde
A certeyn our in whiche comyn schulde
// And Troylus þat al þis 1 newe daunce 1 [1-1 by corrector]
Knew at þe fulle and waytid on it ay
Hadde vp on here mad his puruyaunce
And fond his cause & þerto al þe aray
Þat ȝif þat he were myssid nyȝt or day
Þe while he was a-boutyn his seruyse
Þat he was gon to don his sacrifise
¶ And muste at swich a tempele a boue wake
Answerid of apollo for to be
And ferst to se þe holy laurer quak
Or þat þe god ouȝt speke out of þe tre
To tellyn hym next / whi þe grekys xulde fle
And for þy / lette hym no man god forbede
But preye apollo helpyn in þis nede
¶ Now is þere lityl more for to done
But pandarus vp & schortli for to seyne
Lo sone vp-on þe schaungyng of þe mone
Whan lyȝtles is þe world a nyȝt or tweyene
And þat þe walkyn schop hym forto reyne
He streyt on morwe on-to his nece wente
Ȝe han wel herd þe fyn of his entente
// Whan he was come he gan a-non to pleye
As he was wont & of him seluyn iape
And fynally he swor & gan hire seye
Be þis & þat sche schulde hym not a-skape
Ne don him lengere aftir hire to gape
But serteynli sche muste bi hire leue
Cum suppe in his hous with hym at eue
¶ At which sche low & gan hire faste excuse
And seyde it reynyþ lo how schulde I gon
Let ben quod he ne stond not þus to muse
Þis mot ben don ȝe schal ben þere a-non
So at þe laste herof þey felle at on
Or ell softe he swor hire in hire ere
He wolde neuere come þer sche were
// Sone aftir þis sche gan to hym to rounne
And axed hym ȝif þat Troilus was þere

A bedde weryn þere as I haue seyd

Now blisful venus þou me grace synde

ffor which pallas was with a-glouros wroþ

Þat for to holdyn in loue a man in honde

As ȝe in myn þe whech þyng trewely
Me leuere were þan þese wordis tweyne
Ȝit schulde I bet enduryn al myn peyne
¶ So þat Cresseyde answeride & þat a-non
And with a sik sche seyde o herte dere
Þe game I-wis so fer forþ now is gon
Þat fyrst schal phebus falle from his spere
And euery egele ben þe doūuys fere
And euery rok out of his place stert
Or Troylus out / of Cresseydis hert
// Ȝe ben so depe in-with myn herte graue
Þat þow I wolde it turne out of myn þoȝut
As wisely wery god myn soule saue
To deyȝin in þe pleyne I coude notiȝt
And for þe loue of god þat haþ us wrouȝt
Let in ȝoure brayn non oþer fantasye
So crepe þat is cause me to deye
¶ And ȝe me wolde han as faste in mynde
As I haue ȝow þat wolde I ȝow be-seche
And ȝif I woste soþly þat to fynde
God myȝte not a poynt myne ioyes eche
But herte myn with-oute more speche
Beþ to me trewe or ellis it were reuthe
ffor I am þyn bi god & be myn treuthe
// Beþ glad forþy & leuyth in sekirnesse
Þis seide I neuere er þis ne schal to mo
And ȝif to ȝow it were a gret gladnes
To turne a-ȝen sone aftyr ȝe were go
As fayn wolde I as ȝe it were so
As wisely god myn herte brynge at rest
And hym in armys tok & ofte kyst
¶ A-ȝen his wil syþe it mot nedis be
Þis Troilus vp & faste hym clede
And in his armys tok his ladi fre
An hunderid tyme & on his woye him spede
And with swich vois / as þow his herte blede
He seide far wel dere herte swete
Þere god vs graute sone 1 for to mete 1 [1-1 corrected]
¶ To which no word for sorwe sche answerde
So sore gan his partynge hire distreyne
And troylus on to his paleys ferde
As woo-be-gon as sche. was soþ to seyne
So harde hym wrong of scharp desirie peyne
ffor to ben eft þere he was in plesaunce
Þat it may neuere out of his remembraunce
// Ho turnede to his rial paleys sone
He softe in-to his bed gan for to slynke
To slepe longe as he was wone to done
But al for nouȝt he may wel ligge & wynke
But slepe ne may þerin his herte synke
Þynkynge how sche for whom desir him brende
A þousent fold [fold corrected] was worþy / more þan he wende
¶ And in his þouȝt gan vp & doun to wende
Hire wordis alle and euery cuntenance
And formely in preysyng in his mynde
Þe leste poynt þat to hym was plesaunce
And verayly of þeilke remembraunce
Desyr al newe hym brende & lust to brede
Gan more þan erst & ȝit tok he non hede
// Criseyde also ryȝt in þe selue wise
Of troylus gan here herte schette
His worþynesse his lust his dedis wise
His gentilnesse & how sche with hym mette
Þankynge loue he so wel hire be-sette
Desyrynge eft to han hire herte dere
At swich a plyȝt sche durste make him chere
¶ Pandarus a morwe wich þat comyn was
In [n corrected] to his nece & gan hire fayre grete
Seyde al þis nyȝt so reynyd it allas
Þat al myn dred is þat ȝe nece swete
Han lityl leyser had / to slepe & mete
Al nyȝt quod sche haþ reyn so don me wake
Þat some of hem I trowe here heuedis ake
¶ And ner he come & seyde how stont it now
Þis merie morwe nece how can ȝe fare
Crisseyde ansswerede neuere þe bet for ȝow
ffor þat ȝe ben god ȝif ȝoure herte care
God helpe me so ȝe can syre [syre corrected] al þis fare
Trowe I quod sche for alle þese wordis white
Who so seth ȝow / knowe ȝow ful lyte
// With þat sche gan hire face for to wrye
With þe schete & wex for schame al red
And pandarus gan in for to pryke
And seyde nece ȝit þat schal be ded
Haue here a swerd & smyte of myn hed
With þat hise arm al sodeynly he þrest
Vndir hire nekke & at þe laste hire kyst
¶ I passe al þat / swich chargith not to sey
What god for-ȝaf his deþ & sche also
ffor ȝaf / & with hire vnkele gan to pleye
ffor oþer cause was þere non þan so
But of þis þyng to þe effecte to go
Whan tyme was hom to hire hous sche went
And pandarus haþ fully his entent
// Now turne we a-ȝyn to troylus
Þat resteles ful longe a bedde lay
And priuyli sente aftyr pandarus
To hym to come in al þe haste he may
He com a-non / not onys seyde he na
And troylus ful sobirly he grette
And doun vp on his beddis syde him sette
¶ Þis troilus with al affeccioun
Of frendis loue þat herte may deuyse
To pandarus on kneis fel a-doun
And er þat he wolde of þe place a-ryse
He gan hym þanke in his beste wise
An hunderid tyme & gan þe tyme blysse
Þat he was born to brynge hym from distresse
¶ He seyde o frend of frendis aldyr best
Þat euere was þe soþe for to telle
Þou hast in heuene brouȝt myn soule at rest
ffrom flegetoun þe fery flod of helle
Þat þow I myȝte a þousent tyme selle
Vp-on a day myn lyf in þyn seruyse
It myȝte not a mote in þat suffyse
// Þe sunne which þat al þe world may se
Saw neuere ȝit myn lyf þat dar I lay
So Inly fayr & goodli as is sche
Whois I am al & schal tyl þat I day
And þat I am þus ȝouris [u corrector] may I say
Þat þankid be þe hye worþynes
Of loue & ek þyn kynde besynes
¶ Þus hast þou me no lytil þyng I-ȝeue
ffor which obligid be for ay
Myn lyf / fro þour þyn helpe I leue
Or ellys ded hade I ben manye a day
And with þat word doun in his bed he lay
And pandarus ful soberely hym herde
Til al was sayd & þanne he þus answerde
// Myn dere frend if I haue don for þe
In ony cas I wot it is me lef
And am as glad as man may of it be
God helpe me so but tak now not a gref
Þat I schal seyn be war of þis myschef
Þat þere as now / art / brouȝt // in to blisse
Þat þou þyn self ne cause it not to mysse
¶ for of fortunys scharp aduersite
Þe werste kynde / of infortune is þis
A man to han ben in prosperite
And it remembryn whan it passid is
Þu art wys I-now forþi do not a-mys
Be not to rakyl þow þou sytte warme
ffor ȝif þou be certeyn it wol [corrector] þe harme
¶ Þou art at ese & hold þe wel þerinne
ffor al so seur as red is euery fyre
As gret a craft is kepe wel as wynne
Brydele al wey wel þyn speche & þyn desyr
ffor wordelis ioye haldyþ not but a wyr
Þat preue I wel it brestyþ al day so ofte
fforþy nede is to werchyn with it softe
// Quod Troylus & god to-forne
Myn dere frend þat I schal so me bere
Þat in myn gylt þere schal no þyng be lorne
Ne .I. wil not rakele as for to greuyn hire
It nedyþ not þis þyng al day to tere
ffor wistist þou myn herte wel pandare
God wot of þis þou woldist litil care
¶ Þanne gan he telle hym of his gladde nyȝt
And wherof fyrst his herte dredde & how
And seyde frend as I am trewe knyȝt
And be þat feyth I schal to god & ȝow
I hadde it neuere half so ofte as now
And ay þe more þat desyr me bityþ
To louyn hire best þe more me delityth
// I not myn self not wisely what it is
But now I fele a newe qualite
Ȝa al a noþer þan I dede or þis
Pandaris answered and seyde þus þat he
Þat onys may in heuene blisse be
He felyth oþere woyis dar I lay
Þan ilke tyme he fyrst of herde it say
¶ Þis is a word for al þis troylus
Was neuere ful to speke of þis matere
And for-to preysyn vn-to pandarus
Þe bounte of his ryȝte lady dere
And Pandarus to þanke & make chere
Þis tale ay was spannewe to be-gynne
Til þat nyȝt departyd hem a twynne
¶ Sone aftyr þis for þat fortune it wolde
I-comyn was þe blysful tyme swete
Þat Troylus was warnyd þat he schulde
Þere he was erst Crisseyde his lady mete
ffor whi he felte his herte in ioye flete
And fayfully gan alle þe goddis [ddi corrected] herye
And lat se now ȝif þat he can be merye
// And holdyn was þe forme & þe wyse
Of hire comynge & ek of his also
As it was erst which nedyþ not deuyse
But pleynly to þe effectis for to go
In ioye & seurete Pandarus hem to
Abede brouȝt whan hem boþe lest
And þus þey ben in quiete & in rest
¶ Not nedyþ it to ȝow sithe þey ben mette [te added]
To axe at me ȝif þat þey blyþe were
ffor ȝif it erst was wel þo wa it bette [te added]
A þousent fold þis nedyþ not to enquyre
A-gon was euery sorwe & euery fere
And boþe Iwis þey hadde & so þey wende
As meche ioye as herte may comprehende
// Þis nys no lytil þyng of for to sey
Þis passeþ euery wyȝt forto deuyse
ffor eche of hem gan oþeris lust obeye
ffelicite which þat þese clerkys wise
Comendyn so ne may not hire suffyse
2 This passyth al that herte may bethynke
This Ioye may not wretyn ben wyth ynke
¶ But crewel deth so wellowoy the stonnde 2 [2-2 by corrector]
Gan for ta-proche as þey be sygnys knewe
ffor whiche he in ȝouthe felte deþis wonde
So wo has hem þat schongyn gan here hewe
A day þey gan to despise al newe
Calle it traytour enuyous & werse
And bittyrly þe dayis lyȝt þey curse
¶ Quod Troylus allas now am I war
Þat Pirus & þe swifte stede ire
Wich þat drawyn forþ þe sunnys char
Han gon sum bipaþ in dispit of me
Þat makiþ it so sone day to be
And for þe sunne hym hastyþ so to ryse
Ne schal I neuere don hym sacrifise
// But nedis day departyn hem muste sone
And whan here speche don was & here chere
Þey twyn a-non as þey were wone to done
And sette tyme of me-tyng eft in fere
And manye a nyȝt þey wrouȝte in þis manere
And þus fortune a tyme led in ioye
Cresseyde & ek þis kyngis sone of Troye
¶ In suffisauns in blis & in segyngys
Þis Troylus gan [a alterd] al his lyf to lede
He spendyth iustyþ makyþ festyngys
He ȝeuyth frely ofte & chaungyþ wede
And held a-boute hym alwey out of drede
A world of folk as come hym wel of kynde
Þe frossest þe best he coude fynde
// Þat swich a vois of hym was & a steuene
Þour-out þe world of honour & largesse
Þat it vp rong ryȝt to þe ȝate of heuene
And as in loue he was in swich gladnesse
Þat in his herte he demyd as I gesse
Þat þere ne is louere in þis world at ese
So wel as he & so gan loue hym plese
¶ Þe godlyhid & bounte which þat kynde
In ony oþer ladi at sette
Can not þe mountenans of a knot onbynde
Aboute his herte of al Crissides nette
He was so harde I-maskid & I-knette
Þat it ondon on ony maner syde
Þat nyl not ben for nouȝt þat may betyde
¶ And by þe hond ful ofte he wolde take
Þis pandarus & in-to gardyn lede
And swich a feste & swich a proces make
Hym of Crisseyde & of hire womanhede
And of hire beute þat with-outyn drede
It was an heuene his wordis for to here
And þanne wolde he synge in his manere

LG.HEAD: (250) (Troilus's Song of Love, 1; adapted from Boethius.)
LG.L: // Loue þat of erþe & se haþ gouernaunce
Loue þat his hestis haþ in heuene hye
Loue þat with an holsom allyaunce
Hast pepelys ioyny as hym list hem seye
Loue þat endytyþ lawe of cumpanye
And coupelys doþ in vertu for to dwelle
Bynd þis acord þat I haue told & telle

LG.HEAD: (251) (Troilus's Song. 2.)
LG.L: ¶ Þat þere þe world with fayth þat is onstabele
Dyuersith so his stoundis concordyng
Þat elementis þat ben so discordabele
Hold in a bounde perpetuel duryng
Þat Phebus may his rosi day forþ brynge
And þat þe mone haþ lorschepe ouer þe nytyȝs
Al þis doþ loue & heryed be his myȝtys

LG.HEAD: (252) (Troilus's Song. 3.)
LG.L: // Þat þere þe se þat gredi is to flowyn
Constreynyþ to a certeyn ende so
His flodis þat so fersely þey ne growyn
To drenchyn erþe & al for euere-mo
And ȝif þat loue auȝte let his bridil go
Al þat now louyth asundery schulde lepe
And lost were al þat loue halt now to hepe

LG.HEAD: (253) (Troilus's Song. 4.)
LG.L: ¶ So wolde god þat auȝtour is of kynde
Þat with his bounde loue of þis vertu lyst
So serkelyn hertis alle & faste bynde
Þat from his hond no wiȝt þe weye owt wyst
And hertis colde hem wolde I þat he twyst
To make hem loue & þat hem lust ay rewe
And hertys sore & kepyn hem þat ben trewe
¶ In alle nedis for þe tounys werre
He was & ay þe fyrste in armys dede
And serteynly but ȝif þat bokis erre
Saue ector most I-dred of ony wyȝt
And þis encres of hardynesse & myȝt
Come hym of loue his ladyis þank to wyn
Þat alteryd his spryt euere so with-in
// In tyme of trewe on haukynge wolde he ryde
Or eɫɫ hunte bor bere or lioun
Þe smale bestis let he go be syde
Whan þat he com rydyng in to toun
fful ofte his lady from hire wyndowe doun
As frosch as facoun comyn out of mewe
fful redi was his lady to saluwe
¶ And most of loue & vertu was his speche
And in dispit hadde al wrechedenes
And douteles non nede was hym beseche
To honouryn hem þat haddyn worþines
And esen hem þat weryn [r later] in distres
And glad was he ȝif ony wyȝt wel ferde
Þat lovere was whan he it wiste or herde
// ffor soþ to seyn he lorn hade euery wiȝt
But ȝif he were in louys hey seruyse
I mene folk þat ouȝt it ben of ryȝt
And oueral þis so wel coude he deuyse
Of sentement & in so vnkouþ wyse
Al his aray þat euery louere þouȝte
Þat al was wel what so he seyde or wrouȝt
¶ And þow þat he be comyn of blod real
Hym lyst of pride at no whit for to chase
Benygne he was to eche in general [e al, alterd]
ffor which he gat hym þank in euery plase
Þus wolde loue I-heryed be his grace
Þat pride enuye yre & aueryce
He gatt to fle & euery oþer vice

DIV3.P: [Leaves 80 and 81 have been cut out of the Cambridge MS.]

HEADNOTE.P: [Campsall MS., leaf 69.]
[In this Book, the tags of the f, g, k, t of the MS. are not printed.]

LG.HEAD: (1) (Proem)
LG.L: But al to litel weylawey þe whyle.
Lasteth swych Ioye y-þonked be Fortune.
That semeth trewest whanne she wole bygyle.
And kane to foles so here song entune.
That she hem hent and blent traytour comune.
And whan a wyght is from here whiel y-þrowe.
Than laugheth she and maketh here þe mowe.
From Troylus she gan here brighte face.
A-wey to wriþe. and tok of hym noon hede.
But caste hym clene oute of his lady grace.
And on here whiel she sette vp diomede.
For which ryþt now myn herte gynneth blede.
And now my penne allas wiþ which I write.
Quakeþ for drede of that I mot endite.
For how Criseyde Troylus forsook.
Or at þe leste how þat she was vnkynde.
Mot hennes forth ben matere of my book.
As writen folk þorugh which it is in mynde.
Allas þat þey shulde euere cause fynde.
To speke here harm and yf þey on here lye.
y-wys hem self sholde han þe vilonye.

LG.HEAD: (4) (Invocation)
LG.L: O ye herynes nyghttes doughtren thre.
That endeles compleynes euere in pyne.
Megera. Alete. and ek Thesyphone.
Thow cruel Mars ek fader of Quyryne.
This ilke ferþe book me helpeth fyne.
So þat þe losse of lyf and loue yfere.
Of Troylus be fully shewed here.

DIV3.P: Incipit Quartus Liber.

LG.HEAD: (5) (The Story)
LG.L: LIggynge yn ost as I haue seyd er þis.
The Grekys stronge a-boute Troye town.
By-fel þat whanne þat Phebus shynyng is.
Vp on þe brest of hercules lyoun.
That Ector with many a bold baroun.
Caste on a day wiþ Grekes for to fighte.
As he was woned to greue hem what he myghte.
Not I how longe or short it was by-twene.
This purpos and þat day þey fighte mente.
But on a day wel armed bryght and shene.
Ector & many a worþi wight out wente.
wiþ spere on hond and bygge bowes bente.
And in þe berd with-oute lenge lette.
Here fomen in þe feld a-noon hem mette.
The longe day wiþ speres faste y-grounde.
with arwes dartes swerdes maces fele.
They fyghte and bryngen hors and man to grounde.
And with here axes out þe braynes quelle.
But in þe last shour soth for to telle.
The folk of Troye hem seluen so mysledden.
That with þe worse at nyght homward þey fledden.
At whiche day was taken Antenor.
Maugre Polydamas .or Monesteo.
Santippe / Sarpedon / Polynestor.
Polyte or eke þe Troian daun Rupheo.
And oþere lasse folk as Phebuseo.
So þat for harm þat day þe folk of Troye.
Dredden to lese a gret part of here Ioye.
Of Pryamus was yeue at Grekes requeste.
A tyme of trewe and þo þey gonnen trete.
Here prisoneres to chaungen most and leste.
And for the surplus yeue sommes grete.
This þing a-noon was kouth in euery strete.
Boþe in þassege / in towne and euery where.
And with þe firste it cam to Calkas ere.
Whan Calkas knew þis tretys sholde holde.
In Consistorie a-mong þe Grekes soone.
He gan in thrynge forth with lordes olde.
And sette hym þere as he was woned to done.
And with a chaunged face hem bad a bone.
For loue of god to don hym þat reuerence.
To stynte noyse / and yeue hym audyence.
Thanne seyde he þus / lo lordes myne I was.
Troian as it is knowen out of drede.
And if þat yow remembre I am Calkas.
That alderfirst yaf comfort to youre nede.
And told[e] wel how þat ye sholden spede.
For dredles þorugh yow shal in a stounde.
Ben Troye y-brend / and bete doun to grounde.
And in what forme or for what manere wyse.
This town to shende / and al youre lust to acheue.
Ye han er þis wel herd it me deuyse.
This knowe ye my lordes as I leue.
And for þe Grekes weres me so leue.
I com my-self in my propre persone.
To teche in þis how yow was best to done.
Hauynge vn-to my tresour ne my rente.
Right no resport / to respect of youre ese.
Thus al my good I loste and to yow wente.
wenyng in þis you lordes for to plese.
But al þat losse ne doth me no dishese.
I vouche saf / as wysly haue I Ioye.
For you to lese / al þat I haue in Troye.
Saue of a doughter þat I lafte allas.
Slepynge at hom whanne out of Troye I sterte.
O sterne and cruwel fader þat I was.
How myght I haue yn þat so hard an herte.
Allas .I. ne hadde y-brought here in here sherte.
For sorwe of which I wol not lyue to morwe.
But yf ye lordes rewe vp-on my sorwe.
For by þat cause I say no tyme er now.
Here to delyuere I holden haue my pes.
But now or neuere yif þat it lyke yowe.
I may here haue right sone douteles.
O help and grace a-mong al þis pres.
Rewe on þis olde caytyf in destresse.
Syn I for yow haue al þis heuynesse.
Ye haue now kaught & fetered in preson.
Troians y-nowe / and yf youre wille be.
My chy[l]d with on may haue redempcion.
Now for þe loue of god and of bounte.
On of so fele allas so yeue hym me.
what nede were it þis preyere for to werne.
Syn ye shul bothe han folk and town as yerne.
On peril of my lyf I shal not lye.
Appollo hath me told it feythfully.
I haue ek founden by astronomye.
By sort and by augurye ek trewely.
I dar wel seye þe tyme is faste by.
That fir and flaumbe on al þe toun shal sprede.
And þus shal Troye turnen in asshen dede.
For Certeyn Phebus and Neptainus boþe.
That maden þe walles of þe toun.
Ben with þe folk of Troye alwey so wroþe.
That þei wole brynge it to confusioun.
Right in despit of kyng lameadoun.
By cause he nolde payen hem here hire.
The town of Troye shal ben set on fire.
Tellyng his tale alwey þis olde Greye.
Humble in speche and yn his lokynge eke.
The salte terys from his eyen twye.
Ful faste ronnen doun by eyther cheke.
So longe he gan of socour hem by-seche
That for to helen hym of his sorwes sore.
They yaf hym Antenor with-oute more.
But who was glad y-nowh but Calkas þo.
And of þis þing ful sone hise nedes leyde.
On hem þat sholden for þe tretis go.
And hem for Antenor ful ofte preyde.
To bryng hem kyng Toas and Criseyde
And whan Pryam his saue-gard sente.
The Ambassiatours to Troye streyght þei wente.
The cause y-told of here comynge. the olde.
Pryam þe kyng ful soone in general.
Let here-vpon his Parlement to holde.

Thourgh loue is broken alday euery lawe.
Kygh now sumwhat þi corage and þi myght.
Haue mercy on þi self for ony awe.
Lat not þis wrecched wo þin herte gnawe.
But manly set þe world on sixe and seuene.
And yf þow deye a martir go to heuene.
I wol my self be with þe at þis nede.
Theygh ich and al my kyn vp-on a stonde.
Shulle in a strete as dogges liggen dede.
Thourgh girt with many a wyd and blody wounde.
In euery cas I wol a frend be founde.
And yf þe lyst here steruen as a wrecche.
A dieu. þe deuel spede hym þat recche.
This Troylus gan with þo wordes to quyken.
And seyde frende graunt mercy ich assente.
But certaynly þow mayst not me so pryken.
Ne peyne noon ne may me so tormente.
That for no cas it is not myn entente.
At short wordes þough I dyen sholde.
To rauysshen hire / but yf here-self it wolde.
Why so mene I quod Pandarus al þis day.
But tel me þanne / hastow here wel assayed.
That sorwest þus / and he answered nay.
wher-of artow quod Pandare þan a-mayed.
That nost not þat she wol ben euele apayed.
To rauysshen here syn þow hast not ben þere.
But if þat Ioue told it yn þin eere.
For-thi rys vp as nought ne were a-noon.
And wassh þi face and to þe kyng þow wende.
Or he may wondren whider þow art gon.
Thow most with wysdom hym & othere blende.
Or vp-on cas he may after þe sende.
Er þow be war and shortly broþer dere.
Be glad / and lat me werke in þis matere.
For I shal shappe it so sikerly
Thow shalt þis nyght som tyme in som manere.
Com speke with þi lady preuely.
And by here wordes ek and by here chere.
Thow shalt ful sone a-parceyue and wel here.
Al here entente / and yn þis cas þe beste.
And fare now wel / for in þis poynt I reste.
The swyfte fame whiche þat false þynges.
Egal reporteth lyk þe þynges trewe.
was þorugh-out Troye y-fled with preste wynges.
Fro man to man and made þis tale of newe.
How Calkas doughter with here brighte hewe.
At parlement with-oute wordes more.
I-graunted was yn chaunge of Antenore.
The whiche tale a-noon right as Criseyde.
Had herd. she þat of here fader roughte.
As in þis cas right nought ne whanne he deyde.
Ful bysily to Iuppiter by-soughte.
yeue hym myschaunce þat þis tretis broughte.
But shortly lest þis tales soth were.
She dorste at no wyght asken it for fere.
As she þat hadde here herte and al here mynde.
On Troylus y-set so wonder faste.
That al þe world ne koude here loue vnbynde.
Ne Troylus out of here herte caste.
She wol ben his whil þat here lyf may laste.
And þus she brenneth boþe in loue and drede.
That she nyste what was best to rede.
But as men sen in towne and al aboute.
That wommen vsen frendes to visite.
So to Criseyde of wommen come a rowte.
For pitous Ioye and wenden here delite.
And with here tales dere ynowh a myte.
These wommen whiche þat yn þe cite dwelle.
Thei sette hem doun and seyde as I shal telle.
Quod first þat oone .I. am glad trewely.
By-cause of yow þat ye shal youre fader se.
A-noþer answered I-wys so am not .I.
For al to litel hath she with vs be.
Quod þe þridde I hope y-wys þat she.
Shal brynge vs þe pes on euery side.
That whanne she gooth almyghti god here gyde.
Tho wo[r]des and þo wommannyssh þynges./
She herd hem ryght as þough she þens were.
For god it wot here herte on oþer þing is.
Al-þough þe body sat a-mong hem þere.
Here aduertence is alwey ellys-where.
For Troylus ful faste here herte soughte.
with-outen word alwey on hym she þoughte.
This wommen þat wenden here to plese.
A-boute nought gonne alle here tales spende.
Swych vanite ne kan don hem non ese.
As she þat al þis mene while brende.
Of oþer passion þan þat þey wende.
So þat she felte almost here herte deye.
For wo and wery of þat companye.

LG.L: And thilke fooles sittynge here a-boute.
wende þat she wepte and syked sore.
By cause þat [she] sholde out of þat route.
Departe. and neuere pleye with hem more.
And þey þat hadde y-knowen here of yore.
Seygh here so wepe and þoughte it kyndenesse.
And eche of hem wepte eke for here distresse.
And bisily þey gonnen here comforten.
Of þing god wot on which she litel þoughte.
And with here tales wenden here disporten.
And to be glad þey often here by-soughte.
But swich an ese þer-with þey here wroughte.
Right as a man is esed for to fele.
For ache of hed to clawen hym on his hele.
But after al þis nyce vanyte.
They tok here leue and hom þey wenten alle.
Cryseyde ful of sorwful pite.
In to here chaumbre vp wente out of þe halle.
And on here bed she gan for ded to falle.
In purpos neuere þennes for to ryse.
And þus she wroughte as I shal yow deuyse.

DIV3.P: [The real Stanza 106, l. 736-742, is misplaced in the Campsall MS. & Harl. 2280 & 3943, and put after st. 107 (see p. 197, 198 of Mr. Rossetti's Filostrato and Troylus, Chaucer Soc.). But as the change may have been made by Chaucer, and as the changer has alterd the text (l. 750, 752, 764) to make the story right, I am obliged to have different stanzas for nos. 106-108, and different lines for nos. 736-756.]

LG.L: Here ownded heer þat sonnyssħ was of hewe.
She rente / and ek here fyngres longe and smale.
She wrong ful ofte and bad god on here rewe.
And with þe deth to don bote on here bale.
Here hewe whilom bryght þat þo was pale.
Bar witnes of here wo and constreynte.
And þus she spak sobbynge in here compleynte.
Allas quod she out of þis regioun.
I woful wrecche and infortuned wight.
And born in corsed constellacioun.
Mot gon and þus departen fro my knyght.
wo worth allas þat ilke dayes lyght.

Therwith þe terys from here eighen two.

She mot for-gon. for which disauenture.
She held here-self a forlost creature.

That ilke day þat I from hym departe.

And þus my-seluen wold I do to dethe.
And Troylus my cloþes euerychone.

That I am as out of þis world a-gon.
That wont was yow to setten in quiete.
And of myn ordre ay til deth me mete.
The obseruaunce euere yn youre absence.
Shal sorwe ben. compleynte and abstinence.
Myn herte and ek þe woful gost þer-Inne.
Biquethe I with youre spirit to compleyne.
Eternally for þey shul neuere twynne.
For þough in erthe twynned be we tweyne.
Yet in þe feld of pite out of peyne.
That hight Elysos shul we ben y-fere.
As Orpheus. and Erudice his fere.
Thus herte myn for Antenor Allas.
I soone shal be chaunged as I wene.
But how shul ye don yn þis sorwful cas.
How shal youre tendre herte þis sustene.
But herte myn / for-yet þis sorwe and tene.
And me also / for sothly for to seye.
So ye wel fare / I recche not to deye.
How myght it euere y-red ben or y-songe.
The pleynte þat she made in here distresse.

Vn-to Criseyde / as ye han herd deuyse.

And he ful glad to don hym þat seruice.
Vn-to Criseyde in a ful seere wyse.
Ther as she lay in torment and in rage.
Come here to telle al holly his message.
And fond þat she here-seluen gan to trete.
Ful pitously / for with here salte terys.

For yf Criseyde hadde erst compleyned sore.

Endeth þanne loue in wo. ye er men lieth.

The ende of blisse ay sorwe it occupieth.
And who þat troweth not þat it so be.
Lat hym vpon me woful wrecche y-se.
That my self hate / and ay my birþe accurse.
Felynge alwey fro wo I go to worse.
Who-so me seth. he seth sorwe al at onys.
Peyne / torment / pleynt / wo / and distresse.
Out of my woful body / harm þer non is.
As angwyssh / langour / cruel bitternesse.
A-noy / smert / drede / fury / and ek sikenesse.

That may non erþely mannes tonge seye.

with yow to ben al nyght for to deuyse.
Remede in þis / yf þer were any wyse.
This short and pleyne þeffect of my message.
As ferforth as my wit may comprehende.
For ye þat ben of torment in swych rage.

And for þe loue of god my Nece dere.
So lef þis wo er Troylus be here.

As she þat felt dedly sharpe distresse.
But yet to me his sorwe is muche more.

Kan he for me so pitously compleyne.
I-wis this sorw doubleþ al my peyne.

To sen þat sorwe whiche þat he is Inne.

Quod Pandarus allas whi do ye so.

Goth Pandarus and Troylus he soughte.

As he þat of his lyf no lenger rowhte.
But to þe petouse goddes euerychone.
Ful tendrely he preyde and made his mone.
To don hym sone out of þis world to pace.
For wel he þouhte þer was noon oþer grace.
And shortly al þe soþe for to seye.
He was so fallen in despeyr þat day.
That outrely he shop hym for to deye.
For right þus was his argument alwey.
He seyde he nas but lorn waylawey.
For al þat cometh / comth by necessite.
Thus to be lorn it is my destyne.
For certaynly þis wot I wel he seyde.
That for-sight of dyuyne purueyaunce.
Hath seyn alwey me to for-gon Criseyde.
Syn god seth euery þing out of doutaunce.
And hem desponeth þourgh his ordenaunce.
In here merites soþly for to be.
As they shul come by predestine.
But naþeles allas whom shal I leue.
For þer ben clerkes grete many on.
That destyne þorugh argumentȝ preue.
And som men seyn þat nedly þer is noon.
But þat frechoys is yeuen vs euerychon.
O. welaway so sley arn clerkes olde.
That I not whos opynyoun I may holde.
For so men seyn / yf god seth al byforn.

wherfor I seye þat from eterne yf he.

which may not ben deceyued neuere mo.
Hath feled biforn / with-outen ignoraunce.

To wriþen out / fro goddes purueyinge.

Vncerteyn / and no stedefast forseynge.

wot it byforn with-outen ignoraunce.
And in þis manere þis necessite.
Retorneth in his part contrarie a-gayn.

The certayn cause of þe necessite.

Be cause certeyn of þe purueyinge.

That it byhoueth þat þe byfallyng.
Of þinges wyst byforn certeynly.

That certes þin opynyon soth be.

As þus / nowe herkene / for I wol not tarie.

And I seye þough þe cause of soth of þis.

Thus on þis same wyse out of doutaunce.
I may wel make as it semeth me.
My resonynge of goddes pourueyaunce.

Beth nought to hasty in þis hote fare.
For hasty man ne wanteth neuere care.
What trowe ye þat þe peple ek of al aboute.
wolde of it seye / it is ful lyght to arede.
They wolden seye / and swere it out of doute.
That loue ne drof yow nought to don þis dede.
But lust voluptuous / and coward drede.
Thus were al lost y-wys myn herte dere.
Yowre honour which þat now shyneth so clere.
And also þenketh on myn honeste.
That floureth yet how foule it sholde it shende.
And with what filþe it spotted sholde be.
If in þis forme I sholde with yow wende.
Ne þough I lyuede vn-to þe worldes ende.
My name sholde I neuere a-yenward wynne.
Thus were I lost and þat were rouþe & synne.
And for-þi sle with reson al þis hete.
Men seyn þe suffraunt ouercometh par de.
Ek who-so wole han leef he leef mote lete.
Thus makeþ vertue of necessite.
By pacient and þenk þat lord is he.
Of fortune ay þat nought wole of here recche.
And she ne daunteth no wight but a wrecche.
And trusteþ þis þat certes herte swete.
Er Phebus suster lucyna the shene.
The leon passe out of þis ariete.
I wol ben here with-outen ony wene.
I mene as helpe me Iuno heuenes queene.
The tenthe day / but yf þat deth me assayle.
I wol yow sen with-outen ony fayle.
And now so þis be soth quod Troylus.
I shal wel suffre vn-to the tenþe day.
Syn þat I se þat nede it mot be þus.
But for þe loue of god yf it be may.
So lat vs stele pryuely a-way.
For euere in oon as for to lyue in reste.
Myn herte seyþ it wole ben þe beste.
O mercy god / what lyf is þis quod she.
Allas ye sle me þus for verray tene.
I se wel now þat ye mystrusten me.
For by youre wordes it is wel I-sene.
Now for þe loue of Cynthes þe shene.
Mystrust me not þus causeles for routhe.
Syn to be trewe I haue yow plyght my trouthe.
And thenketh wel þat som tyme it is wit.
To spende a tyme / a tyme for to wynne.
Ne parde lorn am I nought fro yow yet.
Though þat we ben a day or two a twynne.
Dryf out þe fantasies yow wiþ-Inne.
And trusteth me / and leueth ek youre sorwe.
Or her my trouþe I wol not lyue til morwe.
For if ye wiste how sore it doth me smerte.
Ye wolde cesse of þis for god þow wost.
The pure spirit wepeþ in myn herte.
To se yow wepen þat I loue most.
And þat I mot gon to þe Grekes ost.
Ye nere it þat I wist remedie.
To com a-yeyn / right here I wolde dye.
But certes I am not so nyce a wyght.
That I ne kan ymagynen a weye.
To come a-yen þat day þat I haue hight.
For who may holde þing þat wole a-way.
My fader nought for al his queynte pley.
And by my þryft my wendyng out of Troye.
A-noþer day shal torne vs alle to Ioye.
For-thy with al myn herte I yow beseche.
Yf þat yow lyst don ough for my preyere.
And for þe loue which þat I loue yow eke.
That er þat I departe fro yow here.
That of þe good of comfort & a chere.
I may you sen / þat [ye] may brynge at reste.
Myn herte / which þat is o poyn to breste.
And ouer al þis I pray yow quod she þo.
Myn owen hertes sothfast suffisaunce.
Syn I am þyn al hool with-outen mo.
That whil þat I am assent no plesaunce.
Of oþere / do ye me fro youre remembraunce.
For I am euere a-gast / for-whi men rede.
That loue is þing ay ful of bysy drede.
For yn þis world / þer lyueth lady noon.
If þat ye were vntrewe as god defende.
That so bytraysed were or wo bygon.
As I þat al trouþe in yow entende.
And douteles yf þat ych oþer wende.
I nere but ded / and er ye cause fynde.
For goddes loue / so beth me not vnkynde.
To þis answerede Troylus and seyde.
Now god to whom þer nys no cause y-wrye.
Me glad as wys I neuere vn-to Criseyde.
Syn þilke day I saw here first with eye.
was fals ne neuere shal til þat I dye.
At short wordes wel ye may me leue.
I kan no more / it shal be founde at preue.
Graunt mercy good myn y-wys quod she.
And blysful Venus lat me neuere sterue.
Er I may stonde of plesaunce in degre.
To quyte hym wel þat so wel kan deserue.
And whil þat my wit wol me conserue.
I shal so don so trewe I haue yow founde.
That ay honour to meward shal rebounde.
For trusteþ wel þat youre estat royal.
Ne veyn delit / nor oonly worþinesse.
Of yow in werre / or torney Marcial.
Ne pompe aray / nobley or ek richesse.
Ne made me to Rewe on youre distresse.
But moral vertue grounded vpon trouþe.
That was þe cause / I first hadde on yow rouþe.
Ek gentil herte and manhod þat ye hadde.
And þat ye hadde as me þoughte in despit.
Euery thing þat souned in-to badde.
As rudenesse an pepelyssħ appetit.
And þat yowre reson brydled youre delit.
This made a-bouen euery creature.
That I was youre and shal whil I may dure.
And this may lengthe of yeres not for-do.
Ne remuable fortune deface.
But Iuppiter þat of his myght may do.
The sorwful to be glad so yeue vs grace.
Er nyghtes ten / to meten in þis place.
So þat it may youre herte and myn suffice.
And fareth now wel for tyme is þat ye ryse.
And after þat þey longe y-pleyned hadde.
And ofte I-kyst and streyght in armes folde.
The day gan ryse and Troylus hym cladde.
And rowfullych his lady gan byholde.
As he þat felte dethes cares colde.
And to his grace he gan hym recomaunde.
wher hym was wo / þis holde I no demaunde.
For mannes hed ymagynen ne kan.
Nen-tendement considere / ne tonge telle.
This cruwel peynes of þis sorwful man.
That passen euery torment doun in helle.
For he saugh þat she ne myghte dwelle.
which þat his soule out of his herte rente.
with-outen more out of þe chaumbre he wente.

HEADNOTE.P: [Harleian MS. 2280, on leaf 56, back.]
[The few tagd f, g, k, t's of the MS. are not printed in this Book.]

LG.HEAD: (1) (Proem)
LG.L: ¶ But al to litel walawey þe while
Lasteth swich Ioy I-thonked be fortune
Þat semeth trewest when she wol bigyle
and kan to fooles so hire song entune
Þat she hem hente and blente traitour comune
And when a wight is from hire whiel Ithrowe
Than laugheth she and maketh hym þe mowe
¶ From Troilus she gan hire brighte face
awey to wrythe and took of hym non hede
But cast hym clene oute of his lady grace
And on hire whiel she sette up diomede
For whiche myn herte right now gynneth to blede
And now my penne allas with which I wryte
Quaketh for drede of þat [I] most endite
¶ For how Criseyde Troilus for-soke
Or at þe leeste how þat she was vnkynde
Moot hennes forth ben matere of my book
As wryten folk thorugh which it is mynde
Allas þat they sholde euere cause fynde
To speke hire harme and if they on hire lye
I-wis hem self shold han þe vylenye

LG.HEAD: (4) (Invocation)
LG.L: ¶ O ȝe herynes nyghttes doughtren thre
Þat endeles compleynen euere in pyne
Megera alete / and ek thesiphone
Thow cruel mars ek fader to quyryne
Þis ilke ferthe book me helpeth fyne
So þat þe los of lyf and loue y-fere
Of Troilus be fully shewed heere

DIV3.P: Incipit quartus liber.

LG.HEAD: (5) (The Story)
LG.L: Lyggynge in oost / as I haue seyde or þis
Þe grekes stronge a-boute Troye town
Byfel / þat when þat phebus shynynge is
Vp on the breste of herculis leoun
Þat Ector with ful many a bolde baroun
Cast on a day with grekes for to fighte
As he was wonte to greue hem what he myght
¶ Not I how longe or short it was bitwene
Þis purpos / and þat day they fighten mente
But on a day wel armed bryghte and shene
Ector and many a worthi wight out wente
wit spere in honde and bigge bowes bente
And in þe berde with-outen lenger lette
Hire fomen in þe felde anon hem mette
¶ Þe longe day with speres sharpe I-grounde
with arwes / dartes swerdes / maces felle
They fighten and bryngen hors and man to grownde
And with hire axes out þe braynes quelle
But in þe laste shoure soth for to telle
Þe folk of Troie hem seluen so mysleden
Þat with þe wors at nyght homward they fledden
¶ At which day was taken antenor
Maugre Polidamas or monesteo
Santippe sarpedon Polynestor
Polite or ek þe Troian daun rupheo
And other lesse folk / as phebuseo
So þat for harme þat day þe folk of Troie
Dreden to lese a grete part of hire Ioye
¶ Of Priamus was ȝeue a grek requeste
A tyme of trew and þo they gonnen trete
Hire prisoners to chaungen most and leste
And for þe surplus ȝeuene sommes grete
Þis thynge a-non was with in euery strete
Both in thessage and town and euery where
And with þe firste it come to calkas ere
¶ whan calkas knew þis tretis shold holde
In consistorie o-mange þe grekes soone
He gan in thrynge forth with lordes olde
And set hym there as he was wonte to done
And with a chaunged face hem bad a boone
For loue of god to / don þat reuerence
To stynte noyse and ȝeue hym audience
¶ Than seyde he thus lo lordes myn ich was
Troian / as it is knowen of drede
And if ȝow remembre I am kalkas /
Þat alderfirste ȝaf confert to ȝoure nede
And tolde wel how þat ȝe shold spede
For dredeles thorwgh ȝow shal in a stownde
Ben Troie brente and betten down to grownde
¶ And in what fere or in what manere wyse
Þis town shende and al ȝoure luste tacheue
Ȝe han or this wel herde it me deuyse
Þis knowe ȝe my lordes as I leue i. credo
And for þe grekes weren me so leue i. cari
I com my self in my propre persone
