To teche in þis how ȝow was best to done
¶ Hauynge to my tresour ne my rente
Right no resport / to respite of ȝour ese
Þus al my goode I leste and to ȝow wente
wynynge in þis ȝow lordes for to plese
But al þat los ne doth me no disese
I vouche sauf / as wysly haue I Ioye
For ȝow to leese alle þat I haue in Troye
¶ Saue of a doughter that I lefte allas
Slepynge at home when out of Troie I sterte
O sterne o cruel fader þat I was
How myght I haue in þat so harde an herte
Allas I ne hadde brought hire in hire sherte
For sorwe of which I wol nought lyue to morwe
But if ȝe lordes rew vp-on my sorwe
¶ For by þat cause I say no tyme or nowe
Hire to deliuere ich holden haue my pees
But now or neuere if it like ȝowe
I may hire haue right soone douteles
O helpe and grace amonge al þis prees
Rew up-on þis olde caytif in distresse
Syn I thorwgh ȝow have al þis heuynesse
¶ Ȝe haue now caught and fetered in prisoun
Troians I-nowe and If ȝoure willes be
My childe with oon may han redempcion
Now for þe loue of god and of bounte
Oon of so fele allas so ȝif hym me
what nede were it this preyere for to werne
Syn ȝe shul both han folk and town as ȝerne
¶ On peril of my lif I shal nat lye
Appollo hath me told it feithfully,
I haue ek founde by astronomye
By sort and by augurye ek trewly
And dar wel seye the tyme is faste by
Þat fir and flaumbe on al þe town shal sprede
And þus shal Troie torne to asshen dede
¶ For certeyn phebus and neptunus [MS. neptimus] bothe
Þat makkeden the walles of þe town
Ben with þe folk of Troie alwey so wrothe
Þat they wol brynge it to confusioun
Right in dispit of kynge lameadon
By cause he nold payen hem here hire
Þe town of Troie shal ben set on fyre
¶ Tellynge his tale alway þis old greye
Humble in his speche and in his lokynge ek
Þe salt teres from his eyen tweye
Ful faste ronnen down by eyther cheeke
So longe he gan of socoure hem by-seke
Þat for to hele hym of his sorwues soore
They haue hym antenor with-outen more
¶ But who was glad ynough but calkas þo
And of þis thynge ful soone his nedes layde
On hem þat sholden for þe tretis go
And hem for antenor ful oft preyde
To brynge hom kynge Tooas and cryseyde
And whan Priam his saue garde sente
Thembassadours to troie streught wente
¶ The cause I-tolde of hire comynge the
Priam þe kynge ful soone in general
Let hire-vp-on his parlement to holde
Of which theffect / rehercen ȝow I shal
Thembassatours ben answerde for fynal
Theschaunge of prisoners and alle þis nede
Hem lyketh wele and forth in they procede
¶ This Troilus was present in þe place
whan axed was for antenor Criseyde
For which ful soon chaungen gan his face
as he þat with þo wordes wel neigh dyede
But natheles he no worde to hit seyde
List men sholde his affeccion espye
witht mannes herte he gan hys sorwes drye
¶ And ful of angwisħ and of grisely drede
And what lordes wolde vn-to it seye
And if they wolde graunte as god for-bede
Theschaunge of hir þan thought he thynges tweye
First how to saue hire honour and what weye
He myght best theschaunge of hire with-stonde
Ful faste he caste how al thys myght stonde
¶ Loue hym made al prest to don hyre bide
And rather dyen than she sholde go
But reson seyde hym on þat other syde
with-outen assente of hire ne do not so
leste for þi werke she wolde be þi fo
And seyde þat thorwgh thy medlynge is Iblowe
Ȝoure eyther loue þer it was erst vnknowe
¶ For wich he gan deliberen for the beste
That though þe lordes wolde she wente
He wolde lat hem graunte what hem liste
And telle his lady firste what þat they mente
And whan þat she had seyde hym hire entente
Ther-efter wolde he werken also blyue
Theigh al þe world aȝeyn it wold stryue
¶ Ector which þat wele þe grekes herde
For antenor how they wolde han Cryseyde
Gan it with-stonde and sobrely answerde
Sires she nys no prisoner he seyde
I not on ȝow who þis þat þis charge layde
But on my part ȝe may eft sones hem telle
we vsen here no wommen for to selle
¶ The noyse of peple vp stirte thanne atones /
As breme as blase of straw I-set on fyre
For Infortune it wolde for the nones
They sholden hire confusion desire
Ector quod they what gost may thow enspire
Þis womman þus to shilde and don vs lese
Daun antenor / a wrong wey now ȝe chese
¶ Þat is so wis and eke so bolde baroun
And we han nede tolk as men may se
He is ek on þe grettest of this town
O Ector lat tho fantasyes be
O kynge priam quod they þus siggen we
Þat al oure vois is to for-gon Criseyde
And to delyueren antenor they preyde
¶ O Iuuenal lorde trewe is thy sentence
Þat litel witen folk what is to ȝerne
Þat they ne fynde in hire desire offence
For cloude of errour ne lat hem disterne
what best is and lo here ensaumple as ȝerne
Þis folk desiren now delyueraunce
Of antenor þat brought hem to myschaunce
¶ For he was after traitour to þe town
Of Troie allas they quite hym oute to rathe
O nyce world / lo thy discrecioun
Criseyde whiche þat neuere dide hem scathe
Shal now no longer in hire blisse bathe
But antenor he shal com hom to towne
And she shal out þus seyde here and howne
¶ For whiche delibered was by parlemente
For antenor to ȝelden out Criseyde
And pronounced by the president
Al-theigh þat Ector nay ful oft preyde
And finaly what wight þat it with-seyde
It was for nought it most ben and sholde
For substaunce of þe parlement it wolde
¶ Departed out of parlement echone
This Troilus with-outen wordes mo
Vn-to his chaumbre spedde hym faste allone
But if were aman of his or two
The whiche he bad out fast for to go
By cause he wolde slepen as he seyde
And hastely vp on his bed hym layde
¶ And as in wynter leues ben byraft
Eche efter other til þe tre be bare
So þat þer nys but bark and braunche ylaft
Lith Troilus byraft of eche welfare
Ybounden in þe blak bark of care
Disposed wode out of his wit to brayde
So soore hym sat þe chaungynge of Criseyde
¶ He ryste hym up and euery dore he shette
And wyndow ek and tho þis sorwful man
Vp on his beddes syde a-down hym sett
Ful like a dede ymage pale and wan
And in his breste þe heped wo bygan
Out brast / and he to werken in þis wyse
In his wodenesse / as I shal ȝow deuyse
¶ Right as þe wilde bole bigynneth sprynge
Now here now ther ydarted to þe herte
And of his deth roreth in compleynnynge
Right so gan he aboute þe chaumbre sterte
Smytynge his brest ay with his fistes smerte
His hed to þe walle his body to þe grounde
Ful ofte he swapte hym seluen to confounde
¶ His eyen two for pite of herte
out stremeden as swyft welles tweye
Þe heigh sobbes of his sorwes smerte
His spech hym refte vnnethes myghte he seye
O deth allas why nyl-tow do me deye
A-corsed be þat day whiche þat nature
Shope me to ben a lyues creature
¶ But efter when þe furie and al þe rage
which þat his herte twiste and fast threste
By lenghe of tyme som what gan at-swage
Vp on his bedde he layde hym down to reste
But þo bigan his teres more oute breste
Þat wonder is þe body may suffise
To half þis wo which þat I ȝow deuyse
¶ Than seyde he þus fortune allas þe while
what haue I don what haue I þus a-gilt
How myghtestow for routhe me by-gyle
Is ther no grace and shal I þus be spilte Sine causs.
Shal þus Criseyde a-wey for þat thow wilt
Allas how maistow in thyn herte fynde
To ben to me þus cruel and vnkynde
¶ Haue þe nought honoured al my lyue
As thow wel woost a-boue þe goddes alle
why wiltow me fro Ioie thus depryue
O Troilus what may men þe now calle
But wrich of wriches out of honour falle
Into miserie in whiche I wol biwaille
Criseide allas / til þat þe breth me faille
¶ Allas fortune if þat my life in Ioie
Displesed hadde vn-to thy foule enuye
whi ne haddestow my fader kyng of Troye
Byraft the life or don my bretheren dye
Or slayn my-self þat þus compleyne and crye
I combre world þat may of no thynge serue
But euere dye and neuere fully sterue
¶ If þat Criseyde allone were me laft
Nought rought I whidere thow woldest me stere
And hire allas than hastow me biraft
But euere more lo þis is thy manere
To reue a wyght þat moost is to hym dere
To preue in þat thi gerful violence
Þus am I lost ther helpeth no defence
¶ O verre lord o loue o god allas
Þat knowest best myn herte and alle my thought
what shal my sorwful lyf don in þis cas
If I for-go þat I so deere haue bought
Syn ȝe Criseyde and me han fully brought
In to ȝour grace / and both oure hertes seled
How may ȝe suffre / allas it be repeled
¶ what I may don I shal whil I may dure
On lyue in torment and in cruel peyne
Þis infortune or this disauenture
Allone as I was borne I-wys compleyne
Ne neuere wol I sen it shyne or reyne
But ende I wol as Edippe in derkenesse
My sorwful lyf and dyen in distresse
¶ O verrey goost þat errest to and fro
whi nyltow flen out of þe wofulleste
Body / þat euere myght on grounde go
O soule lurkynge in þis wo vnneste .i. go out of þi nest
Fle forth out of myn herte and lat it breste
And folow alwey Criseyde þi lady deere
Þi right place is now no longer here
¶ O woful eyen two syn ȝoure disporte
was al to sen Criseydes eyen bright
what shal ȝe don but for my disconforte
Stonden for naught and wepen out ȝour sighte
Syn she is queynte þat was ȝow to lighte
In veyne fro þis forth haue ich eyen Tweye
I-formed / Syn ȝoure vertu is a-weye
¶ O my Criseyde o lady souerayne
Of þis woful soule þat þus cryeth
Who shal now ȝeuen confort to þe peyne
Allas no wight / but when myn herte dyeth
My spirit which þat so vn-to ȝow hyeth
Receyue in gre / for þat shal ay ȝow serue
For-thy no fors is thought þe body sterue
¶ O ȝe louers þat heighe vp on þe whiel
Ben set of fortune in goode auenture
God leue þat ȝe fynde ay loue of stiel
And longe mote ȝoure lyf in Ioie endure
But when ȝe comen by my sepulture
Remembreth þat ȝoure felowe resteth þere
For I loued ek though ich vnworthy were
¶ O olde vnholsom and myslyued man
Calkas I mene allas what ayled the
To ben a greke / syn thow ert born troian
O calkas which þat wolt my bane be
In cursed tyme was thow borne for me
As wold blisful Iouo for his Ioie
Þat I þe hadde wher I wold in Troie
¶ A thousand sikes hottere þan þe glede
Out of his breste ech efter othere wente
Medled with pleyntes now his wo to fede
For which his woful teris neuere stente
And shortly so hise peynes hym to-rente
And wax so maat þat Ioie or penaunce
He feleth non but lith forth in a traunce
¶ Pandare which þat in þe parlement
Adde harde / what euery lord and burges seyde
And how ful graunted was by oon assente
For antenor to ȝelden so Criseyde
Gan wel neigh woode out of his wit to breyde
So þat for wo he nyste what he mente
But in a rees to Troilus he wente
¶ A certeyn knyght þat for þe tyme kepte
Þe chaumbre dore vndid it hym anon
And Pandare þat ful tendrelych wepte
In to þe derke chaumbre as stille as stone
Towarde þe bedde gan softly to gon
So confus þat he nyst what to seye
For verray wo his wit was neigh awaye
¶ And with his chere and lokynge al to-torn
For sorwe of þis and with his armes folden
He stode þis woful Troilus biforn
And on his pitous face he gan biholden
But lord so soft gan his herte colden
Seynge his frend in wo whos heuynesse
His herte slough as thoughte hym for distresse
¶ Þis woful witht þis Troilus þat felte
his frend Pandare y-comen hym to se
Gan as þe snow aȝein þe sonne melte
For which þis sorwful Pandare of pite
Gan for to wepe as tendrelich as he
And specheles this ben thise ilke tweye
Þat neither myght a worde for sorw seye
¶ But at þe laste this woful Troilus
Neigh ded for smerte gan bresten out to rore
And with a sorwful noise he seyde thus
Amang hise sobbes and his sikes sore
Lo Pandare I am ded with-outen more
Hastow nat herd at parlement he seyde
For antenor how loste is my Criseyde
¶ Þis Pandarus ful ded and pale of hewe
Ful pitously answerde and seyde yis
As wisly were it fals as it is trewe
That I haue herde and woot al how it is
O mercy god who wold haue trowed þis
who wold haue wende þat in so litel a throwe
Fortune oure Ioie wold haue ouer throw
¶ For in þis worlde ther is no creature
As to my dome þat euere saugh ruyne
Straunger þen þis thorwgh cas or auenture
But who may al eschue or al deuyne
Swich is þis world for-þi I þus deffyne
Ne truste no wight to fynden in fortune
Ay properte / hire ȝiftes ben comune
¶ But tel me þis why thow ert now so mad
To sorwen þus why listow in þis wyse
Syn þi desire al holly hastow had
So þat by right it ought ynough suffise
But I þat neuere felt in my seruyse
A frendly chere or lokynge of an eye
Lat me þus wepe and waylen til I dye
¶ And ouer al þis as thow wel woost þi selue
Þis town is ful of ladis al aboute
And to my doom fayrer þan swich twelue
As euere she was / shal I fynden in som route
Ye oon or two with-outen any doute
For-þi be glad myn owen deere brother
If she be lost we shal recouere a-nother
¶ what god forbede alwey þat ech plesaunce
In o thynge were and in noon other wight
If on kan synge a nother kan wel daunce
If þis be goodly she is glad and light
And þis is fair and þat kan goode a-right
Ech for his vertu holden is for deere
Both heroner and faucoun for ryuere
¶ And ek as writ ȝauȝis þat was ful wis
Þe new loue oute chaceth oft þe olde
And vp on newe cas lith a newe a-uys
Thynke ek þi lif to sauen ertow holden
Swich fire by processe shal of kynde colden
For syn it is but casuel plesaunce
Som cas shal putte it oute of remembraunce
¶ For also seur as day cometh after nyght
Þe new loue / labour or other wo
Or elles selde seynge of a wight
Don olde affeccions alle ouer go
And for þi part thow shal haue oon of two
Tabrigge with þi bittre peynes smerte
Absens of hire shal dryue hire out of herte
¶ Þese wordes seyde he for þe noones alle
To helpe his frende list he for sorwe dyed
For douteles to don his wo to falle
He rought nought what vnthrift þat he seyde
But Troilus þat neigh for sorw dyed
Took litel hede of alle þat euere he mente
Oon ere it herde attother out it wente
¶ But atte last answerde and seyde frende
Þis lechecraft or heled thus to be
were wel sittynge if þat I were a fend
To traysen a wight þat trewe is vn-to me
I preye god let þis counseyle neuere I-the
But do me rather sterue a-non right here
Er I þus do as thow me woldest leere
¶ She þat I serue I-wis what so thow seye
To whom myn herte enhabit is by right
Shal han me holly hires til þat I dye
For Pandarus syn I haue trowthe hire hight
I wol nat ben vntrow for no wight
But as hire man I wole ay lyue and sterue
And neuere other creature serue
¶ And þer thow seist thow shalt as faire fynde
As she / lat be / make no comparisoun
To creature yformed here by kynde
O leue Pandare in conclusyoun
I wol not ben of thyn opynyoun
Touchynge al þis for whiche I þe beseche
So holde þi pees thow slest me with þi speche
¶ Thow biddest me I sholde loue a nother
Alle freshly newe and lat Criseyde go
It lith nat in my Power leeue brother
And though .I myghte I wol not do so
But kanstow pleyen raket to and fro
Nettle in dokke out now þis now þat Pandare
Now foule falle hire for þi wo and care
¶ Thow fairest ek by me thow Pandarus
As he þat whan a wight is wo-by-gon
He cometh to hym a paas and seith right thus
Thynke nat on smerte and thow shalt fele none
Thow moost me first transmuwen in a stoon
And reue me my passiouns alle
Er thow so lightly do my wo to falle
¶ Þe deth may wel out of my brest departe
Þe lyf / so longe may þis sorw myne
But fro my soule shal Criseydes darte
Out neuer mo / but down with proserpyne
Whan I am dede I wol go wone in pyne
And þer I wol eternaly compleyne
My wo / and þat twynned be we tweyne
¶ Thow hast here made an argument for fyne
How þat it shold lasse peyne be
Criseyde to for-gon for she was myne
And lyued in ese and in felicite
why gabbestow þat seydest vn-to me
Þat hym is wors þat is fro wel I-throwe
Þan he hadde erst non of þat wele y-knowe
¶ But tel me now syn þat the thynketh so lyght
To chaungen so in loue ay to and fro
Why hastow nat doon bysily thy myghte
To chaungen hire þat doth þe al þi wo
why nyltow lete hire fro þin herte I-go
why nyltow loue a nother lady swete
Þat may þin herte setten in quiete
¶ If thow hast hadde in loue ay ȝet meschaunce
And kast it nought oute of thyn herte dryue
I þat lyuede in luste and in plesaunce
with hire as muche as creature on lyue
How shold I þat forȝete and þat so blyue
O wher hastow ben so longe hyde in muwe
Þat kanst so wel and formeliche argue
¶ Nay god woote nought worthi is al þi reede
For which for what þat euere may be-falle
With-outen wordes mo I wol be dede
O deth þat endere ert of sorwes alle
Com now syn I so oft efter þe calle
For sely is þat deth soft for to seyne
That oft I-cleped cometh and endeth peyne
¶ wel wote I whil my lif was in qui[e]te
Er thow me slewe I wolde haue ȝeuen hire
But now þi comynge is to me so swete
Þat in þis world I no thynge so desire
O deth syn with þi sorw I am a-fire
Thow outher do me a-non in teres drenche
Or with cold strooke myn heete quenche
¶ Syn þat thow slest so fele in sondry wyse
Aȝeyns hire wil vn-preyed day and nyghte
Do me at my requeste this seruyse
Deliuere now þe world so dostow right
Of me / þat am þe wofullest wight
Þat euere was / for tyme is þat I sterue
Syn in þis world of nought may serue
¶ This troilus in teres gan distille
As licour out of a lambic ful faste
And Pandarus gan hold his tonge stille
And to þe grounde his eyen don he caste
But natheles thus thought he at þe laste
what parde rather þan my felawe deye
Ȝet shal I somwhat more vn-to hym seye
¶ And seyd frende syn thow haste swich distresse
And syn þe list myn argumentȝ to blame
why nyl thy seluen helpen don retresse
And with þi manhod letten al þis grame
Go rauyshe hire ne kanstow nought for shame
And outher lat hire out town faire
Or hold hire stille and leue þi nyce fare
¶ Artow in troye and hast non hardimente
To tak a womman which þat loueth the
And wold hire seluen ben of thyn assente
Now is nat þis a nyce vanyte
Rise vp a-non and lat þis wepynge be
And right thow ert a man for in þis houre
I wol ben dede or she bleuen oure
¶ To this answerde hym Troylus ful soft
And seyde parde leue brother deere
Al this haue I my self ȝet thought ful oft
And more thynge þan thow deuysest herehic
But why þis thynge is laft thow shalt wel hereaudire
And when thow me hast ȝeuen an audience
Þer-efter maistow telle alle þi sentence
¶ First syn thow woost þis town hath alle þis werre
For rauysshyng of wommen so by nyght
It shold nought be suffred me to erre
as it stant now / ne don so grete vnright
I sholde han also blame of euery wyght
My fadres graunte If that I so with-stode
Syn she is chaunged for þe townes goode
¶ I haue ek thought so it were hire assente
To axe hire at my fader of his grace
Þan thynke I thys were hire acusemente
Syn wel I woot I may hire nought purchace
For syn my fader in so heigh a place
As parlement / hath hire eschaunge enseled
He nyl for me his lettre be repeled
¶ Ȝet drede I most hire herte to [p has a dash under, = per p̄ertorbe
with violence If I do swich a game
For if I wolde it openly distorbe
It moost be disclandre to hire name,
And me were leuere ded than hire defame
As nold god but if I shold haue
hire honour leuere þan my lif to saue
¶ Þus am I lost for ought þat I kan se
For certein is syn þat I am hire kynyght
I most hire honour leuere han þan me
Iu euery cas as louers aught of righte
Þus am I in desire and reson twyght
Desire for to distourben hire me redeth
And reson nyl so myn herte dredeth
¶ Þus wepynge þat he koude neuere cesse
He seyde allas how shal I wriche fare
For wel fele I alway my loue encresce
And hope is lasse and lasse alway Pandare
Encresen ek þe causes of my care
So waylawey why nyl myn herte breste
For as in loue þer is but litel rest
¶ Pandare answerde frend thow mayst for me
Don as þe lest / but hadde ich it so hoote
and thyn estate she sholde go with me
Though al þis town cryed on þis thynge by note
I nold sette at al þat noyse a grote
For when men han wel cryed þan wol they rowne
Ek wonder last but ix nyght neuere in towne
¶ Deuyne nat in reson ay so depe
Ne curtaisly but helpe þi self a-non
Bet is þat othere þan þi seluen wepe
And namely syn ȝe two ben al oone
Rise vp / for by myn hed she shal not gon
And rather be in blame a lite I-founde
Þan sterue here as a gnat with-outen wounde
¶ It is no shame vn-to ȝow ne no vyce
Hire to with-holden þat ye loueth most
Paraunter she myght holden þe for nyce
To laten hire go þus vn-to þe grekes oost
Thynk ek fortune as wel þi-seluen wooste
Helpeth hardy man vn-to his emprise
And weyneth wreches for hire cowardyse
¶ And though thy lady wolde a lite hire greue
Thow shalt þiself þi pees here-efter make
But as for me certein I kan not leeue
Þat she wolde it a now for euel take
why shold þanne of fered thyn herte quake
Thynk ek how Paris hath þat is þi brother
A loue / and why shaltowe not haue a nothe
¶ And Troylus o thynge I dar þe swere
Þat If Criseyde which þat is þi lief
Now loueth þe as wel as thow dost hire
God help me so she nyl not take a-gryefe
Theigh thow do boote o-non in þis meschief
And if wilneth fro þe for to passe
Thanne is she fals so loue hire wel þe lasse
¶ For-þi take herte and thynk right as knyght
Thorwe loue is broken alday euery lawe
Right now somwhat þi curage and þi myght
haue mercy on þi self for any awe
lat not þis wreched wo thyne herte gnawe
and manly set þe world on six and seuene
And if thow deye a martyr go to heuene
¶ I wol my self ben with þe at þis dede
Theigh ich and alle my kyn vp-on a stownde
Shul in a strete as dogges liggen dede
Thorwgh gyrt with many wyde and blody wounde
In euery cas I wol a frend ben founde
And if þe list here steruen as a wreche
A dieu / þe deuel spede hym þat it reche
¶ This Troilus gan with wordes quykken
And seyde frende graunte mercy ich assente
But certeynly thow maist not so me priken
Ne peyne non ne may me so tormente
Þat for no cas it is not myn entente
At shorte wordes though I dyen shold
To rauysshen hire but If hire self it wolde
¶ why so mene I quod Pandarus
But tel me þanne hastow hire wil asayde
Þat sorwest þus and he answerde hym nay
were-of ertow quod Pandare þanne amayed
Þat nost not þat she wol ben yuel apeyed
To rauysshen hire syn thow hast nought ben þere
But If þat Ioue told it in thyn ere
¶ For-thy ris vp as nought ne were anon
And wessh þi face and to þe kynge thow wende
Or he may wondren wheder thow ert gon
Thow most with wisdom hym and other blynde
Or vp-on cas he may efter the sende
Er thow be war and shortly brother deere
Be glad / and lat me werke in þis matere
¶ For I shal shape it so þat sikerly
Thow shalt þis nyght somtyme in som manere
Com speken with þi lady priuely
And by hire wordes ek as by hire cheere
Thow shalt ful soone a-perceyue and wel here
al hire entent and in þis cas þe beste
And fare now wele for in this poynte I reste
¶ The swifte fame which þat fals thynges
Egal reportehth like þe thynges trewe
was thorugh-out Troye yfled with prest wynges
Fro man to man and made þis tale al newe
How calkas doughter with hire bryght hewe
At parlement with-outen wordes moore
I-graunted was in chaunge of antenore
¶ Þe which tale a-non right as Criseyde
Hadde herde she which þat of hir fader roughte
As in þis cas right nought ne when he deyed
Ful bisily to Iuppiter bisoughte
Ȝeue hym meschaunce þat þis tretis broughte
But shortly lest this tales sothe were
She dorst at no wight axen it for feere
¶ As she þat hadde hire herte and al hire mynde
On Troilus ysette so wonder faste
Þat al þis world ne myghte hire loue vnbynde
Ne Troilus out of hire herte caste
She wol ben his wil þat hire lif may laste
And she þus brenneth bothe in loue and drede
So þat she nyste what was best to rede.
¶ But as men seen in town and alle a-boute
Þat wommen vsen frendes to visite
So to Criseyde of wommen com a route
For pitous Ioie / and wenden hire delite
And with hire tales dere ynough a myte
Þis wommen which þat in þe cite dwelle
They set hem down and seyde as I shal telle
¶ Quod firste þat oon I am glad trewly
By-cause of ȝow þat shal ȝoure fader se
A nother seyd I-wys so nam not I
For to litel hath she with vs be
Quod tho þe thridde I hope I-wis þat she
Shal brynge vs þe pees on euery syde
Þanne when she goth al-myghty god hire gyde
¶ Tho wordes and þo wommansshe thynges
She herde hem right as though she tennes were
For god it woot hire herte on other thynges is
Al though þe body sate a-mange hem there
Hire aduertens is alwey elles-where
For Troilus ful fast hire soule soughte
with-outen worde on hym alwey she thoughte
¶ Thise wommen þat þus wenden hire to pleese
Aboute nought gonne al hire tales spende
Swich vanite ne kan don hire non ese
As she þat al þis mene while brende
Of other passioun þan they wende
So þat she felt al-moost hire herte dye
For wo and wery of þat compaignye
¶ And þilke fooles sittynge hire a-boute
wenden þat she wepte and syked soore
By cause þat shol out of þat route
Departen / and neuere pleye wit hem more
And þey þat hadde y-knowen hire of yoore
Seigh hire so wepe and thought it kyndenesse
And ech of hem wepte eke for hire distresse
¶ And bisily they gonnen hire conforten
Of thynge god woot on which she litel thoughte
And wit hire tales wenden hire disporten
And to be glad they oft hire bysoughte
But which an ese ther-with they hire wroughte
Right as a man is esed for to feele
For ach of hed to clowen hym on his heele
¶ But efter al þis nyce vanite
They took hire leue and hom they wente alle
Criseyde ful of sorwful pitee
In to hire chaumbre vp wente out of þe halle
And on hire bed she gan for ded to falle
In purpos neuere thennes for to rise
And þus she wroughte as I shal ȝowe devyse
¶ Hire ownded here þat sonnyssh was of hewe
She rente / and ek hire fyngeres longe and smale
She wronge ful oft / and bad god on hire rewe
And with þe deth to don boote on hire bale
Hire hew whilom bright þat þo was pale
Bar witnesse of hire wo and hire constreynte
And þus she spake sobbynge in hire compleynte
¶ Allas quod she out of this region
I woful wreche and infortuned wight
And born in corsed constellacioun
Moot goon / and þus departen fro my knyght
wo worth allas þat ilke dayes lyght
On which I saugh hym first with eyen tweyne
Þat causeth me / and ich hym al þis peyne
¶ Þer-with þe teres from hire eyen two
Down fille / as shour in aperil swithe
Hire white brest she bet and for þe wo
Efter þe deth she cryed a thousand sythe
Syn he þat wont hire wo was for to lithe
She moot for-gon for which disauenture
She held hire self a forlost creature
¶ She seyd how shal he doon and ich also
how shold I lyue if þat I fro hym twynne
O deere herte ek þat I loue so
who shal þat sorw alen þat ȝe ben Inne
O calkas fader thyn be al þis synne
O moder myn þat cleped were argyue
wo worth þat day þat thow me bere on lyue
¶ To what fyn shold I lyue and sorwen þus
How shold a fissh with-outen water dure
what is Criseyde worth from Troilus
How shold a plaunte or lyues creature
Lyue / with-outen his kynde noriture
For which ful oft a byworde here I seye
Þat rootheles mot grene soon dye
¶ I shal doon þus syn neither swerde ne darte
Dar I non handlee for the cruelte
Þat ilk day þat I from ȝow departe
If sorwe of þat nyl nat my bane be
Þanne shal no mete or drynk com in me
Til I my soule out of my breste vnshethe
And þus my-seluen wold I don to dethe
¶ And Troilus my clothes euerychon
Shal blake ben in tokennynge herte swete
Þat I am out of þis worlde gon
Þat wonte was ȝow to setten in quiete
And of myn ordre ay til deth me mete
Þe obseruaunce euere in ȝoure absens
Shal sorw ben compleynte and abstinence
¶ Myn herte and ek þe woful goost þer-Inne
By-quethe I with ȝoure spirit to compleyne
Eternaly for they shal neuere twynne
For though in erith I-twynned be we tweyne
Ȝet in þe feld of pite out of peyne
Þat height Elysos shal we ben I-feere
As orpheus and Erudice his feere
¶ Thus herte myn for antenor allas
I soone shal ben chaunged as I weene
But how shul ȝe don in þis sorwful cas
How shal ȝoure tendre herte þis sustene
But herte myne for-ȝet this sorw and teen
And me also for sothly for to seye
So ȝe wel fare I reche noughte to dye
¶ How myght it euere yherd ben or ysonge
Þe pleynte þat she made in hire distresse
I not / but as for me my litel tonge
If discryuen wold hire heuynesse
It sholde Make hire sorwe seme lesse
Þanne þat it was / and childisshly deface
Hire heighe compleynte and þer-for ich it pace
¶ Pandare which þat sente from Troilus
was vnto Criseyde as ȝe han herde deuyse
Þat for þe beste it was a-corded thus
And he ful glad to don hym þat seruyse
Vn-to Criseyde in a ful faire wyse
Þer as she lay in torment and in rage
Com hire to telle alle holly his message
¶ And fonde þat she hire-seluen gan to trete
Ful pitously / for with hire salte teres
Hire breste / hire face y-bathed was ful wete
Þe myghty tresses of hire sonnysshe here
Vnbroiden hangen al a-boute hire eeres
which ȝaf hym verray signal of matere
Of deth which þat hire herte gan desire
¶ when she hym saugh she gan for sorwe anon
Hire tery face atwixe hire armes hyde
For which þis Pandare is so wo-bigon
Þat in þe hous he myght vnneth abyde
As he þat pite hadde on euery syde
For if Criseide hadda erst compleyned soore
Þo gan she pleyne a thousand tyme moore.
¶ And in hire aspre pleynte þus she seyde
Pandare first of ioies moo þan two
was cause causynge vn-to me Criseyde
Þat now transmuwed ben in cruel wo
Ther shal I seye to ȝow wel com or no
Þat aldirfirste me brought vn-to seruyse
of loue / allas þat endeth in swich wyse
¶ Endeth thanne loue in wo ȝe or men lieth
And and alle wordly blisse as thynketh me
Þe ende of blisse ay sorw it ocupieth
And who-so troweth not þat it so be
lat vp-on me woful wreche y-see
Þat my-self hate and ay burthe a-corse
Felynge alwey fro wikke I go to worse
¶ who-so me seeth he seeth sorwe al atones
Peyne torment / pleynte / wo / distresse
Out of my woful body harm þer non is
As angwissh / langour / cruel / bitternesse
Anoy / smert / drede furye and ek sekenesse
I trowe I-wis from teres reyne
For pite of myn aspre and cruel peyne
¶ And though my suster ful of disconfort
Quod Pandarus what thynkestow to doo
why ne hastow to þi-seluen som reporte
why wiltow þus þi self allas for-do
Leef al þis werk and take now hede to
Þat I shal seyne / and herkene of goode entente
Þis message whiche by me þi Troilus me sente
¶ Torned hire tho Criseyde a wo makynge
So grete / þat it a deth was for to se
Allas quod she what wordes may ȝe brynge
what wol my deere herte seyne to me
which þat I drede neuere mo to se
wol he han pleynte or teres or I wende
I haue I-noughe If he ther-efter sende
¶ She was right swich to seen in hire visage
As is þat wight þat men on beere bynde
Hire face like to paradis þe ymage
was al chaunged in a nother kynde
Þe pleye þe laughtre men was wonte to fynde
On hire / and ek hire Ioies euerychone
Ben fled / and þus lith now Criseyde allone
¶ Aboute hire eyen two purpre rynge
By-trent in sothfast toknynge of lyre peyne
Þat to be-holde it was a dedely thynge
For which Pandare myght not refreyne
Þe teres from his eyen for to reyne
But nathales / as he best myght he seyde
From Troilus / thise wordes to Criseyde
¶ Loo nece I trowe ȝe han herde al howe
Þe kynge with other lordes for þe beste
Hath made eschaunge of antenor and ȝowe
Þat cause is of þis sorw and þis vnreste
But how þis cas doth Troilus moleste
Þat may non erthly mannes tonge seye
For verray wo his wit is alle a-weye
¶ For which we han so sorwed he and I.
Þat in to litel both it hadde vs slawe
But thorugh myn conseil þis day fynaly
He somwhat is fro wepynge now with-drawe
And semeth me at he desireth fawe
with ȝow to ben al nyght for to deuyse
Remede in þis if ther any wyse
¶ This shorte and pleyne þeffect of my message
As fer forth as my wit kan comprehende
For ȝe þat ben of tormente in swich rage
May to no longe prologe as now entende
And here-vp-on ȝe may answer to hym sende
And for þe loue of god my nece deere
So lef this wo or Troilus be heere
¶ Gret is my wo quod she and sighte soore
As she þat feleth · dedely sharp distresse
But ȝet to me is sorwe is muchel more
Þat loue hym bet þan he hym self I gesse
Allas for me hath swich heuynesse
kan he for me so pitously compleyne
I-wis þis sorw dowbleth al my peyne
¶ Greuous to me god woot for to twyne
Quod she / but ȝet it hardere is to me
To sen þat sorwe which þat he is Inne
For wel wot I it wol my bane be
And dye I wol in certeyn tho quod she
But bid hym come er deth þat þus me threteth
Dryue out that gost which in myne herte he betheth
¶ Þise wordes seyde she on hire armes two
Fil [? MS. stil] gruf and gan to wepen pitously
Quod pandarus allas why do ȝe so
Syn wel ȝe woote þe tyme is fast by
Þat he shal com aris vp hastely
Þat he ȝow nat bywepen thus ne fynde
But ȝe wol haue hym woode out of hys mynde
¶ For wiste he þat ȝe ferde in þis manere
He wold hym seluen sle / and if I wende
To han þis fare he shold nat com heere
For al þe good þat priam may despende
For to what fyn he wold a-non pretende
Þat knowe ich wel and for-þi ȝet I seye
So lef þis sorwe or platly he wol dye
¶ And shapeth ȝow his sorw for tabrigge
And nought encresce leue nece swete
Beth rather to hym cause of flat than egge
And with som wysdom ȝe his sorwe beete
what helpeth it to wexen ful a strete
Or though ȝe bothe in salt terys dreynte
Bet is a tyme of cure ay þan of pleynte
¶ I mene thus when iche hym hyder brynge
Syn ȝe be wyse and both of oon assent
So shapeth how destourbe ȝour goynge
Or come aȝeyn soone efter ȝe be wente
Wommen ben wyse in short a-vysemente
And lat sen how ȝoure wit shal now availe
And what þat I may help it schal not faile
¶ Go quod Criseyde and vncle trewly
I shal don al my myght me to restreyne
From wepynge in his sight and bysily
Hym for to glade I shal don al my peyne
And in myn herte seken euery veyne
If to this soor there may be founden salue
It shal not lakke certeyn on myn halue
¶ Goth Pandarus and Troilus he soughte
Til in a temple he fonde hym allone
As he þat of his lif no lenger roughte
But to þe pitouse goddes euerychon
Ful tenderly he preyde and made his mone
To doon hym soon out of þis worlde to pace
For wel he thoughte þer was no nother grace
¶ And sothely al þe sothe for to seyne
He was so fallen in dispaire þat day
Þat outrely he shope hym for [to] dye
For righte þus was his argument alwey
He seyde he nas but lorn waylawey
For al þat cometh comth by necessite
Þus to ben lorne it is my desteyne
¶ For certeynly þis woote I wel he sayde
Þat forsyght of deuyne puruyaunce
Hathe seyn alwey me for to for-gon Criseyde
Syn god seth euery thynge out of doutaunce
And hym disponeth thorwgh his ordinaunce
In hire merites sothely for to be
as they shul comen by predesteyne
¶ But natheles allas whom shal I leue
For þer ben grete many oone
That destyne thorwgh argumentȝ preue
And som man seyn þat nedely þer is noon
But þat fre cloys [for choys] is ȝeuen vs euerichon
O waylaway so sleighe ern clerkes olde
Þat I nat whos opinion I may holde
¶ For som men seyn If god seth al byforne
Ne god may not deseyued ben parde
Than moot it fallen theigh men hadde it sworne
Þat purueyaunce hath seyn be-for to be
wher-for I seye þat from eterne if he .i. done
Hathe wiste by-forn our thought ek as oure dede
we haue no fre choys as thise clekkes rede
¶ For other thoughte nor other dede also
Myght neuere ben but swich as purueyaunce
Which may nat ben deceyued neuere moo
Hath feled by-forne with-outen ignoraunce
For if ther myght ben a variaunce
To wrythen out fro goddes purueynge
Ther ner no prescience of thynge comynge
¶ But it were rather an opinyon
Vncertein / and in no stedfast forseynge
And certes þat were an abusyon
Þat god shold han no parfit clere wetynge
More þan we men þat han doutes wenynge
But swich an erroure vp-on god to gesse
Were fals and foule and wikked corsednesse
¶ Ek þis is an opinyon of some
Þat han hire top ful heigh and smothe I-shore
They seyn right þus þat thynge is nat to comen
For þat þe prescience hath seyne by-fore
Þat it shal come but they seyn þat ther-fore
Þat it shal come ther-for þe purueyaunce
woot it bifore with-outen ignorance
¶ And in þis manere þis necessite
Retourneth in his part contrarye agayn
For nedfully by-houeth it not to be
That þilke thynges fallen in certeyn
Þat ben purueyed / but nedly as they seyne
Bihoueth it þat thynges which þat falle
Þat þei in certein ben purueied alle
¶ I mene as though I laboured me in this
To enqueren which thynge cause of whiche thynge be
As whether þat þe prescience of god is
The certein cause of þe necessite
Of thynges þat to comen ben parde
Or if necessite of thynge comynge
Be cause certein of the purueyinge
¶ But now nen-force I me nat in shwynge
How the ordre of causes stant / but wol woot I
Þat it bihoueth that the bifallynge
Of thynges wiste bifor certeinly
Be necessarie al seme it nat ther-by
That prescience put fallynge necessarie
To thynge to come al falle it foule or faire
¶ For if þer sit a man ȝonde on a see
Than by necessite bihoueth it
Þat certes thyn opinioun soth be
That wenest or coniectest þat he sit
And further now ouer aȝeinwarde ȝit
lo right so is it of þe part contrarie
As thus nowe herkene for I wol nat tarie
¶ I sey þat if þe opinion of this
Be soth / for þat he sit than seye I this
Þat he moot sitten by necessite
And þus necessite in either is
For in hym nede of sittynge is I-wis
And in the / nede of soth and þis for soth
Ther mot necessite ben in ȝow bothe
¶ Bot thow maist seyne þe man sit nat þere-fore
Þat thyn opinioun of his sittynge sothe is
But rather for the man sit there by-fore
Þerfor is thyn opinioun soth y-wys
And I seye though þe cause of soth of þis
Cometh of his sittynge ȝet necessite
Is entrechaunged both in hym and the
¶ Thus in this same wyse out of doutaunce
I may wel maken as it semeth me
My resonynge of goddes purueiaunce
And of þe thynges þat to comen be
By which reson men may wel y-see
Þat thylk thynges þat in erthe falle
Þat by necessite they comen alle
¶ For al-though þat for thynge shal come ywys
Þer-for is it purueyed certeynly
Nat þat it comes for it purueied is
Ȝet natheles bihoueth it nedfully
Þat thynge to come be purueied trewly
Or elles thynges þat purueied be
That they bitiden by necessite
¶ And þis sufficeth right y-nough certeyn
For to discruye oure fre choys euery dele
But now is this abusioun to seyne
Þat fallynge of the thynges temporel
Is cause of goddes prescience eternel
Now trewly þat is a fals sentence
Þat thynge to come sholde cause his prescience
¶ what myght I wene and I hadde swich a thought
But þat god purueieth thynge þat is to come
For þat is to come and elles nought
So myght I wene þat þynges alle and sone
Þat whilom ben bifalle and ouere-come
Ben cause of thilke soueyren puruyaunce
Þat for-woot alle with-outen ignoraunce
¶ And ouer al þis ȝet seye I moore herto
Þat right as when I woot there is o thynge
Iwis þat thynge mot nedfully be so
Ek right as when I woote a thynge comynge i. euentus
So mot it come and þus þe bifallynge
Of thynges þat ben wiste bi-fore þe tyde
They mowe not ben eschued on no syde
¶ Þan seyde he þus almyghty Ioue in Trone
Þat woost of al þis thynge þe sothfastnesse
Rewe on my sorwe or do me dyen sone
Or brynge Criseyde and me fro þis distresse
And while he was in al þis heuynesse
Disputynge with hym self in þis matere
Com Pandare in / and seyde as ȝe may here
¶ O myghty god quod Pandarus in Trone
I who say euere a wys man faren so
whi Troilus what thynkestow to doon
Hastow swich luste to ben thyn owne fo
What parde ȝet is not Criseyde ago
whi lust þe so þi self for-doon for drede
Þat in thyn hed thy nene semen dede
¶ Hastow nought lyued many a ȝere by-forne
with-outen hire and ferde ful wel atese
Ertow for hire and for non other borne
Hath kynde þe wroughte al oonly hire to plese
lat be / and thynk right þus in thy disese
Þat in þe dees right as þer fallen chaunces
Right so in loue þere com and gon plesaunces
¶ And ȝet þis is a wonder moost of alle
whi thow þus sorwest syn thow nost not ȝit
Touchynge hire goynge how þat it shal falle
Ne ȝif she kan hire self distourben it
Thow hast nat ȝit assayed al hire wit
A man may al by-tyme his nekke beede
whan it shal of and sorwen at þe nede
¶ For-þi take hede of al þat I shal seye
I haue with hire I-spoke and longe I-be
So as a-corded was by-twyxe us twa
And euer moo me thynketh þus þat she
Hath somwhat in hire hert I preuete
whar-with she can If I shal right arede
Destourbe al þis of which thow ert in drede
¶ For which my conseil is whan it is nyght
Thow to hire go and mak of þis an ende
And blisful Iuno thorwgh hire grete myghte
Shal as I hope hire grace vnto vs sende
Myn herte seith she shal nat wende
And for-þi put thyn herte a qwhile in reste
And hold þis purpos for it is þe beste
¶ This Troilus answerde and sighte soore
Thow saist right wel and I wol doon right so
And what hym liste he seyde vnto it moore
And whan þat it was tyme for to go
Ful preuely hym self with-outen mo
Vn-to hire come as he was wonte to doon
And how they wroughte I shal ȝow tellen soone
¶ Soth is than when they gonnen first to meete
So gan the peyne hire hertes for to twyste
Þat neither of hem myghte other grete
But hem in armes tooke and efter kyste
Þe lasse woful of hem both nyste
wher þat he was ne myght o word out brynge
As I seyde arst / for wo and for sobbynge
¶ Þe woful teres þat they leten falle
As bittre wern out of teres kynde
For peyne / as is ligne aloes or galle
So bittre teres wepe noughte as I fynde
Tho woful myrra [? MS. a] thorwgh þe barke and rynde
Þat in þis world þer nys so hard an herte
Þat nolde han rewed on hire peynes smerte
¶ But when hire woful wery gostes tweyne
Retourned ben / ther as hem owen to dwelle
And þat som what to woken gan þe peyne
By lenghthe of pleynte and ebben gan the welle
Of hire teres / and þe herte vnswelle
With brokyn vois al hois for shright Criseyde
To Troilus thise ilke wordes seyde
¶ O Ioue I deye and mercy I biseche
Helpe Troilus / and ther-with-al hire face
Vp on his breste she leyde and lefte speche
His woful spirit from his propre place
Right with þe worde alwey o peynte to pace
And þus she lith with hewes pale and grene
Þat whilom fressh and fairest was to sene
¶ Thus Troilus þat on hire gan biholde
Clepynge hire name and she lay as for dede
With-outen answere and felt hire lymes colde
Hire eyen throwen vpwarde to hire hed
This sorwful man kan now noon other rede
But oft tyme hire cold mouthe he kyste
Wher hym was wo god and hym self it wiste
¶ He rist hym vp and longe streught he hire layde
For signe of lyf for ought he kan or may
Kan he non fynde in no thynge on Criseyde
For which his songe ful oft is walaway
But when he saugh þat specheles she lay
with sorwful vois and herte of blisse al bare
He seyde how she was fro þis worlde y-fare
¶ So efter þat longe hadde hyre compleyned
His hondes wronge and seyde þat was to seye
And with hire teris salt hire breest by-reyned
He gan tho teris wepen of ful dreye
And pitously gan for she soule preye
And seyde o lord þat ert in þi trone
Rew ek on me for I shal folwe hir sone
¶ She colde was and with-outen sentemente
For aught he woot for breth ne felt he non
And þis was hym a preignant argument
Þat she was forth out of þis world a-gone
And when he sey þer was non other wone
He gan hyre lymes dresse in swich manere
As men don hem þat shal be layd on beere
¶ And efter þis with sterne and cruel herte
His swerde anon out of his shethe he twyghte
Hym self to slane how sore þat hym smerte
So þat his soule hire soule folwen myghte
Þer as dome of mynos wold it dighte
Syn loue and cruel fortune it ne wolde
Þat in þis world .he langer lyuen sholde
¶ Than seyde he þus fulfilld of heigh desdayn
O cruel Ioue and thow fortune aduerse
Þis al and som þat falsly haue ye slayn
Criseyde / and syn ȝe may do me no werse
Fy on ȝoure myght and werkes so dyuerse
Þus cowardly ȝe shul me neuere wynne
Ther shal no deth me fro my lady twynne
¶ For I þis world syn ȝe haue slayn hire thus
wol lete and folw hire spirit low or heye
Shal neuere louer seyn That Troilus
Dar not for with his lady dye
For certein I wol bere hire companye
But syn ȝe wol not suffure vs lyues here
Ȝet suffreth þat our soules ben I-feere
¶ And thow cite which þat I lyue in wo
And thow priam and bretheren alle I-fere
And thow moder far wel for I go
and attropes mak redy thow my beere
And thow Criseyde o swete herte deere
Receyue now my spirit wolde he seye
With swerd at herte al redy for to dye
¶ But as god wold of swough ther-with she brayde
And gan to sike and Troilus she cryede
And he answerde lady myn Criseyde
Lyue ȝe ȝit and lete his swerde down glide
Ȝe herte myn þat thanked be cupide
Quod she / and ther-with-al for sighte
And he bigan to glad hire as he myghte
¶ Took hire in armes two and kyste hire ofte
And hire to glade / he dide al his entente
For which hire gooste þat fliked ay o lofte
In-to hire woful herte aȝein it wente
But at þe laste as þat hire eye glente
a syde / anon she gan his swerde aspye
As it lay bare / and gan for feere crie
¶ And asked hym whi he it hadde out drawe
And Troilus a-non / þe cause hire tolde
And how hym self þer-with he wolde han slawe
For which Criseyde vp-on hym gan by-holde
And gan hym in armes faste folde
And seyde o mercy god lo which a dede
Allas how neigh we weren bothe dede
¶ Thanne if I nadde I-spoken as grace was
Ȝe wold han slayn ȝowre-self a-non quod she
Ȝe douteles / and she answarde allas
For by þat ilk lord that made me
I nold a forlonge wey o lyue haue be
After ȝour deth to han ben crowned quene
Of al þat lond þe sonne on shyneth sheene
¶ But with this selue swerde which þat here is
My self I wolde han slayn quod she tho
But hoo for we han right ynowgh of þis
And lat vs rise and streughte to bedde go
And þer lat vs speken of oure wo
For by þe morter which þat I se brenne
Know I ful wel þat day is not fere henne
¶ when they were in hire bedde in armes folde
Naught was it like tho nyghtes here biforn
For pitously ich other gan by-holde
As they þat hadden al hire blisse y-lorn
Bywaylynge ay þe day þat they were borne
Til at þe laste þis sorwful wight Criseyde
To Troilus þis ilke wordis seyde
¶ Loo herte myne wel woot ȝe þis quod she
Þat if a wight alwey his wo compleyne
And seketh naught how holpen for to be
It is but folye and encresse of peyne
And sin þat here assembled be we twyne
To fynde boote of wo þat we ben Inne
It were al tyme soone to bigynne
¶ I am a womman as ful wel ȝe woote
And as I am auysed sodeynly
So wol I telle ȝow whil it is hoote
Me thynketh thus þat noither ȝe nor I
Ought half þis wo to maken skilfully
For þer is art y-nough for to redresse
Þat ȝet is mys and slen þis heuynesse
¶ Soth is þe wo þe wriche þat wo ben Inne
For aught I wot for no thynge elles is
But for þe cause þat we sholden twynne
Considered al þer nys nomore amys
But what is thanne a remade vnto þis
But þat we shape vs soone for to mete
Þis al and som my deere herte I-wis
¶ Now þat I shal wele bryngen it aboute
To com aȝein soon efter þat I go
Ther-of am I no maner thynge in doute
For dredeles with-In a wowke or two
I shal ben here and þat it may be so
By al right / and in a wordes fewe
I shal ȝow wel an heepe of weyes shewe
¶ For which I wol nat mak longe sermon
For tyme I-loste may nought recouered be
But I wol gon to my conclusion
And in þe best in aught þat I kan see
And for þe loue of god forȝeue it me
If I speke aught aȝenis ȝoure hertes reste
For trewely I speke it for þe beste
¶ Makynge alwey a protestacioun
Þat now þis wordes which þat I shal seye
Nys but to shewen ȝowe my mocioun
To fynde vn-to oure help þe beste weye
And taketh it non other-wyse I ȝow preye
For in affecte what so ȝe me comaunde
Þat wol I don for [þat] ys no demaunde
¶ Now herkeneth þis ȝe han wel vnderstonde
My goynge graunted is by parlement
So forforth þat it may not be withtstonde
For al þis world as by my Iugement
And syn ther helpeth non a-uysement
T[o] letten it / lat it passe out of mynde
And lat vs shape a better wey to fynde
¶ The sothe þe twynynge of vs twyne
Wol us disese and crueliche a-noye
But hym bihoueth som tyme han a peyne
Þat serueth loue If þat he wol haue Ioye
And syn I shal no forther out of Troie
Þan I may ride aȝein on half a morwe
It aught lasse causen vs to sorwe
So as I shal not so ben hidde in muwe
Þat day by day myn swete herte deere
Syn wel ȝe wot þat it is now a truwe
Ȝe shal ful wel al myn estate yheere
And er þat truwe is don I shal ben here
And þanne haue ȝe bothe antenor ywonne
and me also / beth glad now if ȝe konne
¶ And thynk right þus Criseyde is now agon
But she shal com hastily aȝein
And when allas bi god lo right a-non
Er dayes ten þis dar I saufly seyne
And þan at erste shal we be so feyne
So as we shal to-gideres euere dwelle
Þat al þis worlde ne myght oure blisse telle
¶ I see that oft tyme ther as we bene now
Þat for þe beste oure conseil for to hide
Ȝe spek not with me nor I with ȝowe
In fourtenyght / ne se ȝow go ne ride
May ȝe nought ten dayes þanne abide
For myn honour in swich an auenture
I wys ȝe mowe elles lite endure
¶ Ȝe knewe eke how þat al my kyn is here
But if þat onlich it my fader be
And myn other thynges al I-feere
And nameliche my deere herte ȝe
whom þat I nolde leuen for to se
For al þis world as wyde as it hath space
Or elles se iche neuere Ioues face
¶ whi trow ȝe my fader in þis wyse
Coueiteth so to se me but for drede
Lest in this town þat folkes me despice
Be cause of hym for his vnhappi dede
what woot my fader what lyf þat I lede
For if he wiste in Troie how wel I fare
Vs neded for my wendynge nought care
¶ Ȝe seen þat euery day ek mor and more
Men trete of pees and It supposed is
Þat men þe queene Eleyne shal restore
And grekes vs restoren þat is mys
So thought þer nere comfort non but this
Þat men purposen pees on euery syde
Ȝe may þe bettre at ese of herte abyde
¶ For if þat it be pees myn herte deere
Þe nature of þe pees moot nedes dryue
Þat men most entrecommunen yfere
And to and fro ek ride and gon as blyue
Alday as thykke as been fleen from an hyue
And euery wight han liberte to bleue
whar as hym liste bet with-outen leue
¶ And though so be þat pees þer may be non
Ȝet hider though ther neuer pees ne weere
I most come / for whider shold I gone
Or how meschaunce sholde I dwelle þere
O-mange þe men of armes euere in feere
For which as wysely god my soule rede
I kan not sen where-of ȝe sholden drede
¶ Haue here a nother wey if it so be
Þat al þis thynge ne may not suffise
My fader as ȝe knowen wele parde
Is old / and elde is ful of coueityse
And I right now haue founden al þe gyse
With-outen net wher-with I shal hym hente
And herkeneth how if þat ȝe wol assente
¶ Loo Troilus men seyne þat ful harde it is
Þe wolf ful and þe wether hoole to haue
Þis is to seyn þat men ful oft y-wis
Moot spenden part þe remenaunte for to saue
For ay with gold men may þe herte graue
Of hym þat set is vp-on coueitise
And how I mene I shal it ȝowe deuyse
¶ Þe moeble which þat I haue in þis town
Vn-to my fader shal I take and seye
Þat right for truste and for sauacioun
It sent is from a frend of his or tweye
Þe which frendes feruentliche hym preye
To sende efter more and þat in heye
Whil þat þis town stante þus in Iupartye
¶ And þat shal ben an huge quantite // i. of golde
Þus shal I seyn / but list it folk aspied
Þis may be sente bi no wight but by me
I shal ek shewen hym if pees betyde
what frendes þat ich haue on euery syde
Towarde þe courte to don the wreth space
Of Priamus / and don hym stonde in grace
¶ So what for o thynge and for other swete
I shal hym so enchaunten with my sawes
Þat right in heuene his soul-is shal he mete
For alle appollo or his clerkes lawes
Or kalkulynge auayleth nought thre hawes
Desire of gold shal so his soule blynde
Þat as me liste I shal wel make an ende
¶ And if he wol aught by his sorte it preue
If that I lye / in certein I shal fynde
Destourben hym and plukke hym by the sleue
Makynge his sort / and beren hym on honde
He hath not wele þe goddes vnderstonde
For goddes speken in amphibelogies
And for a soth they tellen twenty lyes
¶ Ek drede fond firste goddes suppose
thus shal I seyn / and þat his coward herte
Made hym a-mys þe goddes text to glose
When he for ferde out of delphos sterte
And but I make hym soon to conuerte
And don my rede with-Inne a day or tweye
I wol to ȝow oblige me to deye
¶ And treweliche as writen wel I fynde
That al þis thynge was seyde in goode entent
And þat hire herte trewe was and kynde
Towardis hym and spak right as she mente
And þat she for wo neigh when she wente
And was in purpos euere to be trewe
Þus writen they þat of hire werkes knowe
¶ To Troilus with herte and eres spradde
Herd al þis thynge deuysen to and fro
And verliche it semed þat he hadde
The self wit / but to late hire go
His herte mysforȝafe hym euere mo
And finaly he gan his herte wreste
To trusten hire and toke it for þe beste
¶ For which þe grete furye of his penaunce
was queynte with hepe and ther-with hem bytwene
Bygan for Ioye thamarouse daunce
And as the bryddes whan the sonne is shene
Deliten in hire songe in leues grene
Right so þe wordes þat they spak Ifeere
Delites hem and made hire hertes chere
¶ But natheles the wendynge of Criseyde
For al þis world may not out of his mynde
For whiche ful oft he pitously hire preyde
Þat of hire heste he may hire trewe fynde
And seyde hire certes If ȝe be vnkynde
And but ȝe come at day set in-to Troye
Ne shal I neuere haue hele honour ne Ioye
¶ For also soth as sonne vp-rist o morwe
And god so wysely thow me woful wreche
To reste brynge out of þis cruel sorwe
I wol my-seluen sla if þat ȝe drecche
But of my deth / though litel be to recche
Ȝet or þat ȝeue me causen so to smerte
Dwelle rather here myn owen swete herte
¶ For trewely myn owene lady deere
Tho sleightes ȝit þat I haue herde ȝowe steere
Ful shapely ben to faylen alle I-feere
For þus men seith þat oon thynketh þe bere
But al a-nother thynketh his ledere
Ȝour sire is wis / and seyde is out of drede
Men may the wise at-renne and nought atrede
¶ It is ful hard to halten vnspied
Bifor a crepul. for he kan the craft
Ȝoure fader is in sleighte as argus eyed
For al be þat his mooble is hym by-raft
His olde sleighte is ȝit so with hym laft
Ȝe shal nat blynde hym for ȝowre wommanhede
Ne feyne arighte and þat is alle my drede
¶ I not if pees shal euere mo bitide
But pees or no for ernest ne for game
I woot syn calkas on the grekes seyde
Hath oones ben / and lost so foule his name
He dar nomor com here aȝein for shame
For whiche þat wey for aught I kan espye
To trusten on nys but a fantasye
¶ Ȝe shal ek sen ȝour fader shal ȝow glose
To ben a wife / and as he kan wel preche
He shal som greke so preyse and wele alose
Þat rauysshen he shal ȝow with his speche
Or do ȝow don be force as he shal teche
And Troilus of on whom ȝe nyl han routhe
Shal causeles so steruen in his trouthe
¶ And ouer al þis ȝoure fader shal despise
Vs alle / and seyn / þis cite nys but lorne
And þat thassage neuere shal arise
For-why þe grekes han it al sworne
Tyl we be sleyne and down our walles torn
And þus he shal ȝow with his wordes feere
Þat ay drede I þat ȝe wol bleuen theere
¶ Ȝe shal ek seen so many a lusti knyght
O-mange þe grekes ful of worthynesse
And ech of hem with hert wit and myght
To plesen ȝow don alle his bisynesse
Þat ȝe shul dullen of the rudenesse
Of vs cely Troians / but if routhe
Remorde ȝow / or vertu of ȝoure trouthe
¶ And this to me so greuous is to thynke
Þat fro my breeste it wol my soule sende
Ne dredeles in me ther may not synke
A goode opynyoun If þat ȝe wende
For-why ȝoure faderes sleighte wol vs shende
And if ȝe gon as I haue told yore
So thynke I nam but deede with-oute more
¶ For which with humble trewe and pitouse herte
A thousand tyme mercy I ȝow preye
So reweth on myn aspre peynes smerte
And doth somwhat as þat I shal ȝow seye
And lat vs stele awey by-twyxe vs tweye.
And thynke þat foly is when man may cheese
For accident his substaunce ay to lese
¶ I mene þis þat syn we mow or day
wele stele away and ben to-gidere so
what wit were it to putten in assay
In cas ȝe sholdon to ȝoure fader go
If þat ȝe myghten com aȝein or no
Thus mene I that were a grete folye
To puten þat sykernesse in iu-partye
¶ And vulgarly to speken of substaunce
Of tresour may we bothe with vs lede
I-noughe to haue in honour and plesaunce
Til in-to tyme þat we shal be dede
And þus we may esshuen al þis drede
For euery other wey ȝe kan recorde
Myn herte I-wis may þer-with nought a-corde
¶ And hardily ne dredeth no pouerte
For I haue kyn and frendes elles-were
Þat though we comen in oure bare sherte
vs sholde neyther lakken golde ne gere
But ben honoured whil we dwellen there
And go we a-non for as in myn entente
Þis is þe best if þat ȝe wol assente
¶ Cryseyde with a syk ryght in þis wyse
Answerde I-wis my deere herte trewe
we may wel stele a-way as ȝe deuyse
And fynden swich vnthrifty wayes newe
But efterward ful sore it wol vs rewe
And help me god so at my most nede
As causeles ȝe suffren alle this drede
¶ For thylke day þat I for cherisynge
Or drede of fader or of any other wight
Or for estat delit or for weddynge
Be fals to ȝow my Troilus my knyghte
Saturnes doughter Iuno th[r]ough hyre myghte
As wood as athamante do me dwelle
Eternaliche in stix þe put of helle
¶ And þis on euery god celestial
I swere it ȝow / and ek on ech goddesse
On euery Nymphe and deyte infernal
On satury and fawny more and lesse
Þat halue goddes ben of wildernesse
And attropos my thred of lif to-breste
If I be fals now. trowe me if ȝow leste
¶ And thow symoys þat as an arwe clere
Th[r]ough Troye rennest ay downwarde to þe se
Ber witnesse of þis word þat seyde is here
Þat thilke day þat ich vntrewe be
To Troilus myn owen herte fre
Þat thow retourne bakkwarde to thy welle
And I with body and soule synk in helle.
¶ But þat ȝe spek away þus for to go
And letten alle ȝoure frendes god forbede
For any womman þat ȝe sholde so
And namely syn Troye hath now swiche nede
of help and ek of [o] thynge taketh hede
If þis were wist my lif lay in balaunce
And ȝoure honour god shilde vs fro myschaunce
¶ And if so be þat pees here-after take
As alday happeth after anger game
Why lord þe wo and sorwe ȝe wolden make
Þat ȝe ne dorst come aȝeyne for shame
And er þat iu-parten so ȝoure name
Beth nought to hastif in þis hote fare
For hastif man wanthe neuere care
¶ what trow ȝe ek þe peple alle aboute
wold of it seye / it is a ful light tarede
They wolden seye / and swere it oute of doute
Þat loue ne drof ȝow nought to don þis dede
But lust voluptuous and cowarde drede
Thus were al loste I-wis my herte deere
Ȝoure honour which þat now shyneth so cleere
¶ And also thynketh on myn honeste
Þat floureth ȝet how foul I shold it shende
And with what filthe it spotted shold be
If in þis fourme I shold with ȝow wende
And though I lyued vn-to þe worldes ende
My name shold I neuere a-ȝeynwarde wynne
Þus were I lost and þat were routhe and synne
¶ And for-þi sle with reson al þis hete
Men seyn the suffrant ouercometh parde
Ek who-so wol han lief he lyfe moot leete
Thus maketh vertue of necessite
By paciens / and thynke þat lorde is he
Of fortune ay that naught wol of hire reche
And she ne doutheth no wight but o wreche
¶ And trusteth þis þat certes herte swete
Er Phebus suster lucyus the shene
Þe leon .i. signum leonis passe oute of this ariete .i. signum arietis
I wol ben here with-outen any wene
I mene as help me Iuno heuynesse queene
Þe tenthe day but if þat deth messaile
I wol ȝow sen with-outen any fayle
¶ And now so þis be soth quod Troilus
I shal wel suffre vn-to þe tenthe day
Syn that I se þat nede it mot be þus
But for þe loue of god if it be may
So lat vs stele pryuely a-way
For euere in oone as for to lyue in reste
Myn herte seith þat it wol be þe beste
¶ O mercy god what lyfe is þis quod she
Allas ȝe sle me thus for verray tene
I se wel now þat ȝe mystrusten me
For by ȝoure wordes it is wel I-seene
Now for þe loue of cynthia the sheene
Mystruste me naught þus causeles for routhe
Syn to be trew I haue ȝow plyght my trouth
¶ And thynketh wel þat som tyme it is wit
To spende a tyme / a tyme for to wynne
Ne parde lorne am I naught fro ȝow ȝit
Though þat we ben a day or tweye a-twynne
Dryfe oute þe fantasies ȝow fro with-Inne
And trusteþ me and leueth ek ȝoure sorwe
Or here my trouthe I wol nought lyue tyl morwe
¶ For if ȝe wiste how soore it doth me smerte
Ȝe wolde ceese of þis / for god thow wooste
The pure spirit wepeth in myn herte
To se ȝow wepen þat I loue most
And þat I moot gon to þe grekes ost
Ȝe nere it þat I wiste remedye
To com a-ȝeyn right here I wolde dye
¶ But certes I am nought so nyce a wight
Þat I ne kan ymagynen a way
To come a-ȝeyn þat day þat I haue hight
For who may holde a thynge þat wol awey
My fader naught for al his queynte pleye
And by my thrifte my wendynge out of troye
A-nother day shal com vs al to Ioye
¶ For-þi with al myn herte I ȝow beseke
If þat ȝow liste don ought for my preyere
And for þat loue whiche þat I loue ȝow eke
Þat er þat I departe fro ȝow here
Þat of so goode a confort and a chere
I may ȝow sen / þat ȝe may brynge at reste
Myn herte whiche þat is a poynte to breste
¶ And ouer alle þis I preye quod she tho
Myn own herte sothfaste suffisaunce
Syn I am þin alle hole with-outen mo
Þat whil þat I am absente no plesaunce
Of other do me fro ȝoure remembraunce
For I am euere a-gast for-why men rede
Þat loue is thynge ay ful of bysy drede
¶ For in þis worlde ther lyueth lady noon
If þat ȝe were vn-trewe as god defende
Þat so be-traysed were or wo-by-gon
As I þat al trouthe in ȝow entende
And douteles if þat ich other wende
I nere but ded / and er ȝe cause fynde
For goddes loue so beth me nought vnkynde
¶ To þis answerde Troilus and seyde
Now god to whom ther nys no cause ywrye
Me glad / as wis I neuere vnto Cryseyde
Syn thilke day I saugh hire first with eye
Was fals / ne neuer shal tyl þat I deye
At short wordes wele ȝe may me lette
I kan no more it shal be founde at preue
¶ Graunte mercy goode myn I-wis quod she
And blisful venus lat me neuere sterue
Er I may stounde of plesaunce in degre
To quyte hym wel þat so wele kan deserue
And whil þat god my wit wol me conserue
I shal so don so trewe I haue ȝow founde
Þat ay honour to me warde shal rebounde
¶ For trusteth þat ȝoure estat real
Ne veyn delit / nor oonely worthinesse
Of ȝow in werre or tournay marcial
Ne pomp / array / nobley / or ek richsse
Ne made me to rew on ȝoure destresse
But moral virtue grounded vp-on trowthe
Þat was þe cause I firste hadde on ȝow routhe
¶ Eke gentil herte and manhode þat ȝe hadde
And þat ȝe hadde as me thought in despite
Euery thynge þat souned in-to badde
As rudenesse and poeplissh appetite
And þat ȝoure reson brideled ȝoure delite
Þis made abouen euery creature
Þat I was ȝoure and shal whil I may dure
¶ And þis may lenght of ȝeres nought for-do
Ne renuable fortune deface
But Iuppiter þat of his myght may do
Þe sorwful to be glad so ȝeue vs grace
Er nyghtes x. to meten in this place
So þat it may ȝoure herte and myn suffise
And fareth now wel for [tyme is, later, written in margin] þat ȝe rise
¶ And after that they longe ypleyned hadde
And oft kyste and streyte in armes folde
Þe day gan ryse and Troilus hym cladde
and rewfulliche his lady gan by-holde
As he þat felte dethes cares colde
And to hire grace he gan hym to recomaunde
where he was wo þis holde I no demaunde
¶ For mannes hed ymagynen ne kan
Ne mendement considere ne tonge telle
Þe cruel peynes of þis sorwful man
Þat passen euery torment down in helle
For when he saugh þat she ne myght dwelle
whiche þat his soule out of his herte rente
with-outen more out of þe chaumber he wente

HEADNOTE.P: [Leaves 80 and 81 have been cut out of the Cambridge MS.]
[Two leaves, 80 and 81, have been cut out of this MS.]
[Camb. Univ. Libr. MS. Gg. 4. 27, leaf 82.]

LG.L: ¶ Of peril of myn self I schal not lye
Appollo haþ me told sekyrly
I haue ek founde it be astronomye
By sort & be augurye ek trewely
And dar wel seyn þe tyme is faste bye
Þat fer & flaumme on al þe toun schal sprede
And þus schal Troye turne tyl asschyn dede
// ffor serteyn Phebus & Natyinus boþe
Þat madyn alle þe waɫɫ of þe toun
Ben with þe folk of Troye alwoy so wroþe
Þat þey wele bryngyn it to confusioun
Ryȝt in dispit of kyng lameodoun
Be cause he nulde paye hem here here
Þe toun of Troye schal be set on fere
¶ Tellynge his tale alwey þis olde greye
Humbele in his speche & in his tellynge eke
Þe salte terys from his eyȝyn tweye
fful faste ronne doun on eyþer cheke
So longe he gan of mercy hem beseke
Þat for to hele hym of his sorwys sore
Þey ȝaf hym antenore with-outyn more
// But who was glad I-now but calcas þo
And of his þyng his nede ful sone heleyde
On hem þat schulde for þe tretys go
And for antenore ful ofte preyede
To bryngyn hem kyng Toas & Crisseide
And whan priam his saf cundwyt hem sent
Þeem-bassatourys to Troye streyt þey went
¶ Þe cause I-tolde of here comynge olde
Priam þe kyngys fulle sone in general
Gan þere-vp-on his parlement to holde
Of which þe effect rehersyn ȝow I schal
Þe embassadourys ben answerid for fenal
Þe chaunge of presoneris & al þis nede
Hem likiþ wel & forþ in þey procede
¶ Þis Troilus was present In þe place
Whan axed was for Antenore Crisseide
ffor wich ful sone chaunge gan his face
As he þat wel ny with þo wordis deyede
But naþeles [þe corrected] he no word to it seyde
Lest men schulde his effeccioun espye
With mannys herte he gan his sorwe drye
// And ful of anguys & of gresely drede
A-bede what lordis wolde to it seye
And ȝif þey wolde graunte as god forbede
Þe schaunge of hire þanne þouȝte he þyngis tweye
ffyrst to saue hire honour & what weye
He myȝte best þe grauntynge with-stonde
Þis caste he þo how al þis myȝte stonde
¶ Loue hym made al prest to don hire bide
Or raþere deyen þan sche schulde go
But resoun seide hym on þat oþere syde
With-oute asent of hire ne do not so
Lest for þyn werk sche wolde be þynn fo
And seyn þat þour þyn medelyng is I-blowe
Ȝoure boþeis loue þere it was erst onknowe
ffor wich he gan deliberyn for þe beste
Þat þow þe lordis wolde þat sche wente
He wolde let hem graunte what hem leste
And telle his lady fyrst what þat þey mente
And whan þat sche hadde told hym hire entente
Þeraftyr wolde werke also blyþe
Þey al þe world a-ȝen it wolde stryue
¶ Ector with þat wel þe grekis herde
ffor antenor how þey wolde han Criseyde
Gan it withstonde and sobirly answerde
Serys sche is no presoner he seyde
I not on ȝow who þat þis charge [P r later] leyde
But for myn part ȝe may eft sone hem telle
We vsyn here no woman for to selle
¶ Þe noyse of peple vp sterte þanne atonys
As breme as blase of strawe it set on fere
for infortune wolde for þe nonys
Þey schulde here confusioun desire
Ector quod þey what gost may ȝow enspire
Þis woman þus to schide & doun vs lese
Daun antenore a wrong woye now ȝe chese
// Þat is so wis and ek so beld baroun
And we han nede of folk as men may se
He ek is on þe gretteste of þis toun
O Ector let sweche fantasijs be
O king Priam quod þey þus seyde we
Þat oure acord is forto forgon Crisseide
And to delyuere antenore þey preyede
¶ O Iuuenal lord soþ is þyn sentence
Þat litil wetyn folk what is to ȝerne
Þat þey ne fyndyn in here desyr offence
ffor cloude of errour lat hem not desserne
What best is & lo here ensaumpele as ȝerne
Þese folk desiryn now deliberaunce
Of antenor þat brouȝte hem to myschaunce
// ffor he was aftyr tretour to þey toun
Of troye allas þey quyt hym out to raþe
But þus it fel ryȝt in conclusioun
Crisseide wich þat neuere dede hem schaþe
Schal now no lengere in hyre blysse baþe
But antenore he scnal come in to toune
And sche schal out þus seyde here & hounne
¶ ffor wich delyueryd was by a parlement
To ȝilde a-non for Antenore Crisseyde
And it pronounced be þe president
Al-þow þat ector nay ful ofte preyede
But fynally what wit þat it withseyde
It was for nouȝt it muste ben an scholde
ffor substaunce of þe parlement it wolde
¶ DeparTed out of parlemen echon
Þis troylus with-outyn wordis mo
Into his chaubere spede him faste alon
But it were a man of his or too
Þe whiche he dede out faste forto go
Be cause he wolde slepyn as he seyde
And hastely vp on his bed hym leyde
// And as in wyntyr leuys ben beraffte [eraffte corrected]
Eche aftyr oþer tyl þe tre be bare
So þat þere nys but bark & braunch I-laste
Lyth troylus be-raft of eche wel-fare
I-boundyn in þe blak bark of care
Disposid wod out of his wit to breyde
So sore hym sat þe chaungynge of crisseyde
¶ He rist hym vp & euery dore he schette
And wyndowe & / þo þis sorweful man
Vp on his beddys side a-doun hym sette
fful lyk a ded ymage pale & wan
And in his brest þe hepede wo by-gan
Out breste / & he to werkyn on þis wyse
In his distreste as I schal ȝow deuyse
Ryȝt as þe wilde lole gynnyth sprynge
Now here now þere departid to þe herte
And on his deþ ryȝt on compleynynge
Ryȝt so gan he a-boute þe chaumbere sterte
Smytynge his brest ay with his festis smerte
His hed to þe wal his bodi to þe grounde
fful ofte he schop hym selue to confounde
¶ His eyȝen too for pete of herte
So weptyn þat þey semyn weɫɫ tweye
Þerwith þe sobbis of his sorwis smerte
His speche hym rafte vn-neþe myȝte he seye
O deþ allas why nylt þou me to deye
A-cursid he be þat day. with þat nature
Schop me to ben almesse cryature
¶ But aftyr whan al þis furye & al þis rage
Whiche þat his herte twyste & faste þryst
Be lenthe of tyme sumwhat gan a-swage
Vp on his bed he leyde hym doun to rest
But þo be-gunne his teris more out to brest
Þat wel oneþe þe body may suffyse
To half þis wo which þat I ȝow deuyse
// Þanne seyde he þus fortune allas þe while
What haue I don what haue haue I þus agylt
How mayst þu þus for reuthe me begile
Is þere no grace & schal I þus ben spylt
Schal þus Crisseyde allas for þat þou wylt
Allas how mayst þou in þyn herte fynde
To ben to me so crewel & onkynde
¶ Haue I not honoured al myn lyue
As þou wel wost a-bouyn goddis alle
Whi wilt þou þanne of ioye me depriue
O Troylus what may me now þe calle
But wreche of wrechis out of honour falle
In-to myn deþ in which I wele be-wayle
Crisseide allas til þat þe breþ me fayle
// Allas fortune ȝif þat myn lyf in foye
Displesid hadde on-to þyn foule envye
Whi ne haddyst þou myn fadyr kyng of troye
Be-reft þe lyf er þan myne breþeryn deye
Or slayn myn self þat þus compleyne & crye
I combere world þat may of noþyng serue
But alwey deþ & neuere fully sterwe
¶ Ȝif þat Crisseide alone were me left
Nouȝt rouȝte I whedyr þat þou woldist me stere
And hire allas þanne hast þou me be-reft
But eueremore lo þis is þyn manere
To reue which þat most is to hym dere
To preue in þat þyn gery violence
Þus am I lost þere helpyth non defence
O werray loue o lord o god allas
Þat knowyn best myn herte & al myn þouȝt
How schal myn reuful lyf don in þis cas
Ȝif I forgo þat I so dere haue bouȝt
Syn ȝe Crisseyde & [1 m corrected] me han fully brouȝt
In to ȝoure grace & boþe ȝoure hertys selid
How may ȝe sufferyn þat it be repelyd
// What schal I don I schal whil I may deure
In wo in turnement & in crewel peyne
Þis infortune or þis mys-auenture
Alone as I was born allas compleyne
Ne neuere whil I it sen schyne or reyne
Ne heuenys lyȝt & þus I in derknes
Myn woful lyf wele endyn for distresse
¶ O werray gost þat erryst to & fro
Whi nylt þou fle out of þyn wofullest //
Body þat myȝte on grounde go
O soule lurkynge in þis wonest
ffle forþ a-non & do myn herte brest
[1, 307-322, by corrector] And folwe alwoy crisseyde thyn lady deere
Thyn righte place is no lengere here
// What shulde ye don but for myn disconfort
Stondyn for nought & wepyn out ȝoure ye
Syn sche is queynt that wont was yow to disport
In vayn from this forth have I seyn twye
I for medycyn youre vertu is a-weye
O crewel eyen sythyn that youre dispyt
Was al to sen Crisseydes eyen bryght
¶ O myn Crisseyde / o lady souereyne
O ye ilke woful soule that thus crieth
Ho shal now yeuyn confort to myn peyne
Allas not but whan myn herte deyeth
Myn spyrit which that so on-to you hyeth
Resseyve in gre for that shal euere serve
ffor-thy no fors whan that the body sterve [1. 307-322, by corrector]
¶ O ȝe loueris þat hey vp on þe whe corrected whel
Ben set of fortune in good auenture
God leue ay þat ȝe fynde loue stel
And longe mote ȝe in ioye endeure
And whan ȝe comyn to myn sepulture
Re-membrith þat ȝoure felawe restyþ þere
ffor I loued ek þow I onworþy were
// O olde onholsom & mysbeleuyd man
Calcas I mene allas what aylyth þe
To ben a grek syn þou art born troyan
O calcas wych þat wilt myn bane be
In cursed tyme was þou born for me
As wolde blysful ioue for his ioye
Þat I þe hadde where I wolde in troye
¶ An hunderid sikys hottere þan þe glede
Out of his bryst eche aftyr oþer went
Medelid with pleyntis newe his wo to fede
Þerwith his woful teris neuere stent
And schortly so his sorwis so to-rent
And wex so mate þat ioye nor penaunce
He felyth non but lyth forth in a trau[n]ce
// Pandarus which þat in þe parlement
Hadde herd what euery lord & borwis seyde
And how ful grauntid was by on asent
for antenore to chaungyn so crisseyde
Gan wel ny wod out of his 1 wit to breyde 1 [1-1 corrected, and then yde alterd to nt]
So þat for wo he nyste what he mente
But in a res to troylus he wente
¶ A certeyn knyght [first, knyt] þat for þe tyme kepte
Þe chaumbere dore vndyr hym a-non
And Pandarus þat ful tenderely wepte
In to þis derke chaumbere stylle as ston
Toward þe bed gan softely to gon
So confeus þat he nyste what to seye
ffor werray wo his wit was al aweye
¶ But with his chere & lokyng al to-torne
Ny ded [MS. dede] for wo & with his armys foldyn
He stod þis sorweful Troilus a-forne
And on his pitous face he gan be-holden
And lord so oftyn gan his herte coldyn
Seinge his frend In woo whos heuynesse
His herte slow as þouȝte hym for distresse
Þis woful wiȝt þis troylus þat felt
His frend Pandarus was comyn him to se
Gan as þe snow a-ȝen þe sunne to melt
ffor which þis sorweful Pandarus of pete
Gan for to wepe as entirely as he
And specheles þus ben þese ilke tweye
Þat neyþer myȝte a word for sorwe seye
¶ But at þe laste þis woful Troilus
ffor crewel smert gan brestyn out to rore
And with sorweful noyse he seyde þus
Among his sobbis & his sowis [w corrected] sore
Lo Pandare I am ded with-oute more
Hast þow not herd at parlement he seyde
ffor antenore how lost is myn Crisseyde
// Þis pandarus ful ded & pale of hew
fful pittously / answerde & seyde þus
As wisely were it fals at it is trewe
Þat I haue herd we wote alle how it is
O mercy lord ho wolde a trowid þis
Who wolde a went þat in so lytil a þrowe
ffortune oure ioye wolde han ouer-throwe
¶ O in þis world þere nys no cryature
As to myn dom þat euere sau ruyne
Strengere þan þis þour cas or auenture
But who may al eschewe or al deuyne
Wich is þis world forþy I þus defyne
Ne trust ne wit to fyndyn in fortune
Ay properete his ȝiftys [s corrected from n] ben comune
¶ But telle me þis whi þu art now so mad
To sorewe þus whi lyst þou in þis wise
Syn þyn desyr al holly hast þou had
So þat be ryȝt It auȝte I-now suffyse
But I þat neuere fond in myn seruyse
A frendely cher or schaungyng of an eye
Lat me þus wepe & wayle wil I deye
// And oueral þis as þow wel wost þyn selue
Þis toun is ful of ladijs al aboute
And to myn dom fayrere þan sweche tweine
As euere sche was schal I fynde in a route
Ȝa to or þre with-outyn ony doute
ffor-þy be glad myn owene dere broþer
Ȝif sche be lost we schal rekeuere a noþer
¶ What god forbede alwoy þat eche plesaunce
In o þyng were & in non oþer wiȝt
What on can synge a noþer can wel daunce
Ȝif þis is fayr sche þat can good & ryȝt
Ȝif þis is goodly þat is glad & lyȝt
Iche for his vertu holdyn is for dere
Boþe 2 Goshauk 2 [2-2 by corrector] / & facoun of reuere
// And ek as writ ȝanȝis þat was ful wise
Þe newe loue out schakyth ofte þe olde
And vp-on newe cas lyth a newe auyse
And þyng þyn lyf to saue or þou olde
Swich fyre be proces schal be kynde colde
We schal sen it. is but aunsel plesaunce
Sum cas schal putte it out of remembrance
¶ ffor al so seur as day comyth aftyr nyȝt
Þe newe loue labour or oþer wo
Or eɫɫ selde seinge of a wyȝt
Don olde effecciounys alle ouergo
And for þi parte þou schat have on of tho
To abregge þynne bittere peynys smerte
Absence of hire schal dryue it out of herte
¶ Þese wordis seyde he for þe nonys alle
To helpe his frend lest he for sorwe deyede
ffor douteles to make his sorwe to falle
He rouȝte not what onþryft þat he seyde
But troylus þat ny for sorwe deyede
Tok lytyl hed of al þat euere he ment
On ere it herde at þe oþer out it went
// But at þe laste he answerde & seyde frend
Þis lechecraft or helid þus to be
Were wel sittynge ȝif þat I were a frend
To trostyn hire þat trowis on to me
I preye god lat þis conseyl neuere be
But do me raþere sterue a-non ryȝt here
Or I do as þou woldyst me lere
¶ Sche þat I serue I-wis what so þou seye
To whom myn herte enabitid is þour ryȝt
Schal ha me holy his þat I deye
What pandarus seþ I haue here be-hyȝt
I wele not ben ontrewe to no wyȝt
But as hire man I wele ay leue & sterue
And neuere oþer cryature serue
// And þere þou seyst þou schat as fayre fynde
As sche let be mak non comparisoun
To criateure I-formyd hire be kynde
O leue Pandarus lef þyn conclusioun
I nyl not ben of þyn opynyoun
To chonge þus for-þi I þe beseche
So held þyn pes þou slest me with þyn speche
¶ Þou biddyst me I schulde loue anoþer
Al fresschely newe & lete crysseyde go
It leyth not in myn power leue broþer
And þow I myȝte I nulde not don so
But canstu pleye raket to & fro
Nettil in dokke out now þis now þat pandare
Now foule falle hire for þyn wo þat care
¶ Þow farst ek by me pandarus
As he þat whan a man is wo-be-gon
He come to him a pas & seyde þus
Þynke not on smert & þou schat fele non
Þu muste me fyrst transmute in to a ston
And reue me mynne pasciounys alle
Or þow so lyȝtely do myn wo to falle
// Myn deþ may wel out of myn brest departe
Þe lyf so longe may myn sorwe myne
But fro myn soule schal crisseid darte
Out neueremo but out with proserpyne
Whan I am ded I wele go wene in peyne
And þere I wele eternally compleyne
Þis wo / & þanne tweynnyd be we tweyne
¶ Þou hast here mad an argument ful fyne
How þat I schulde allas pleyne me
Crisseyde for to forgon for sche was myn
And lyuyn in ese & in felicite
Whi gabbist þou þou seydist þus to me
Þat him is wers þat is from wele I-þrowe
Þan he hadde erst non of þat wele I-knowe
// But sey me þis sithe þat þe þynkith so lyȝt
To chau[n]ge ay so in loue to & fro
Why hast þou not busyed þyn myȝt
To chongyn hire þat doþ þe al þis wo
Why nylt þou lette hire from þyn herte go
Why nylt þou loue a noþer lady swete
Þat may þyn herte sette / in quyete
¶ Ȝif þou hast had in loue ay ȝit myschaunce
And canst it not ȝit from þyn herte dryf
I þat hauede in loue & in plesaunce
With hire as meche as cryatour on lyf
How schulde I þat forȝete & þat so blyf
Or where hast þou ben hid so longe in mewe
Þat canst so wel & formaly argewe
¶ Nay Pandarus not worth is al þis red
But douteles for ouȝt þat may be-falle
With-outyn wordis mo I wele ben ded
O deþ þat ender art of sorwis alle
Come now syn I so ofte aftyr þe calle
ffor sely is þat deþ soþ for to seyn
Þat ofte I-clepid comyþ & endith peyn
// Wel I wot whil myn lyf was in quiete
Or deþ me slow I wolde a ȝeuyn here
But now his comynge is to me so swete
Þat in þis world I noþyng so desyre
O deþ sith þat with þis sorwe I am onfere
Þou oþer do me a-non in teris drenche
Or with pyn colde strok myn herte quenche
¶ Sithe þat þou slest so fele in sundery wyse
A-ȝens here wil onpreyed day & nyȝt
Do me at myn request þis seruyse
Delyuere þe world þan dost þou gret ryȝt
Of me þat am þe wofuleste wyȝt
Þat euere was for tyme is þat I sterwe
Sithe in þis world of ryȝt nouȝt may I serue
// Þis Troilus in teris gan distille
As licour out of a lambik ful faste
And Pandarus gan helde his tunge stylle
And to þe ground his eyȝeyn doun he cast
But na-þe-les þus þouȝte he at þe last
What parde raþere þan my felawe deye
Ȝit schal I more / sumwhat to hym seye
¶ And seyde frend syn þow hast swich distresse
And sithe þe lust myn argument to blame
Whi nylt þyn selue helpe to don redresse
And with þyn manhod lettyn al þis grame
Go rauysch hire canst þou not for schame
And oþer lat hire of þe toun fare
Or hold hire stylle & lef þyn grete care
¶ Art þou in troye & hast þou none hardy men
A woman wich þat louyth þe
